Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops unilateral strength and metabolic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other knee slightly bent off the ground.
2. Place hands on the floor and kick the free leg back into a single-leg plank.
3. Jump the foot forward to land on the same supporting leg.
4. Explode upward into a single-leg hop and land softly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases explosive leg power and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a standing lunge with one foot forward and one back.
2. Explode upward and switch leg positions in mid-air so the rear leg moves forward.
3. Land softly in a stable lunge and immediately prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Drive from the hips and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Builds lateral power and quick change of direction ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and weight centered.
2. Push explosively laterally off the support foot and cover distance to land on the opposite leg.
3. Absorb the landing with a soft knee bend and immediately bound back.
Safety cue: Bound explosively and absorb the landing with bent knees to control lateral momentum

Health benefit: Enhances muscular endurance and lower body joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands by your sides.
2. Drop quickly into a deep squat while keeping chest lifted.
3. Push through the toes and drive up while swinging the arms forward.
4. Maintain a steady, rhythmic pace for high repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted, use a steady tempo, and breathe evenly through each rep

Health benefit: Enhances explosive lower-body power and vertical reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall two to three feet away with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend your knees and swing your arms back to load power.
3. Jump explosively and reach overhead to touch the wall.
4. Land softly on both feet and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and core engaged

Health benefit: Increases upper-body power and reactive pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Lower your chest to the floor with a controlled descent.
3. Explode upward with force to lift your hands off the ground.
4. Land with slightly bent elbows and immediately lower into the next rep.
Safety cue: Control the descent and keep a tight core and straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Improves leg power balance and dynamic hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step into a deep lunge with one foot forward.
2. Drive through the front heel and explode upward.
3. Switch legs in midair so the rear leg lands forward.
4. Land softly into the opposite lunge and continue the sequence.
Safety cue: Land softly with front knee aligned over the ankle and torso upright

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg explosiveness and proprioceptive balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the knee slightly bent and core engaged.
2. Jump upward and tuck the free knee toward your chest.
3. Land softly on the same leg and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and land softly on the same foot with a slight knee bend

Health benefit: Develops rapid ankle and calf power and reactive coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on both knees with chest upright and hands by your sides.
2. Place hands on the floor beside your hips and load the arms.
3. Swing your arms and explode upward to land on your feet.
4. Absorb the impact with soft knees and return to kneeling if repeating.
Safety cue: Explode with the hips while keeping a neutral spine and land with knees soft

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength while promoting trunk mobility and control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended forward and arms out.
2. Lower into a single-leg squat with chest upright and controlled descent.
3. Rotate your torso toward the supporting leg at the bottom.
4. Drive through the heel to stand and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances acceleration mechanics and short distance speed
Steps to perform:
1. Set up in a staggered split stance with one foot forward and one back.
2. Lean forward slightly over the front foot and load the hips.
3. Drive explosively off the back foot into a forward sprint.
4. Pump your arms and accelerate into full speed.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves full-body coordination and shoulder and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet close to a wall and hands on the floor.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while simultaneously walking your hands toward the wall.
3. Reach a comfortable inverted position with hips over shoulders.
4. Walk your hands away and lower your feet down the wall to return to plank.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and core braced as you move along the wall

Health benefit: Increases rotational power and core force production
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a medicine ball overhead.
2. Brace your core and swing the ball down forcefully toward the ground.
3. Follow the ball with both hands and simulate a full slam motion.
4. Catch the ball or pick it up and reset for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power hip stability and change of direction ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and push off laterally with the other leg.
2. Leap sideways as far as possible and land on the opposite leg.
3. Absorb the landing with a bent knee and immediately push back into the next jump.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat on your back with legs extended and hands under your glutes.
2. Raise both legs together until they are perpendicular to the floor.
3. Lower your legs slowly toward the floor with control without arching your lower back.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom and then raise your legs back up.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and lift the legs with control

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped out to the sides.
2. Hold your feet with your hands and sit tall through your spine.
3. Press your knees gently toward the floor using your elbows.
4. Hinge forward from the hips to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall and bring chest toward your thighs to keep the spine long

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity and promotes hip flexor mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift one knee up toward hip height while swinging the opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the leg and immediately lift the other knee to the same height.
4. Continue alternating knees at a steady, marching tempo.
Safety cue: Drive knees up with a tall chest and engaged core

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your hand.
2. Keep the bottom leg slightly bent and the top leg straight.
3. Lift the top leg upward in a controlled motion to hip height.
4. Lower the top leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the top leg with controlled movement

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances functional movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to descend into a deep squat.
3. Keep your chest up and lower until your hips drop below knee level.
4. Drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.
Safety cue: Sit hips back and down with chest up and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Targets gluteal flexibility and relieves hip tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with one ankle crossed over the opposite thigh to form a figure-4.
2. Keep your back straight and hold the shin or ankle of the crossed leg.
3. Draw your chest toward the raised leg to increase the stretch.
4. Hold, then switch sides and repeat the steps.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright spine and hinge from the hips as you lean forward

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and trunk forward mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach toward your toes with straight or slightly bent knees.
3. Hold briefly at the bottom, then roll up through your spine to stand tall.
4. Repeat the hinge and reach for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a soft knee and lead the movement with your chest

Health benefit: Gently mobilizes lower back and increases hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs extended and arms by your sides.
2. Bend one knee and pull it toward your chest using both hands.
3. Hold the knee to your chest while keeping the other leg extended.
4. Release and switch legs, repeating the pull on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances hip joint mobility and prepares muscles for activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands on your hips.
2. Shift your weight slightly and begin making large circular motions with your hips.
3. Maintain a steady rhythm as you complete several circles in one direction.
4. Reverse the direction and repeat the same number of circles.
Safety cue: Stabilize through the core and move the hip smoothly through full circles

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and strengthens hip flexor muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your glutes and legs extended.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor and point your toes.
3. Perform large alternating kicks by raising one leg while lowering the other.
4. Maintain steady tempo and controlled range of motion throughout.
Safety cue: Press the lower back to the floor and use slow controlled kicks from the hips

Health benefit: Improves unilateral leg strength and balance while enhancing functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step forward with the right foot and lower until both knees bend.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat on the opposite leg and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core braced while the front knee tracks over the ankle

Health benefit: Promotes hip external rotation and seated flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and bring the soles of the feet together.
2. Draw the heels toward the groin and lengthen the spine.
3. Rest the hands on the feet and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and draw the shoulders down away from the ears

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps and glute strength while challenging cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy elevated platform with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step onto the platform with the right foot and press through the heel to lift the body.
3. Place the left foot fully on the platform and stand tall.
4. Step down leading with the left foot and repeat, alternating the leading leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip stability and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Take a slow controlled step to the right followed by the left foot.
3. Reverse the movement and shuffle slowly to the left.
Safety cue: Stay low with knees bent and take small, controlled steps while keeping hips square

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and spinal alignment through contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend the right arm forward and the left leg straight back until fully aligned.
3. Hold the extended position briefly while keeping hips level.
4. Return to start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Reach the opposite arm and leg fully while keeping hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold onto a stable support for balance.
2. Lift the right leg out to the side with a controlled motion and toes forward.
3. Lower the leg slowly and repeat, then switch to the left leg.
Safety cue: Stand tall with the standing hip stacked and lift the leg with control without leaning

Health benefit: Challenges lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under the hips and legs a few inches above the floor.
2. Lift the right leg slightly higher while lowering the left leg toward the floor.
3. Cross the legs by swapping positions in a scissoring motion with control.
4. Continue alternating legs while keeping the lower back pressed to the mat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and relaxation of the lower back and hips
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on the heels with knees wide apart.
2. Reach the arms forward and fold the torso down between the thighs.
3. Rest the forehead on the mat and relax the arms.
Safety cue: Soften the hips and lengthen the spine while breathing deeply and relaxing the shoulders

Health benefit: Combines core endurance with shoulder stability and hip drive in controlled movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank position with hands under the shoulders.
2. Drive the right knee toward the chest slowly while keeping the hips level.
3. Return the right foot to plank and bring the left knee toward the chest slowly.
4. Continue alternating legs at a controlled slow tempo.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and promotes awareness of flexion and extension
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Inhale and drop the belly while lifting the tailbone and chest into a deep arch.
3. Exhale and round the spine while tucking the chin and pelvis into a pronounced curve.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and improves hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until shoulders, hips and knees form a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping hips facing forward and arms at chest height.
3. Rotate to the left with control and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Anchor your hips and rotate from the thoracic spine with control

Health benefit: Improves internal hip mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Let both knees slowly fall inward toward each other while keeping your pelvis level.
3. Draw your knees back to center with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the internal rotation and keep the knee tracking over the foot

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a deep squat.
3. Keep your chest upright and press your knees outward over your toes.
4. Drive through your heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes, sit back into the hips and keep your chest upright

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left leg.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back to grasp your right ankle.
3. Pull your heel toward your glute while keeping knees together and chest upright.
Safety cue: Stand tall, pull the heel toward the glute and tuck the pelvis slightly

Health benefit: Opens chest and improves shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on the floor with arms extended out to the sides in a T.
2. Press your palms into the floor and lift your chest slightly.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together to open your chest.
4. Lower your chest back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and retract the shoulder blades while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Strengthens lower back and glute endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and hips square to the floor.
2. Lift one leg a few inches off the floor while keeping the knee straight and hips stable.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square to the floor and lift and lower the leg with control

Health benefit: Raises heart rate and enhances lower body power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward while driving your right knee up toward chest height.
2. Land lightly on the ball of your foot and immediately drive the left knee up on the next step.
3. Continue alternating knees at a steady, controlled rhythm while pumping your arms.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso, drive the knees up with controlled tempo and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Improves core stability and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and legs lifted in a full extension.
2. Slowly lower your right arm overhead while extending your left leg toward the floor without letting your lower back arch.
3. Return your arm and leg to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite side and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip control and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a step or raised surface with your left foot and let your right foot hang off the edge.
2. Drop your right hip down by lowering the hanging side without bending the standing knee.
3. Contract the standing-side muscles to hike the right hip upward and return to the drop position.
Safety cue: Keep the torso tall and perform the hip hike with slow controlled movement without leaning

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and dynamic movement preparation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall next to a support and place weight on the opposite foot.
2. Swing the free leg side to side in a controlled arc across your body.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged throughout the swings.
4. Control each swing and use the support if you lose balance.
Safety cue: Swing from the hip with a braced core

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands resting on the sides.
2. Extend one leg forward until the knee is straight and the foot flexes.
3. Hold briefly while squeezing the front thigh.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the seat and extend the leg in a controlled tempo

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and cross the right ankle over the left thigh near the knee.
2. Reach hands behind the left thigh and pull the left leg gently toward your chest.
3. Keep both hips level and maintain steady breathing.
4. Hold the position, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Square your hips forward as you ease into the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances core activation and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank on your knees with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest with controlled motion.
3. Return the foot to the plank position with control.
4. Alternate knees while keeping hips stable and shoulders square.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine while driving the knee with control

Health benefit: Develops hip abductor strength and frontal plane mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands at your hips.
2. Step wide to the side and bend the lead knee deeply while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Push through the lead heel to return to the starting stance.
4. Repeat the lunge to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit back into the hips and keep your chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and reactive balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight athletic squat with weight on one leg.
2. Push off laterally and land on the opposite foot with a soft knee bend.
3. Swing the trailing leg behind and touch the floor with the opposite hand.
4. Continue moving side to side with quick, controlled bounds.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control the lateral reach

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from a bench and place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
2. Lower your back knee toward the floor by bending the front knee until the front thigh is near parallel.
3. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
4. Switch legs and repeat the movement on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep your torso upright and lower with steady control

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and coordination for aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump your feet out to shoulder-width while raising your arms overhead.
3. Jump your feet back together while lowering your arms to your sides.
4. Continue the jumps at a steady, rhythmic pace.
Safety cue: Land softly through the balls of your feet with knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and lateral muscle strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and toes slightly turned out.
2. Shift weight to one side and bend that knee deeply while keeping the other leg straight and toes pointing up.
3. Keep your chest upright and sit back into the bent hip.
4. Push through the bent heel to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and legs together.
2. Engage your core and lift your legs forward until they reach hip height or higher.
3. Lower your legs slowly back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lift the legs with slow controlled motion avoiding swing

Health benefit: Improves core strength and abdominal muscle coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Engage your core and lift both legs and upper body simultaneously.
3. Reach your hands toward your feet, forming a V shape.
4. Lower with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip stability and glute strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or at chest.
2. Step one leg diagonally behind and across the standing leg.
3. Lower your hips until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest up hips square and step diagonally while controlling knee alignment over toes

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides.
2. Step one foot straight back and plant the toes.
3. Lower into a deep lunge until both knees are bent around 90 degrees.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves eccentric quadriceps control and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a sturdy box or step with both feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and hinge at the hips.
3. Slowly lower the opposite foot to the floor with control.
4. Push through the standing foot to step back up onto the box.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates hip abductors and enhances gluteal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep the knee bent and lift one leg out to the side to hip height.
3. Lower the leg back with control and repeat for reps before switching sides.
Safety cue: Keep your pelvis stable and move only at the hip joint with slow controlled reps

Health benefit: Combines upper body strength with core rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest toward the ground while bringing one knee to the same-side elbow.
3. Push back up to plank while returning the leg to the start position.
4. Alternate sides with each repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts explosive lower body power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders.
2. Jump both feet forward toward your hands landing in a low squat.
3. Immediately jump feet back to the plank position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and hamstring flexibility while engaging core
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms extended to the sides.
2. Rotate your torso and hinge at the hips to reach one hand toward the opposite foot.
3. Keep the opposite arm extended overhead and gaze toward the raised hand.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves posterior chain balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, foot flat, and the other leg extended straight.
2. Press through the heel of the bent leg and squeeze the glute to lift hips.
3. Keep the extended leg in line with your torso at the top.
4. Lower hips down with control and repeat before switching legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and elevates heart rate for conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and core engaged.
2. Jump both feet out wide while maintaining a straight body line.
3. Jump feet back together and continue at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Extend top arm and top leg upward into a star shape.
4. Hold the position for the desired time and keep the body steady.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over hips and keep hips lifted in the side plank

Health benefit: Builds core strength and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift knees a few inches off the floor.
2. Move right hand and left foot forward a short step.
3. Follow by moving left hand and right foot forward.
4. Continue crawling forward with controlled, low-hip motion.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move each step with slow, controlled contact

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and leg speed
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and drive one knee up explosively toward the chest.
2. Quickly switch legs, pumping arms for speed.
3. Sprint in place or forward with fast high-knee repetitions.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and breathe rhythmically while driving knees high

Health benefit: Develops explosive hip extension and glute power
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hips over knees.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling explosively, squeezing the glute.
3. Return the foot under control to the starting position.
4. Repeat for reps then switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Brace your core and drive through the glute without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and rotational core mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward into a lunge with the right foot.
2. Lower hips until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg and hold briefly.
4. Push through the front heel to stand and step forward with the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the ankle and rotate the torso in control

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and shoulder stability while engaging the core
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge forward to touch the toes.
2. Walk hands forward into a high plank while keeping legs as straight as possible.
3. Walk hands back toward feet and roll up to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases lower body muscular endurance and time under tension
Steps to perform:
1. Step back into a reverse lunge and lower into a shallow position.
2. Pulse up and down with small controlled movements in the lowered lunge.
3. Complete the set for one leg then switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Pulse from the hips with the front knee tracking over the second toe

Health benefit: Targets obliques and promotes dynamic core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and raise one knee toward the same-side elbow.
2. Bend and rotate the torso to bring the elbow toward the knee.
3. Return to standing and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Stand tall, brace your core, and lead the movement by bringing elbow to knee

Health benefit: Improves hip internal and external mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one shin in front and the other behind, both at 90 degrees.
2. Place hands on the floor for balance and lift hips slightly.
3. Rotate hips to switch leg positions so the opposite shin comes forward.
4. Repeat the switch rhythmically while keeping an upright chest.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and switch hips with slow, controlled motion

Health benefit: Combines cardiovascular conditioning with lower body power and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands at chest level.
2. Jump feet out wider than shoulder-width while lowering into a squat.
3. Jump feet back together and stand tall to complete one rep.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, land softly, and ensure knees track over your toes

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and enhances core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and weight evenly distributed.
2. Lift one knee slightly and trace a controlled circle with the hip, moving outward then back under the body.
3. Reverse the direction after several circles and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while making slow controlled hip circles

Health benefit: Builds lateral leg strength and improves single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways to a high box with one foot planted on the box and the other on the floor.
2. Push through the foot on the box to drive your hips up and bring the trailing foot onto the box.
3. Step down laterally with the trailing foot in a controlled motion.
4. Repeat for reps and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral explosiveness and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight knee bend and arms relaxed.
2. Push off laterally and land softly on the opposite foot while swinging your arms for momentum.
3. Absorb the landing with a bent knee and immediately push back to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and torso stable to absorb each hop

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift your shoulders and twist to bring one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg.
3. Switch sides in a smooth pedaling motion.
4. Maintain controlled tempo and keep the neck relaxed.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hinge at the hips.
2. Lower your torso forward while extending the free leg straight behind and keeping your back flat.
3. Reach toward the floor with your hands and feel the stretch in the standing hamstring.
4. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glute to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and quadriceps strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned slightly out.
2. Drop hips down into a deep squat and press your elbows to your inner knees to open the hips.
3. Push through your heels to rise slightly and repeat the deep squat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with hands placed behind your hips and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift your hips into a tabletop position so your torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Step one hand and the opposite foot outward to move sideways while keeping hips elevated.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted, core engaged and shoulders stable while taking controlled steps

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended straight in front and arms out for balance.
2. Push your hips back and slowly lower into a deep single-leg squat while keeping the extended leg off the floor.
3. Keep your chest up and reach your arms forward for balance as you descend.
4. Drive through the heel to stand back up with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg mobility and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and step one foot far back and diagonally behind the standing leg.
2. Bend the front knee and sink into a deep squat while the back toe lightly taps the floor.
3. Keep your chest upright and reach your hands forward for balance.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall chest and hinge at the hips, moving slowly to protect knee alignment

Health benefit: Improves lower body power and explosive jumping ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width and soft knees.
2. Swing your arms back and then explosively swing them up as you jump onto the box, landing with both feet.
3. Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back.
4. Step down one foot at a time before repeating.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and land softly with knees bent and aligned over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances explosive lower body power and leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width apart and brace your core.
2. Sit back and lower into a deep squat until thighs are below parallel.
3. Explode upward into a vertical jump using arms for momentum.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and descend immediately into a deep squat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest tall

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg power and improves balance during dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge with one foot forward and the other back.
2. Lower until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Explode upward and switch legs in midair so the opposite foot lands forward.
4. Land softly and absorb the impact by bending both knees into a lunge.
Safety cue: Keep torso tall and front knee tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Boosts full body conditioning and cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the floor in front of you.
3. Kick your feet back to a plank and perform a full push-up.
4. Jump your feet forward under your hips and explode up into a jump.
Safety cue: Brace your core and control the transition between floor and standing

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and enhances knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a light support if needed.
2. Rise onto your toes and lean your torso back while keeping knees forward.
3. Lower your knees forward as you descend, keeping the chest upright.
4. Push through your toes and extend the knees to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and lower slowly with controlled knee tracking

Health benefit: Increases vertical jump power and plyometric explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and bend slightly at the knees.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward while driving your knees toward your chest.
3. Tuck both knees up tightly at the peak of the jump.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips and knees absorbing impact and brace your core

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and grab the ankle of the opposite leg behind you.
2. Keep the chest up and the standing knee slightly bent.
3. Lower your hips toward the heel of the standing leg until you reach depth.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and chest upright while lowering with control

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and reactive lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Descend into a shallow squat loading your hips and arms.
3. Explode upward and rotate your body 180 degrees in the air.
4. Land softly into a squat facing the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Spot the landing, rotate explosively, and land softly with knees over toes

Health benefit: Enhances horizontal power and long jump explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips.
2. Swing your arms back while bending the knees slightly.
3. Explode forward as far as possible, driving through the hips and arms.
4. Land softly with knees bent and reset for the next jump.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and land in a soft forward squat absorbing the impact

Health benefit: Develops unilateral explosiveness and landing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg a short distance from a sturdy box.
2. Bend the standing knee and swing your arms back for momentum.
3. Explode up and jump onto the box, landing on the same leg.
4. Step down carefully and repeat on the same leg or switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Combines mobility and posterior chain strength under controlled descent
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drop to your knees and sit back toward your heels, lowering your torso.
3. Roll your chest forward and place your hands on the floor to sweep your knees under.
4. Push through hands and feet to stand back up.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves unilateral leg power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lower into a lunge and explode upward while switching legs mid-air.
3. Land softly in a lunge with the opposite leg forward.
4. Repeat by jumping and switching legs each rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips square and front knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands on parallel bars or on the floor beside your hips.
2. Press down through your hands to lift your hips off the ground.
3. Extend both legs straight out in front to form an L shape.
4. Hold the position for the desired time while keeping your core tight.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders depressed and spine tall while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and spinal control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground into a hollow shape.
3. Rock back and forth using a tight core while maintaining the hollow position.
Safety cue: Maintain a flattened lower back with steady diaphragmatic breathing

Health benefit: Develops lower-body muscular endurance and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands clasped behind your head or extended forward.
2. Sink down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back while keeping your chest up.
3. Drive through the balls of your feet to rise and perform a slight rebound or jump at the top.
Safety cue: Drive through the midfoot, keep chest lifted and control the descent

Health benefit: Improves lateral explosiveness and single-leg coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat on one leg with the other leg slightly lifted.
2. Push off explosively to the side, swinging your arms for momentum.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot with a bent knee and stabilize quickly.
Safety cue: Absorb laterally with a soft knee and keep hips level

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg strength and overall conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg with the other leg lifted slightly.
2. Place your hands on the floor and kick the free leg back into a plank while keeping one foot off the ground.
3. Perform a push-up or chest tap, then jump the supporting foot forward toward your hands.
4. Explode up into a jump on the same supporting leg or switch legs for the next rep.
Safety cue: Control the descent with a braced core and land softly on the working leg

Health benefit: Trains explosive hip extension and rapid force development
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on both knees with an upright torso.
2. Explode upward by driving through your hips and swinging your arms to propel yourself to standing.
3. Land softly on both feet with knees slightly bent and return smoothly to kneeling for the next rep.
Safety cue: Explode upward while landing quietly with hips stacked over ankles

Health benefit: Enhances reactive lower-body power and plyometric responsiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a sturdy box or platform with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Step off the box and land softly on both feet while immediately absorbing the impact with bent knees.
3. Explode upward as quickly as possible into a vertical jump.
4. Step back onto the box or reset before the next rep.
Safety cue: Step off controlled and absorb impact through flexed hips and knees

Health benefit: Increases lateral power and horizontal force production
Steps to perform:
1. Start on one foot with a slight knee bend and hips back.
2. Push off laterally as hard as possible to cover maximum distance.
3. Land on the opposite foot softly with a bent knee and stabilize quickly.
4. Repeat by bounding back to the original side.
Safety cue: Focus on controlled cushioned landings and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves alternating leg explosive power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back.
2. Lower into a shallow lunge and swing your arms back for momentum.
3. Explode upward and switch leg positions in mid-air.
4. Land softly in the opposite split stance and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive knees high, keep the pelvis neutral and land with soft knees

Health benefit: Strengthens core and improves grip strength
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and shoulders engaged.
2. Brace your core and lift both legs straight or slightly bent toward the bar.
3. Reach your toes to touch the bar by curling your hips and abs.
4. Lower your legs back to a dead hang with control and reset your shoulders.
Safety cue: Start with a scapular pull and keep core braced to minimize swinging

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength and lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and point one foot outward while keeping the other slightly bent.
2. Shift your weight into the bent leg and push your hips back as you descend.
3. Lower until the bent thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Drive through the bent foot to return upright and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank facing a wall with your feet touching the base.
2. Walk your hands toward the wall while allowing your feet to climb up until your body forms a straight line.
3. Pause briefly with shoulders stacked over hands and core tight.
4. Walk your hands back out to the starting plank and reset.
Safety cue: Pack the shoulders and move hands slowly with core tight for controlled ascent

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and landing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg at the edge of a small box or marker.
2. Step forward and perform a controlled jump or hop, landing on the same leg.
3. Absorb the landing softly with a bent knee and hold balance for a count before repeating.
Safety cue: Land softly with hip and knee flexion to absorb force and maintain upright chest

Health benefit: Builds lateral core power and dynamic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop up on your elbow with feet stacked and hips lifted.
2. Drop your hips toward the ground and then explosively drive them upward.
3. Add a quick upward hip clap or small hop with the top leg before returning to the start.
Safety cue: Maintain a rigid plank line and control the lateral hop without letting hips sag

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and core muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and hips level.
2. Drive one knee rapidly toward your chest and then switch legs in a quick alternating pattern.
3. Maintain a fast, sprint-like tempo while keeping hips low and core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and spine neutral while driving knees quickly with controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens oblique muscles and rotational core control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, lean back slightly, and lift both feet off the ground while holding a weight or hands together.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and touch the weight or hands beside your hip.
3. Rotate to the left and touch beside the opposite hip in a controlled, continuous motion.
Safety cue: Brace the core, sit back slightly, and rotate through the torso while keeping feet elevated

Health benefit: Develops explosive single leg power and lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a split squat stance with one foot forward and one back and hands on hips.
2. Lower into a deep lunge until the back knee is close to the floor.
3. Explode upward into a jump, switching leg positions in mid-air.
4. Land softly in the opposite split squat and repeat.
Safety cue: Explode through the front leg and land softly with knee tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Increases overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall and place your hands shoulder-width apart a few inches from the base.
2. Kick up into a wall-supported handstand with your feet touching the wall and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Push through your shoulders to extend the elbows and return to the handstand, then step down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lower body power and jumping coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a takeoff line with weight on the balls of your feet.
2. Perform a hop off one foot and land on the same foot (hop phase).
3. Immediately step onto the opposite foot and then drive into the final full jump for distance (step and jump phases).
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases groin and inner thigh flexibility and enhances hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with soles of feet together and knees wide.
2. Hold your feet with both hands and lengthen the spine.
3. Exhale and hinge forward from the hips toward the feet.
4. Keep knees relaxed and press elbows against the inner thighs.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and hinge from the hips when folding forward

Health benefit: Promotes hip external rotation and encourages relaxed seated posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and cross one shin over the other.
2. Lengthen the spine and relax the shoulders.
3. Rest hands on the knees and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Sit tall with ribs stacked over pelvis and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Gently stretches the lower back and supports spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with big toes touching.
2. Separate knees wide and reach arms forward on the floor.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor and rest your forehead down.
4. Relax shoulders and extend the arms to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Sink hips back toward heels while keeping spine long

Health benefit: Lengthens hamstrings and calves while promoting posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and legs straight.
2. Hinge from the hips and reach both hands toward the toes.
3. Keep legs straight and allow the head to hang.
4. Return to standing by engaging the core and rolling up.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens the hip flexors and improves front hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and step one foot forward to form a 90-degree angle.
2. Tuck the pelvis under and shift the hips forward over the front knee.
3. Keep the torso upright and squeeze the glute of the back leg.
4. Hold the position and maintain alignment.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and keep the torso upright to avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Targets gluteal muscles and enhances hip external rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and cross one ankle over the opposite thigh near the knee.
2. Press the crossed knee away and flex the crossed foot.
3. Lean forward from the hips to increase the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hinge forward from the hips for a targeted glute stretch

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances functional squat mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push hips back and bend knees while keeping heels on the floor.
3. Lower until thighs are parallel to the floor or as mobility allows.
4. Drive through the heels to return to standing with an upright chest.
Safety cue: Drive hips back and keep weight through heels with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Promotes lower back mobility and stretches the gluteal and hip musculature
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and draw both knees toward your chest.
2. Wrap hands around the shins and pull knees closer to the torso.
3. Keep the low back pressed into the floor and hold the position.
Safety cue: Pull knees toward chest while keeping the lower back gently pressed into the floor

Health benefit: Improves hip joint mobility and enhances dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hands on hips.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite knee slightly.
3. Rotate the lifted knee outward and complete a slow circular motion.
4. Reverse the direction after several reps and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall, brace the core, and move the hips slowly with control

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and glutes while improving single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot forward into a long stride.
2. Bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and step far enough so the front knee stays above the ankle

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and promotes pelvic alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Inhale and drop the belly while lifting the tailbone and gaze slightly forward.
3. Exhale and round the spine, tuck the tailbone and draw the belly upward.
4. Repeat the pelvic tilt slowly for several cycles.
Safety cue: Coordinate pelvic tilts with slow breaths and maintain control through the spine

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and inner thigh flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs spread wide and spine tall.
2. Hinge from the hips and lean forward with a long chest toward the floor.
3. Reach hands forward and hold where you feel a comfortable stretch.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine and hinge from the hips rather than rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your arm.
2. Lift the top leg high while keeping the toes pointed forward.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with control without rotating the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee to grab the same-side ankle behind you.
2. Keep knees close together and push the hips slightly forward.
3. Hold the stretch, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned and chest lifted while gently tucking the pelvis

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and lower back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms out to the sides and legs extended.
2. Lift one foot and swing it toward the opposite hand, rotating the lower back and hips.
3. Return the leg to center and repeat on the other side.
4. Move slowly and control the rotation each rep.
Safety cue: Anchor the pelvis and rotate the spine slowly without forcing the range

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and supports hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Drive through the heels and lift the hips until the torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze the glutes at the top and hold full extension.
4. Lower the hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves coordination and lateral power while challenging dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside the rail with feet hip-width and hands ready for balance.
2. Step the lead leg up and over the rail, lifting the knee high to clear the obstacle.
3. Bring the trailing leg across and step down on the other side.
4. Repeat by stepping back over in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Step over deliberately with a tall torso and control the descent through the supporting leg

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation and builds lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned slightly outward.
2. Sink hips down into a deep squat while keeping the chest lifted.
3. Hold the low position with weight on the heels and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes while sitting back into the heels

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and improves walking cadence
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee up toward hip height with the opposite arm driving forward.
2. Lower the foot and immediately lift the other knee in a marching rhythm.
3. Maintain an upright torso and steady cadence as you alternate knees.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle core rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, knees stacked over hips.
2. Keep both shoulders on the floor and lower the knees slowly to one side.
3. Return the knees to center and repeat to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core stability and posterior chain coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend the opposite arm forward and the opposite leg back, keeping hips level.
3. Reach the lifted heel toward the ceiling while squeezing the glute.
4. Lower back to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level as you reach the arm and opposite leg

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and gentle relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and draw knees toward your chest.
2. Grab the outer edges of your feet with your hands and open your knees wide.
3. Pull your feet toward your armpits and press your knees gently toward the floor.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back gently grounded and breathe deeply as you hold the pose

Health benefit: Stretches lateral torso and improves side range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and raise one arm overhead.
2. Lean the torso toward the opposite side while sliding the raised hand down the thigh.
3. Hold the deep side lean then return upright.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and hinge from the hips as you lean to the side

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and march forward lifting knees high.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest while swinging the opposite arm forward.
3. Land softly on the ball of the foot and continue marching.
4. Maintain an upright posture and brisk cadence.
Safety cue: Drive knees up with core engaged and land softly each step

Health benefit: Enhances hip abductor strength and lateral mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes pointing forward.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the opposite leg straight.
3. Push through the bent foot to shift to the other side and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and shift your weight with control from the hips

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and lower back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and spine tall.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your hands toward your feet.
3. Hold the forward fold and keep your spine long.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and avoid rounding the upper back

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and lower back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and hands under your forehead.
2. Squeeze a glute and lift one leg a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold briefly at the top while keeping hips down.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace the core and lift through the glutes while keeping the pelvis stable

Health benefit: Increases internal hip rotation range and joint awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place one hand on the knee and the other near the ankle.
3. Rotate the thigh inward so the knee moves toward the midline.
4. Return to neutral and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate only from the hip with a controlled range of motion

Health benefit: Develops deep core control and coordination with limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and hips and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Slowly lower one leg toward the floor while keeping the opposite arm stable.
3. Press the lower back into the floor and control the descent.
4. Return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and lower the legs slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds oblique engagement and dynamic core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with body in a straight line.
2. Rotate your hips to one side and dip them toward the floor.
3. Rotate through center to the other side and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the rotation from the hips

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and dynamic leg flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on a stable support and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Swing the free leg forward by hinging at the hip with a controlled motion.
3. Swing the same leg backward while keeping core engaged and posture tall.
4. Repeat for repetitions then switch legs.
Safety cue: Brace your core and control the swing from the hips

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic extension and anterior torso mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under shoulders and elbows close to the body.
2. Push through the palms to straighten the arms and lift the chest high.
3. Keep hips on the floor and open the chest.
4. Lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and lift through the chest while lengthening the spine

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and lower body isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet shoulder-width apart slightly forward.
2. Slide down the wall until your thighs reach below parallel into a deep sit.
3. Hold the position with weight in the heels and chest upright.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility while challenging core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms extended horizontally.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach one hand toward the opposite foot slowly.
3. Rotate the torso as you return upright and reach the other hand down.
4. Move deliberately and control each repetition.
Safety cue: Rotate from the thoracic spine and keep hips square as you reach slowly

Health benefit: Develops lateral strength and hip adductor mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and toes slightly turned out.
2. Shift hips to one side and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Sit into a mid-depth Cossack squat while keeping chest up.
4. Push through the bent foot to return to center and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases lateral hip strength and improves gait stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a wide step to one side.
2. Sink hips back and bend the stepping knee deeply into a lateral lunge.
3. Keep the opposite leg straight and both feet flat.
4. Drive through the bent foot to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Push hips back and lead with your chest while keeping the working foot flat

Health benefit: Targets gluteus medius and hip stability for improved lateral movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one leg diagonally behind the other into a curtsy position.
2. Bend both knees to lower until the back knee nears the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep your torso tall and lower into the curtsy with controlled hip alignment

Health benefit: Enhances internal and external hip rotation coordination and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one hip flexed in front at 90 degrees and the other hip flexed to the side at 90 degrees.
2. Place hands on the floor and maintain a tall spine.
3. Lift the back knee slightly and rotate the hips to switch positions smoothly.
4. Settle into the opposite 90/90 position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and switch hips with controlled hip drives

Health benefit: Increases unilateral leg strength and balance under loaded hip flexion positions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench and place one foot on the bench behind you.
2. Lower hips by bending the front knee until the front thigh is deep and the back knee nears the floor.
3. Keep chest upright and weight over the front heel.
4. Push through the front foot to rise and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee aligned over the foot and lower with slow controlled depth

Health benefit: Improves hip external rotation and releases deep gluteal tension
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees, then bring one knee forward and place it behind the same-side wrist.
2. Extend the opposite leg straight back and square the hips toward the front.
3. Lower your torso over the front leg or support on hands to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Square your hips to the front and breathe deeply as you relax into the pose

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Step your right foot outside your right hand and lower your hips toward the floor.
3. Push back to the high plank and return your right foot.
4. Repeat the same sequence on the left side.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hips square as you step and reach

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate while engaging core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with a tight core.
2. Drive your right knee fully toward your chest and then extend it back.
3. Quickly alternate legs with controlled full-range motion.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked and spine neutral while driving knees with control

Health benefit: Enhances oblique strength and rotational core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs long.
2. Lift your shoulders off the floor and rotate to bring your right elbow toward your left knee while fully extending the right leg.
3. Switch sides by rotating and bringing your left elbow toward your right knee while fully extending the left leg.
4. Continue alternating with full leg extensions.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and control the long leg extension

Health benefit: Improves lateral power, balance, and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Push off laterally and land on one foot while swinging the opposite leg behind you and the arms across the body.
3. Immediately push off the landing foot and leap to the other side, landing softly.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and drive hips back to absorb impact

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step your right foot back into a reverse lunge lowering the back knee toward the floor.
2. Push through the left heel to stand and drive your right knee up toward your chest.
3. Control the descent back into the reverse lunge.
4. Repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and push through the front heel as you drive the knee up

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hips and toes turned out.
2. Squat down until your elbows touch the inside of your knees and your thighs are near parallel.
3. Drive through your heels to stand while squeezing your glutes.
Safety cue: Keep heels grounded, chest lifted, and knees tracking outward as you squat

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core and hip abductors, improving side stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and lift into a side plank on your forearm with legs stacked.
2. Lift your top leg upward while keeping your hips stable.
3. Lower the top leg with control without dropping your hips.
4. Repeat and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and hips and lift the top leg slowly without letting the hips sag

Health benefit: Develops anterior core strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with arms straight and shoulders engaged.
2. Brace your core and lift your legs up toward your chest with controlled motion.
3. Pause at the top with hips and knees flexed.
4. Lower your legs slowly to a full hang.
Safety cue: Pack the shoulders and brace the core to lift the legs with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and seated balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit and lean back slightly with legs extended and hands reaching forward.
2. Lift your torso and legs simultaneously to form a V shape, reaching your hands toward your toes.
3. Hold briefly at the top with a tight core.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and exhale as you lift to engage the core with control

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and shoulder mobility while activating core
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward into a high plank.
3. Walk your feet toward your hands while keeping legs as straight as possible to achieve a deep pike.
4. Walk your hands back out to return to plank and then walk feet forward to stand.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders.
2. Lift one knee out to the side and drive the thigh upward in a high arc.
3. Keep the knee bent and the core braced while holding the top position.
4. Lower the knee back to start with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and brace the core as you lift the leg

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a tabletop position and lift knees a few inches off the ground.
2. Move the opposite hand and foot forward together while keeping hips low.
3. Continue alternating limbs to crawl forward with steady steps.
4. Maintain a neutral spine and controlled breathing throughout.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged while moving with controlled steps

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at sides.
2. Jump feet wide while raising arms overhead.
3. Jump feet back together while bringing arms down to sides.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds unilateral lower body strength and functional power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a high box with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step one foot fully onto the box and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Stand tall at the top with hips extended.
4. Step down slowly with control and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel and keep a tall chest as you step up

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step forward into a lunge while keeping the torso upright.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg and hold briefly.
4. Push through the front heel to step forward and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and hands by your hips.
2. Lift both legs and alternate scissoring them fully up and down.
3. Keep the lower back pressed into the floor throughout the motion.
4. Control the movement and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the mat and control each kick with steady breathing

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while lifting the free leg behind you.
3. Reach both hands toward the standing foot while keeping a long spine.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and a soft standing knee

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and hip external rotation mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and cross one ankle over the opposite knee to make a figure-4.
2. Bend the standing knee slightly and sit back to find balance.
3. Hold the position while keeping the chest upright.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips level and engage the standing glute to maintain balance

Health benefit: Increases functional conditioning and total body power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and drop into a squat, placing hands on the floor.
2. Kick feet back into a plank and lower your chest to the ground.
3. Push through your hands and feet to return to the squat position.
4. Explode upward into a jump and clap overhead.
Safety cue: Hinge hips back and lower with control into the plank keeping core braced

Health benefit: Improves lower body endurance and dynamic cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at sides.
2. Jump feet wide into a low squat while lowering your hips.
3. Jump feet back together and stand tall with arms at sides.
Safety cue: Sit back into a controlled squat keep knees tracking over toes and land softly

Health benefit: Improves core stability and dynamic shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Jump both feet wide and then back together in a quick, controlled motion.
3. Keep hips steady and core tight throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level as you move legs in and out

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain strength and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind hips, fingers facing forward.
2. Lift hips off the ground until torso forms a tabletop position.
3. Step one hand and the opposite foot backward, then repeat to walk forward or backward.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and shoulders stacked over wrists while taking controlled steps

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and improves hip extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with knees under hips and hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling while keeping the knee bent and the foot flexed.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top, then lower the knee back toward the floor without touching.
Safety cue: Keep core stable and drive the heel up without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and joint control in the lunge position
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a deep lunge with the front knee stacked over the ankle and the back knee low.
2. Lower slightly deeper into the lunge by pulsing a few inches up and down.
3. Keep the torso upright and pulse in a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Lower with control keeping the front knee tracking over the toes and torso upright

Health benefit: Stretches calf muscles while enhancing shoulder stability and spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees, then lift hips toward the ceiling to form an inverted V.
2. Press the heels gently toward the floor and lengthen the spine.
3. Spread the fingers, push through the hands, and hold the position.
Safety cue: Press through the palms and reach the heels toward the floor while lengthening the spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and coordination for quick change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly off the ground and arms ready.
2. Hop laterally to the opposite side, landing softly on the opposite foot while swinging the free leg behind.
3. Immediately push off and repeat the lateral hop in a controlled, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright to control lateral force

Health benefit: Develops oblique strength and improves core rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms out to the sides and legs raised perpendicular to the floor.
2. Lower both legs to one side in a controlled arc while keeping the shoulders on the ground.
3. Pull the legs back to center and lower them to the other side with steady core control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and ankle mobility under load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and extend one leg straight out in front at hip height.
2. Push the hips back and bend the standing knee to begin the descent.
3. Lower all the way down into a single-leg squat while keeping the extended leg off the floor.
4. Drive through the heel of the standing leg to rise back to standing and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and eccentric leg strength in deep single leg positions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and point toes slightly outward.
2. Shift weight to one leg and sweep the opposite leg behind while bending deeply into the squat.
3. Lower the hips close to the floor while reaching toward the front foot with the torso.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Trains unilateral leg stability and lateral load distribution
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and shift weight to one leg while keeping the other leg extended to the side.
2. Bend the loaded knee and sink into a deep lateral squat, keeping the extended leg straight.
3. Press into the planted foot to drive back up while sliding the extended leg back to center.
4. Repeat on the opposite side, alternating the archer motion.
Safety cue: Distribute weight evenly and control the lateral shift while keeping the back straight

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and improves knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and toes forward.
2. Rise onto your toes and lock hips forward.
3. Bend knees and lean torso back while lowering knees toward the floor.
4. Push through toes to extend knees and return to start.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and control the knee hinge with a braced core

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances hip and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend knees and drop to your knees, then sit back onto your heels.
3. Lower your torso backward to lie flat on the floor with knees bent.
4. Drive through feet and hips to roll up to a seated position and stand.
Safety cue: Descend slowly with a tight core and drive through the legs to stand tall

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and grasp the other ankle behind your body.
2. Keep chest up and hinge slightly at the hip.
3. Bend the standing knee and lower your body toward the floor while keeping the back knee close to the mat.
