Health benefit: Builds functional leg strength and rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step diagonally forward and lower into a lunge until the front thigh is parallel.
3. Push through the front foot to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Step diagonally with hips back and front knee tracking over the second toe

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and rotational speed of the trunk
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing tall with hands lightly behind your head.
2. Drive one knee up and twist your torso to touch the knee with the opposite elbow.
3. Quickly return to standing and immediately drive the other knee toward the opposite elbow.
4. Maintain a fast, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Drive the knee toward the elbow with a braced core and controlled tempo

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and quick positional control
Steps to perform:
1. Start seated with one leg in front bent 90 degrees and the other leg behind bent 90 degrees.
2. Shift your weight slightly and lift your hips an inch off the ground.
3. Rotate your hips and swing the back leg forward while moving the front leg back.
4. Settle into the opposite 90/90 position and repeat the switch.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and use core control to smoothly switch positions

Health benefit: Combines squat strength with aerobic conditioning and lateral movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with feet together and chest up.
2. Jump your feet out wide while staying in the squat position.
3. Jump your feet back together and land softly in the squat position.
Safety cue: Land softly with chest up, core engaged, and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with feet flat and hands behind your hips.
2. Lift your hips off the ground into a reverse tabletop position.
3. Step one hand and the opposite foot forward in small controlled steps.
4. Continue alternating hand and foot to move across the floor.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and spine neutral while moving with controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves core stability and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hips low and knees bent under the hips.
2. Keep your core tight and back flat.
3. Move your right hand and left foot forward together in short steps.
4. Repeat with the left hand and right foot while maintaining low hips.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and move hands and feet deliberately without letting hips sag

Health benefit: Builds ankle strength and explosive calf power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot near support and keep the other foot off the ground.
2. Push up quickly onto the ball of the standing foot and lift the heel high.
3. Lower the heel quickly back toward the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases muscular endurance and hip stability in the legs
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot forward into a shallow lunge.
2. Keep your chest up and the front knee tracking over the toes.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches by bending and straightening the front knee repeatedly.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the toes and pulse with an upright chest

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and unilateral shoulder strength while improving balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in downward dog with hands shoulder-width and hips raised.
2. Lift one leg behind you until it aligns with your torso.
3. Shift weight forward into plank by lowering hips and stacking shoulders over wrists while keeping the raised leg high.
4. Push back into downward dog by driving hips up and lowering the raised leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal endurance and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift shoulders off the ground and bring one elbow toward the opposite knee.
3. Quickly switch sides in a pedaling motion while keeping the movement fast and controlled.
Safety cue: Rotate from the ribs, keep the neck relaxed, and control the tempo during each pedal

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and reactive balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold onto a sturdy support with one hand.
2. Swing the free leg forward explosively with a straight knee to chest height.
3. Allow the leg to swing back under control and repeat with power.
Safety cue: Keep the torso tall and control the swing from the hip, avoiding excessive momentum

Health benefit: Develops single leg strength mobility and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended straight in front and arms forward.
2. Push hips back and lower down by bending the standing knee while keeping the extended leg off the floor.
3. Descend until hip is below knee level or as mobility allows.
4. Drive through the heel to press back up to standing with the extended leg straight.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances deep hip mobility and unilateral leg control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a deep lunge with the rear toes tucked and the front foot planted.
2. Shift weight onto the front foot and lower your hips while keeping the torso upright.
3. Slide the rear knee backward under your body and reach the torso forward to deepen the squat.
4. Press through the front heel to return to the starting lunge position.
Safety cue: Keep the chest upright and hips square, lowering with slow controlled movement and steady balance

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and grab the ankle of the other leg behind you with the same-side hand.
2. Bend the standing knee and push hips back while keeping the grabbed foot close to your glutes.
3. Lower until the back knee almost touches the ground while keeping chest upright.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return to standing while holding the back foot.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and one back.
2. Jump straight up and switch the leg positions in midair.
3. Land softly into a lunge with the opposite foot forward.
4. Repeat the jump-switch rhythm for reps.
Safety cue: Land softly with knee tracking over toes and torso upright

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness while challenging single-leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Kick your free leg back into a plank on one leg and perform a quick push movement.
3. Jump your feet back toward your hands and stand up on the same leg.
4. Explode upward into a single-leg hop and land softly.
Safety cue: Maintain a tight core and control each transition to avoid collapsing the hips

Health benefit: Develops explosive power and improves single-leg landing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg facing a sturdy box.
2. Swing your arms and bend the knee to load your jump.
3. Jump up and land onto the box on the same leg with a bent knee.
4. Step down under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through the ankle and land softly with knee aligned over toes

Health benefit: Increases plyometric power and hip flexor explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the knee slightly bent.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward, tucking your knee toward your chest.
3. Land softly on the same leg with a bent knee and prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Absorb the landing with a bent knee and keep your chest upright

Health benefit: Enhances lower-body power and muscular endurance through repeated explosive transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forward lunge with one foot ahead and one behind.
2. Jump straight up and switch your front and back legs in midair.
3. Land softly into a lunge with the opposite leg forward and continue.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and reactive balance across wide side-to-side movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and hips back.
2. Leap sideways as far as possible landing on the opposite leg.
3. Absorb the impact with a bent knee and drive the free leg behind you for balance.
4. Push off immediately into the next wide lateral bound.
Safety cue: Stay low through the hips and land under control on a bent knee

Health benefit: Trains eccentric control and rapid force absorption on one leg
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a low box and step forward off the edge.
2. Land on one leg with a soft, bent knee and hips back to absorb impact.
3. Immediately explode upward into a vertical jump upon landing.
4. Land softly and reset on the same leg.
Safety cue: Step off with control and absorb the landing with a soft, bent knee

Health benefit: Builds horizontal explosive strength and single-leg takeoff ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with your torso upright.
2. Swing your arms and drive through the ankle to jump forward.
3. Land on the same leg with a bent knee and absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Drive the hips forward and land on a soft bent knee with chest up

Health benefit: Enhances sequential power production and coordination across multiple phases
Steps to perform:
1. Take a short run-up and approach the takeoff mark.
2. Hop off the takeoff leg and land on that same leg for the hop phase.
3. Continue into the step phase by landing on the opposite leg.
4. Finish with a powerful jump off that leg and land with bent knees.
Safety cue: Control each phase by absorbing landings with bent knees and a strong hip hinge

Health benefit: Develops rotational power and rapid lower-body force generation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart in a shallow squat.
2. Explode upward and rotate your body 180 degrees in the air.
3. Land softly into a squat facing the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight knee bend and arms by your sides.
2. Bend at the knee and swing your arms to generate momentum.
3. Hop diagonally to the next marker in a zig-zag line.
4. Land softly on the same foot and continue the pattern.
Safety cue: Land softly with a slight knee bend and hips level

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the rope handles and stand with feet together and rope behind you.
2. Bend the knees slightly and jump higher than a normal skip.
3. Rotate the wrists faster so the rope passes twice under your feet in one jump.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep a tall posture, soft knees, and breathe rhythmically

Health benefit: Develops eccentric leg control and landing resilience
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a low box on one leg with the other foot off the edge.
2. Step or push off to drop down while keeping hips level.
3. Absorb the landing by bending the knee and holding balance on that leg.
Safety cue: Step down under control, absorbing impact through the hip and knee

Health benefit: Improves lower body explosive power and ankle responsiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Swing your arms and jump, tucking both knees toward your chest.
3. Extend your legs and land softly on both feet.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and absorb landing with a bent knee

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and spatial awareness during dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing your arms and jump, rotating your body a full 360 degrees.
3. Spot the landing and land softly on the balls of your feet.
4. Reset your stance and repeat the rotation in the same direction.
Safety cue: Spot the landing, rotate under control, and keep hips aligned

Health benefit: Increases acceleration ability and fast-twitch muscle recruitment
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a staggered sprint stance with one foot forward and weight on the balls of your feet.
2. Lean slightly forward and drive forcefully through the front foot.
3. Swing your arms explosively and push off to accelerate.
4. Drive the knees up and accelerate into the sprint.
Safety cue: Explode while keeping a stable core and forward lean from the ankles

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and upper body balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a handstand against a wall or freestanding.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and step the other hand forward.
3. Continue alternating hand steps to move forward.
4. Keep the body tight and maintain control while walking.
Safety cue: Keep a tight core, a straight shoulder-to-wrist line, and controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves core engagement and shoulder mobility under load
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with your feet close to a wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer to the wall.
3. Continue until your chest is near the wall or you reach the desired height.
4. Walk your hands back out and lower your feet to return to the plank.
Safety cue: Maintain shoulder packing and a neutral spine as you climb

Health benefit: Increases unilateral leg power and coordination for dynamic transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a split stance with one foot forward and one back.
2. Explode upward and switch the leg positions in midair like a scissor.
3. Land softly into the opposite lunge and prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips level and alternate legs under control

Health benefit: Boosts lateral power and agility for quick change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a soft knee bend.
2. Push off laterally as forcefully as possible and drive the opposite knee across.
3. Land softly on the opposite leg with the knee bent.
4. Immediately push off into the next lateral bound.
Safety cue: Push off explosively and land with a soft bent knee and hips square

Health benefit: Enhances single leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and extend arms forward.
2. Bend knees and sit back to the floor with chest up.
3. Roll onto your back and sit up into a squat.
4. Drive up and finish standing on one leg.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep chest lifted as you lower and finish on one leg

Health benefit: Develops calf and quadriceps endurance and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the balls of your feet with heels raised.
2. Bend knees and drop hips back while swinging arms forward.
3. Drive through the toes to rise and swing arms back up.
Safety cue: Drive up onto the toes with chest upright and controlled rhythm

Health benefit: Builds lateral explosive power and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a box with knees slightly bent.
2. Explosively jump sideways over the box while swinging your arms.
3. Land softly on the opposite side with knees bent.
4. Pivot and repeat back to the starting side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back to absorb impact

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and improves lateral core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on your forearm with body straight.
2. Lower your hips toward the floor in a controlled manner.
3. Explosively lift your hips and drive the top knee toward the elbow.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core tight to maintain control during the plyometric side movement

Health benefit: Improves single leg power and sprint mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall balanced on one leg with a slight knee bend.
2. Drive the opposite knee up and push off to sprint in place on that leg.
3. Keep ground contacts short and pump your arms quickly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances rotational power and change of direction quickness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and bend your knees.
2. Jump and rotate your body 90 degrees in the air.
3. Land softly with knees bent and prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Rotate under control and land softly with knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Improves lateral speed and reactive leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start on one leg with the other leg slightly behind.
2. Explosively hop laterally to land on the opposite leg using arm drive.
3. Minimize ground contact and rebound immediately into the next hop.
Safety cue: Land quietly on the lead foot with hips back and chest upright

Health benefit: Improves landing stability and single leg control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a low box or platform and prepare to step off.
2. Step off and land on one leg with hips back and knee aligned.
3. Hold the single-leg landing briefly to regain balance.
Safety cue: Absorb the landing through a soft knee bend and hip hinge keeping hips level

Health benefit: Develops eccentric control and knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a high box with hands by your sides.
2. Slowly lower the opposite heel to the floor while keeping torso upright.
3. Drive through the standing leg to return to the box without using hands.
Safety cue: Control the descent without hands keeping weight through the heel and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and unilateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Take a wide stance and brace your core.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee into a deep squat while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Push through the leading heel to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat on your back with legs extended and hands under your hips.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Raise both legs together until they are perpendicular to the floor.
4. Lower your legs slowly without touching the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Press the low back into the mat and lower the legs slowly with control

Health benefit: Stretches hamstrings and calves while promoting posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and legs straight.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach both hands toward your toes while keeping legs straight.
3. Return to standing by driving your hips forward and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a soft bend in the knees and lengthen the spine

Health benefit: Builds abdominal endurance and enhances trunk flexion strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and brace your core.
3. Sit all the way up until your torso is upright over your hips.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin and lift with the abs, avoiding momentum

Health benefit: Improves spinal extension mobility and opens chest and anterior shoulder area
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Press into your hands to lift your chest and straighten your arms.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly, then lower your torso back to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles including lower back glutes and upper back
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Squeeze your glutes and shoulder blades and lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Lower all limbs to the floor with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Raise chest and limbs with controlled motion and keep the neck neutral

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility and promotes relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and feet flexed toward your torso.
2. Hinge at the hips and lean forward, reaching toward your feet.
3. Hold the fold while keeping a long spine.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and lead the fold with the chest

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and improves hip and knee functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and bend your knees to lower into a deep squat.
3. Keep your chest up and knees tracking over your toes.
4. Drive through your heels to stand back up and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit hips back, keep knees tracking over toes and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and improves spinal mobility and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands at your chest or hips.
2. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Rotate through center to the left in a controlled motion and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Rotate from the ribcage with hips squared and feet rooted

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and releases tension in the lower back and hips
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Drop both knees to one side while turning your head to the opposite side and keep your shoulders grounded.
3. Return knees to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders on the ground and guide the knees with core control

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity and improves hip flexor strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest rapidly while pumping the opposite arm.
3. Alternate knees quickly in a marching rhythm.
4. Maintain an upright posture and continue at a rapid pace.
Safety cue: Stay upright, drive knees with hip flexors and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and promotes gentle movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Inhale and drop your belly while lifting your chest and tailbone for a deep arch.
3. Exhale and round your spine while tucking your chin and tailbone.
4. Repeat the arching and rounding slowly.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the spine and coordinate pelvis and ribcage to avoid extreme arching

Health benefit: Improves core control and lower abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs raised to 90 degrees.
2. Lower one leg slowly toward the floor without letting the other leg move.
3. Raise the lowered leg back to start.
4. Alternate legs with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet out wide while raising arms overhead.
3. Jump feet back together while lowering arms to the sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and one arm at your side.
2. Reach the opposite arm overhead and bend deeply to the side.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs stacked over hips and bend only to a controlled comfortable range

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and challenges core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands under your hips.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Alternate quick small up and down kicks with straight legs.
4. Keep movements controlled and steady.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the mat and use small controlled kicks from the hips

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and improves posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until hips, knees, and shoulders align.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping hips lifted.
4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze the glutes and lift to a neutral spine, stopping before your low back over-arches

Health benefit: Develops spinal stability and contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg back until parallel to the floor.
3. Hold briefly while maintaining balance.
4. Return to start and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and elevates aerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at the base of the stairs facing upward.
2. Step up quickly onto the first step driving through the working leg.
3. Continue stepping up rapidly while alternating legs.
Safety cue: Control your cadence, land mid-foot and maintain an upright torso with steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances deep core stabilization and controlled limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent to tabletop.
2. Slowly lower one arm and the opposite leg toward the floor together.
3. Bring them back to the starting position.
4. Repeat with the opposite arm and leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes relaxation and gentle posterior chain stretching
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with knees together or apart.
2. Reach your arms forward and lower your chest toward your thighs.
3. Round your upper back and rest your forehead on the floor.
Safety cue: Reach through the arms and lengthen the spine to prevent rounding of the back

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and balance while engaging glutes and quadriceps
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides.
2. Step one foot straight back and lower until both knees form about 90-degree angles.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat the movement leading with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and step back with control driving through the front heel

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and standing postural awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left leg.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back to grip your right ankle.
3. Lean slightly forward and press your hips forward while holding the ankle.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis slightly and keep knees aligned while pulling heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and glutes while improving hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and drive your hips up toward the ceiling into a high bridge.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the top position.
4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular fitness and challenges lower body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Step onto an inclined surface and stand tall with feet hip-width.
2. Walk forward using brisk, short strides while maintaining an upright posture.
3. Maintain a steady pace and controlled breathing for the desired time.
Safety cue: Shorten stride lean slightly from the ankles and maintain a tall posture

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor flexibility and promotes pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your right knee on the floor and left foot planted in front at 90 degrees.
2. Shift your hips forward and tuck your pelvis while squeezing the right glute.
3. Arch your upper back slightly and reach your right arm overhead.
4. Hold the stretch and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Tuck tailbone and keep torso upright with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and lower abdominal muscle control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended a few inches off the floor.
2. Lift one leg toward the ceiling while lowering the other leg close to the floor.
3. Alternate legs in a controlled scissor motion while keeping your core engaged.
4. Continue switching legs with steady, even movements.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the mat and move legs with slow controlled motions

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked and support your head with your hand.
2. Lift the top leg upward keeping it straight and toes pointed forward.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders and lift through the outer hip without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Develops inner thigh strength and enhances hip mobility for squatting patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Bend your knees and lower your hips into a deep plie while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Push through your heels to return to standing while squeezing your inner thighs.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes chest lifted and weight in the heels

Health benefit: Challenges shoulder and core endurance and enhances trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands under your shoulders and step your feet back into a high plank.
2. Press through your palms and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes to prevent your hips from sagging.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Engage core and glutes to maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Stretches posterior chain while improving shoulder mobility and hamstring flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift your hips up and back into downward dog.
2. Press your palms into the mat and straighten your legs, locking the knees.
3. Push your heels toward the floor while lengthening through your spine.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Microbend the knees and press through palms while lengthening the spine

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and oblique muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and lean back slightly.
2. Hold your hands together in front of your chest and brace your core.
3. Rotate your torso to one side and tap your hands by the hip.
4. Rotate to the other side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Brace your core and twist from the torso not the neck

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hips and extend arms out to the sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide one hand down the front of the leg toward the foot.
3. Reach the opposite arm up and keep your eyes on the raised hand.
4. Return to standing and repeat slowly on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and keep a long spine as you reach down

Health benefit: Builds lateral agility and hip abductor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low athletic stance with knees bent and chest up.
2. Push off one foot and shuffle laterally several quick steps while staying low.
3. Keep hips back and use your arms for balance and rhythm.
4. Reverse direction and repeat with controlled, quick steps.
Safety cue: Stay low in an athletic stance and shuffle with quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and glute activation through controlled spinal flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and round your upper back slightly.
2. Bend one knee and grasp it with both hands, pulling it toward your chest.
3. Hold the rounded position briefly and then release.
4. Repeat the same motion on the other leg.
Safety cue: Lift the knee with slow controlled motion and keep your chest open

Health benefit: Increases core power and coordinated oblique firing
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs lifted.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest as you twist the opposite elbow toward it.
3. Switch sides quickly by extending the other leg and bringing the opposite elbow in.
4. Maintain a brisk, continuous alternating motion.
Safety cue: Brace the core and pedal with control instead of using momentum

Health benefit: Enhances cardiovascular work capacity while engaging core and hip flexors
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest and then quickly switch legs in a running pattern.
3. Keep your hips low and core engaged while moving.
4. Continue alternating knees rapidly while holding a strong plank position.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and core engaged while driving knees with control

Health benefit: Improves total body conditioning with lower joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand, then squat down and place your hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Step one foot back at a time to reach a high plank position.
3. Step both feet forward toward your hands and rise to standing.
4. Reach overhead or perform a small jump when standing.
Safety cue: Perform a controlled step back and step up and land softly

Health benefit: Strengthens anterior core and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit and lift your legs and torso to form a V shape while balancing on your sit bones.
2. Extend your arms forward and keep your legs straight or slightly bent.
3. Hold the V position while keeping your core engaged and stable.
Safety cue: Squeeze the core and keep a neutral neck

Health benefit: Develops static core stability and improves posterior pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the ground while reaching your hands overhead.
3. Hold a tight hollow shape with your core engaged and body steady.
Safety cue: Press your lower back gently to the floor and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with light cardio and shoulder engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Jump your feet out wide and then quickly bring them back together like a horizontal jumping jack.
3. Keep your hips level and core tight throughout the movement.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and controlled landings.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight plank line and move legs with controlled small hops

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat with feet shoulder-width and arms relaxed.
2. Jump laterally to the right, landing on your right foot and sweeping your left foot behind.
3. Push off the right foot and leap laterally to the left, landing on your left foot.
4. Repeat the lateral jumps quickly while keeping a low squat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and keep core braced

Health benefit: Builds explosive lower body power and jump performance
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees until thighs are parallel.
3. Explode upward into a jump while swinging your arms overhead.
4. Land softly back into a squat and immediately repeat.
Safety cue: Explode upward and land softly with hips back and chest tall

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted slightly off the floor.
2. Contract your abs and curl your pelvis upward, lifting your hips off the floor.
3. Lower your hips back down with control until just above the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Curl hips upward with controlled core contraction and avoid swinging

Health benefit: Improves core strength and hip flexor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and legs straight.
2. Contract your abs and raise your knees toward your chest with control.
3. Lower your legs back to the starting position without swinging and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders engaged and lift knees with a controlled core contraction

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and core stability with hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor with elbows at about 45 degrees.
3. As you lower, drive your right knee toward your right elbow and keep hips low.
4. Push back up to plank and repeat on the other side, alternating each rep.
Safety cue: Keep core tight and hips level as you bring the knee toward the elbow

Health benefit: Builds shoulder pressing strength and improves overhead control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor while keeping hips elevated.
3. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep head neutral and drive through the shoulders while maintaining a straight spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and oblique endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself up on your bottom forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Hold the position and keep your top hand on your hip or extended, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over hips and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Increases single leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench and place the top of your back foot on the bench.
2. Lower your front knee by bending both knees until your front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your torso upright and your weight on the front heel.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and strengthens quadriceps and glutes
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and take a large step forward.
2. Lower your body until both knees are bent deeply and the back knee hovers near the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Step deeply while keeping torso upright and the front knee aligned over the ankle

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility while engaging core and upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, hinge at the hips, and walk your hands forward until you reach a high plank.
2. Perform a pushup by lowering your chest to the floor and then pushing back up.
3. Walk your hands back toward your feet while keeping legs as straight as comfortable.
4. Stand by reversing the hinge and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance while enhancing full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a tabletop with hands under shoulders and knees lifted a few inches off the ground.
2. Step your right hand and left foot forward while keeping hips low and core tight.
3. Move your left hand and right foot forward to continue crawling.
4. Maintain a steady forward rhythm and keep eyes down to control posture.
Safety cue: Keep core braced, spine neutral and hips level as you move

Health benefit: Develops explosive glute power and hip extension for stronger lower body propulsion
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drive one heel up explosively toward the ceiling while squeezing the glute.
3. Allow a brief hover at the top with the knee bent.
4. Lower under control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and drive through the glute without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves explosive leg power and dynamic agility for rapid change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with shoulders over hands and body in a straight line.
2. Jump both feet forward outside your hands into a low squat.
3. Explode up into a vertical jump, extending hips and swinging arms.
4. Land softly back into the high plank and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance while improving functional climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box or platform with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step one foot fully onto the box and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the trailing foot onto the box and stand tall at the top.
4. Step down lightly one foot at a time and repeat leading with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel and keep your torso upright as you step up

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and rotational mobility for improved coordinated movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a big step forward with one foot.
2. Lower into a deep lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg while keeping your core engaged.
4. Push through the front heel to step forward and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and anaerobic capacity while increasing running speed
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and accelerate to a controlled near-max sprint.
2. Pump your arms and drive your knees while maintaining form.
3. Decelerate gradually and come to a controlled stop.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture with quick, light steps and steady breathing

Health benefit: Increases hamstring activation and running cadence for more efficient leg turnover
Steps to perform:
1. Start jogging and lift your heels toward your glutes with each stride.
2. Keep an upright posture and pump your arms for rhythm.
3. Land lightly on the balls of your feet and repeat quickly.
Safety cue: Keep the pelvis neutral and drive the heels toward the glutes with controlled quick steps

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor strength and cardiovascular rhythm for improved sprint mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and drive one knee up toward hip level explosively.
2. Alternate knees quickly while pumping opposite arms.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and maintain a quick cadence.
Safety cue: Drive the knees up with core engaged and land softly under your hips

Health benefit: Improves core stability and rapid transitional coordination for dynamic balance and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low plank or prone push-up position with hands under shoulders.
2. Swing both feet forward toward your hands and plant them under your hips.
3. Pop up explosively into a staggered athletic stance like a surfer.
4. Absorb the landing softly and reset into the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Combines lower body strength and aerobic conditioning to increase power and stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and lower into a shallow squat.
2. Jump your feet out wide while keeping hips back and chest up.
3. Jump feet back together and return into the squat position.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, knees tracking over toes and land softly on each jump

Health benefit: Enhances hip and shoulder stability while improving coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands placed behind your hips.
2. Lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Move opposite hand and foot to walk forward or backward while keeping hips raised.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and core engaged to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the support knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and push them back while keeping a straight spine.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the back of the standing leg.
4. Drive hips forward to return to standing and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a flat back and a soft standing knee

Health benefit: Improves core stability and shoulder endurance while enhancing rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while minimizing hip rotation.
3. Return the hand to the ground and repeat the tap on the other shoulder.
Safety cue: Brace your core and minimize hip rotation while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps and glute endurance while promoting hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a lunge with the front knee over the ankle and the back knee lowered near the floor.
2. Pulse up and down a few inches by bending and slightly straightening the front knee.
3. Keep your torso upright and continue the small pulses, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the ankle and pulse with controlled depth

Health benefit: Develops muscular endurance of hip flexors and lower abs
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended a few inches off the ground.
2. Alternate lifting one leg a few inches while lowering the other in a quick, controlled flutter motion.
3. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and maintain a steady pace for the duration.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral lower back and small controlled flutters while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and dynamic balance for quick directional changes
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg with a slight knee bend.
2. Jump laterally to the opposite leg, landing softly and swinging the trailing leg behind you.
3. Immediately push off and jump to the other side, maintaining a smooth rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest up to protect the joints

Health benefit: Enhances oblique strength and spinal rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms outstretched and knees bent at 90 degrees above your hips.
2. Lower both knees to one side toward the floor while keeping your shoulders anchored.
3. Use your core to pull the knees back up and lower them to the opposite side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens full core and hip flexors while improving body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat with your legs extended and arms overhead.
2. Simultaneously lift your legs and torso to form a V and reach your hands toward your toes.
3. Lower back down with control until you are fully extended on the floor.
Safety cue: Lead with your chest and engage the core to lift without straining the neck

Health benefit: Builds core and grip strength while increasing active shoulder engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and shoulders engaged.
2. Engage your core and lift your legs by flexing your hips to drive your toes upward.
3. Touch the bar with your toes or shins, then lower your legs back down with control.
Safety cue: Engage your scapula and core to lift the toes while avoiding excessive swinging

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and improves cardiovascular capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and a slight bend in your knees.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward, bringing knees toward your chest in a tuck.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet with knees bent and prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Land quietly by absorbing the impact through the hips and knees and control the rebound

Health benefit: Enhances full body conditioning and cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and brace your core.
2. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground.
3. Kick your feet back into a plank and perform a push-up.
4. Jump feet forward, stand tall, and explode into a vertical jump with arms overhead.
Safety cue: Brace your core and land softly with knees bent and spine neutral

Health benefit: Builds explosive lower body power and leg muscle recruitment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend hips and knees into a quarter squat while swinging your arms back.
3. Explode upward and drive knees to your chest, landing both feet softly on the box.
4. Step or lightly jump back down and reset your stance.
Safety cue: Explode from the hips and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Develops exceptional core strength and trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and grip the edge behind your head.
2. Raise your legs and hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to feet.
3. Slowly lower legs and hips while keeping your torso rigid and shoulders anchored.
4. Control the descent until hips near the bench, then contract to raise back to start.
Safety cue: Hold a rigid torso and lower with slow controlled breathing

Health benefit: Improves single leg strength balance and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended straight in front of you.
2. Reach your arms forward and hinge at the hips while lowering into a single-leg squat.
3. Descend until your working thigh is near parallel to the floor or as low as control allows.
4. Drive through the heel to stand back up and keep the extended leg straight throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a stable support if needed.
2. Rise onto your toes and lean back while keeping knees moving forward over your toes.
3. Lower your knees forward and lean back until the thighs contract deeply.
4. Press through the toes to extend the knees and return to the upright position.
Safety cue: Keep an upright torso and control the descent through the knees

Health benefit: Enhances reactive leg power and neuromuscular efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a raised platform with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Step off the platform and drop to land softly on both feet.
3. Absorb the landing briefly and immediately explode upward into a vertical jump.
4. Land softly with bent knees and reset your position.
Safety cue: Step off with control and absorb the impact by bending knees and hips

Health benefit: Improves horizontal explosive power and hip drive
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips while swinging your arms back.
2. Bend knees into a quarter squat and prepare to explode forward.
3. Propel with hips and arms to jump forward for maximum distance.
4. Land softly on both feet with knees bent and hold your balance.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips and land balanced with soft knees

Health benefit: Develops rotational explosiveness and lower body power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and lower into a squat.
2. Explode upward while rotating hips and shoulders to turn 180 degrees in the air.
3. Land softly in a squat stance facing the opposite direction and reset.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and land softly with knees aligned over toes

Health benefit: Boosts unilateral strength and cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and place your hands on the ground in front of you.
2. Kick the free leg back into a single-leg plank while keeping hips level.
3. Perform a single-leg push-up, then tuck the leg and jump it toward your hands.
4. Stand and explode into a single-leg hop, then switch legs after completing reps.
Safety cue: Keep your core braced and move slowly to maintain balance on the single leg

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power balance and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Leap laterally to the opposite side, driving the trailing leg behind and swinging arms for momentum.
3. Land softly on the opposite leg in a wide stance and immediately push off into the next lateral leap.
Safety cue: Push wide but absorb each landing with a soft knee and stable hips

Health benefit: Builds lower body power and unilateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one foot forward and one foot back in a staggered lunge.
2. Jump explosively straight up while driving the back knee forward and the front knee back.
3. Switch leg positions mid-air and land softly in a lunge with knees bent.
4. Absorb the landing and immediately repeat the jump for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest upright

Health benefit: Develops core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and hands beside your hips.
2. Press into your hands and lift your hips and legs off the ground.
3. Hold your torso upright and legs straight so your body forms an “L.”
4. Squeeze your quads and hold the position for the desired time.
Safety cue: Press through shoulders, keep hips level and legs fully extended

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground into a hollow position.
3. Rock forward and back by using a small, controlled motion while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain a hollow position with lower back pressed to the floor and steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves rotational core strength and trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor while holding a weight at your chest.
2. Lean back slightly into your hips to create a braced core.
3. Rotate your torso and the weight to one side, then rotate to the other side.
4. Keep your feet elevated and maintain a tight midline throughout the twists.
Safety cue: Brace your core, keep a tall chest and rotate from the torso

Health benefit: Increases explosive lower limb power and jump coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start from a tall kneeling position with shins on the ground.
2. Explosively drive through your hips and push into your feet to jump up to standing.
3. Land softly on your feet with knees bent and absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and absorb the landing with soft knees and a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position facing a wall with your feet on the wall.
2. Walk your hands toward the wall while walking your feet up until your body is vertical.
3. Hold the vertical position briefly with a straight body line.
4. Walk your hands back out and walk your feet down to return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed, core tight and move deliberately hand over hand

Health benefit: Enhances upper body balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a freestanding handstand or press into a supported handstand.
2. Shift your weight to one hand and step the opposite hand forward slightly.
3. Continue taking small, controlled hand steps while maintaining a straight body.
4. Stop and lower down safely when you reach your turnaround point.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line through shoulders to wrists and control steps with shoulder strength

Health benefit: Develops hip drive and dynamic leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward while switching your legs in mid-air.
3. Land softly with the opposite leg forward in a split stance and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive knees high, land softly with hips square and maintain upright torso

Health benefit: Boosts lateral explosiveness and reactive ankle strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight knee bend.
2. Push laterally off that foot and leap sideways toward the opposite side.
3. Land on the opposite foot with a soft bend and immediately bound back explosively.
Safety cue: Push off the outside foot, land softly with hips low and chest up

Health benefit: Improves hip and ankle mobility while reinforcing squat mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Drop to your knees, sit back toward your heels, and lower your chest to the ground.
3. Roll or tuck through to a seated position and place hands on the ground.
4. Use your hands and legs to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and quad endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands clasped in front.
2. Sit back on your heels and drop into a deep squat until thighs pass parallel.
3. Explode upward onto the balls of your feet while swinging your arms.
4. Land softly and immediately begin the next squat with a rhythmic tempo.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted, core braced, and land softly with knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Enhances explosive leg power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one foot slightly ahead and knees soft.
2. Hop powerfully off the lead foot and land immediately on the other foot.
3. Push off that foot into a second hop and land back on the lead foot.
4. Finish with an explosive third jump forward and land softly with knees bent.
Safety cue: Absorb each landing with bent knees and drive through the hips between hops

Health benefit: Improves lateral explosiveness and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a low box with knees slightly bent.
2. Swing your arms and explode sideways, jumping both feet together onto and over the box.
3. Clear the box and land softly on the opposite side with knees bent.
4. Reset your stance and repeat the lateral jump back or continue walking over.
Safety cue: Lead with your hips and land softly on the box with knees aligned over toes

Health benefit: Builds lateral core stability and shoulder dynamic strength
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a side plank on your forearm with body in a straight line.
2. Explode upward by driving hips toward the ceiling while lifting the top arm and top leg.
3. Lower back into the side plank with control and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted, shoulder stacked over wrist, and control the descent and rebound

Health benefit: Increases unilateral leg strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back and across behind the front leg.
2. Lower slowly into a deep squat over the front leg while sliding the back knee toward the floor.
3. Keep the torso upright and reach hands toward the front foot for balance.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest, hinge at the hips, and lower with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Develops shoulder strength and balance during inverted movement
Steps to perform:
1. Face a clear wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor a few inches from the wall.
2. Lunge forward and kick one leg up while lifting the other leg to meet it toward the wall.
3. Press through the shoulders to stack hips over shoulders and find balance against the wall.
4. Lower one leg with control back to the floor to exit the handstand.
Safety cue: Drive through the shoulders, keep core tight, and kick up with small controlled bursts

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves spinal and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand, then hinge back and place hands on the floor to move into a full bridge position.
2. Walk your hands slowly toward your heels until you reach a high-bridge or full extension.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping hips lifted and chest open.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet and stand up with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances rotational power and multidirectional coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and rotate hips slightly to prepare for a turn.
2. Dip into a quarter squat and explode upward while driving your arms to rotate 360 degrees.
3. Spot your landing and land softly with knees bent to absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips, spot your landing, and absorb impact with soft knees

Health benefit: Develops single leg strength and lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a wide stance with feet turned slightly outward and arms extended.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight and toes up.
3. Push through the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds unilateral explosive power and running specific balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with the other knee lifted to hip height.
2. Drive the standing leg down and propel your body forward while pumping the opposite arm.
3. Land lightly on the same leg and immediately drive the knee up for the next stride.
4. Maintain quick, aggressive steps for the desired short sprint distance or time then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Anchor your feet and curl your torso up until your chest reaches your thighs.
3. Pause at the top while keeping your core engaged.
4. Lower slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral throughout the movement

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and lower back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach toward your toes with a straight or soft-knee leg.
3. Hold the stretch while breathing steadily.
4. Rise slowly to standing with a flat back.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a soft knee and maintain a long spine

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and encourages diaphragmatic breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop your belly while lifting your head and tailbone into cow.
3. Exhale and round your spine while tucking your chin into cat.
4. Move slowly through the full range linking each motion to your breath.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the cat and cow with controlled breaths and avoid jerky motion

Health benefit: Increases rotational mobility of the spine and hips
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to a T and knees bent.
2. Drop both knees to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Hold the twist and look toward the opposite hand.
4. Return knees to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders grounded and initiate the twist from the torso

Health benefit: Improves hamstring length and promotes lower back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and spine tall.
2. Hinge from the hips and reach toward your feet with a long spine.
3. Hold the forward fold while breathing and then rise slowly.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest, hinge at the hips, and maintain a long spine

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational strength and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Rotate your torso to one side while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and rotate to the opposite side with control.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage the core, and rotate from the thoracic spine with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and stretches chest and abdominal muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Press into your palms and lift your chest while keeping hips in contact with the floor.
3. Hold the lifted position and then lower back down slowly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Lengthens the spine while gently stretching hips and shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels, then fold forward with arms extended.
2. Reach one arm forward and the other to the side for an active reach.
3. Keep your chest toward your thighs and breathe into the stretch.
4. Return your hands to center or switch reaches.
Safety cue: Reach forward with control, lengthen the spine, and breathe into the back

Health benefit: Targets hip flexor lengthening and improves anterior hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot planted in front.
2. Tuck your pelvis and lean your hips forward while keeping your torso upright.
3. Raise the same-side arm and lean toward the opposite side to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold, then return to start and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lower back extensors and enhances posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor and squeeze your back and glutes.
3. Hold the static position, then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep the neck neutral, squeeze glutes and shoulder blades, and avoid hyperextending the spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and oblique muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Bend sideways at the waist toward one side, sliding your hand down the thigh.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and hinge from the hips to keep the spine neutral

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and posterior chain while promoting hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides.
2. Press your feet into the floor and drive your hips up to maximum height.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the top position.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the mat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor strength and increases cardiovascular warm up intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest to hip level while swinging the opposite arm.
3. Lower the foot and repeat on the other side in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall, drive knees up under control and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and improves spinal coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg fully back until both are straight.
3. Keep your hips level and core engaged while holding the extension.
4. Return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Reach opposite arm and leg while keeping hips square and core stable

Health benefit: Builds lower abdominal strength and challenges pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms by your sides.
2. Engage your core and lift both legs together until they reach a 45 to 90 degree angle.
3. Keep your lower back pressed into the mat and control the movement.
4. Lower your legs slowly toward the floor without letting the back arch.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the mat and lift legs slowly with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and encourages balance during controlled flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with the other knee bent.
2. Round your spine and pull the bent knee toward your chest with both hands.
3. Hold briefly, lower the foot, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and round through the spine while lifting the knee under control

Health benefit: Targets hip flexors and enhances lower abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead resting on your hands and legs extended.
2. Lift your legs a few inches off the floor and alternately flutter them up and down.
3. Keep your toes pointed and your core engaged throughout the motion.
Safety cue: Keep hips grounded and use small controlled pulses while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and strengthens lower body muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at the base of the stairs facing forward.
2. Drive one knee up and step onto the next stair quickly, pushing through the heel.
3. Continue stepping rapidly up and down the stairs in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Stay tall, push through the whole foot and use quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Promotes coordinated core activation and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and hips and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower one arm overhead and the opposite leg toward the floor simultaneously.
4. Return to center and repeat with the other arm and leg.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and move both limbs slowly to avoid arching

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip external rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped to the sides.
2. Hold your feet and sit tall with a long spine.
3. Lean forward from the hips while keeping your spine long and hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops inner thigh and glute strength while improving squat depth
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Hinge the hips back and lower deeply with chest lifted.
3. Keep knees tracking toes and weight in the heels.
4. Drive through heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility with core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and arms at sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach one hand toward the opposite foot.
3. Raise the other arm overhead and rotate the chest upward.
4. Return slowly to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a braced core and controlled reach

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles to support lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported.
2. Lift the top leg upward as high as possible with a straight knee.
3. Lower the leg back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged to control the lift

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular demand and strengthens lower body muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Step onto the inclined surface and stand tall.
2. Walk forward at a steady, controlled pace.
3. Maintain a tall posture and use a heel-toe stride.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall posture with a slight forward lean from the ankles

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and spinal rotation for better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees stacked and hips bent.
2. Extend both arms forward with the top arm crossing over.
3. Rotate the top arm and upper torso backward while looking toward the lifted hand.
4. Return to the start position with control.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine while keeping hips stacked

Health benefit: Challenges core endurance and hip flexor control during leg movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended.
2. Lift both legs up to a high angle and begin wide, controlled scissoring motions.
3. Cross one leg over the other while keeping the core engaged.
4. Continue alternating large-range scissor motions with steady control.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and move the legs with control

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and ankle dorsiflexion through full range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Bend at the hips and knees to lower into a deep squat below parallel.
3. Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Sit your hips back and down while keeping the chest up and spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and assists knee joint range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and balance on one leg.
2. Bend the other knee and reach back to grab the ankle or foot.
3. Pull the heel toward the glute while keeping knees close together.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and draw the heel toward the glute without arching the low back

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder endurance under load
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width under shoulders and extend legs behind you.
2. Form a straight line from head to heels and press through the palms.
3. Engage the core and glutes to maintain a neutral spine.
4. Hold the position for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Drive shoulders over wrists, keep hips level, and brace the core

Health benefit: Stretches posterior chain while promoting shoulder mobility and calf flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips up and back into an inverted V shape.
3. Straighten the legs as much as possible and press heels toward the floor.
4. Spread the fingers and relax the head between the arms.
Safety cue: Push hips up and back, lengthening the spine and pressing the heels toward the floor

Health benefit: Enhances oblique strength and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and clasp your hands together.
3. Twist your torso to the right and tap the floor beside your hip.
4. Twist to the left and repeat in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and rotate from the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Lift your right leg straight out to the side to hip height.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift the leg using hip control

Health benefit: Improves lateral movement speed and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Push off one foot and shuffle quickly to the side while staying low.
3. Keep your chest up and arms pumping for balance.
4. Reverse direction after several shuffles and repeat.
Safety cue: Stay low with chest up and take quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic hamstring flexibility and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step your left foot slightly forward.
2. Reach your right hand down toward your left toes as you cross your right leg over.
3. Return to standing and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and reach across while keeping a tall spine

Health benefit: Targets obliques and enhances core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift your shoulders and bring your right elbow toward your left knee while extending the right leg.
3. Switch sides by bringing your left elbow toward your right knee while extending the left leg.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled pedaling motion.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and twist with control

Health benefit: Boosts aerobic effort and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs.
3. Maintain a steady tempo and keep your hips level throughout.
Safety cue: Hold a strong plank and drive knees smoothly without bouncing

Health benefit: Challenges full core and increases abdominal strength and control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat with arms extended overhead and legs together.
2. Simultaneously lift your torso and legs to form a V shape.
3. Reach your hands toward your toes at the top of the movement.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Engage the core and lift with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Develops isometric core endurance and spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground while reaching your arms overhead.
3. Hold the hollow position for the desired time without arching the lower back.
Safety cue: Draw the ribs down and press the lower back gently into the floor

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with lateral cardio movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet together and hands under shoulders.
2. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while keeping a strong plank.
3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels and a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move the feet steadily without dropping hips

Health benefit: Provides full body conditioning and improves functional strength and aerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then squat down and place hands on the floor.
2. Step one foot back and then the other to reach a high plank.
3. Step both feet forward to your hands and stand up or perform a small jump.
4. Repeat at a controlled pace, stepping back instead of jumping if needed.
Safety cue: Land softly, keep core tight and stand through the hips with control

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat with weight on your right leg and arms at your sides.
2. Jump laterally to the left and land on your left foot while sweeping your right foot behind you.
3. Absorb the landing with a soft knee and immediately push off into the next jump.
4. Continue alternating sides with controlled, rhythmic jumps.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest up

Health benefit: Builds lower body power and explosive leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet shoulder-width and chest up.
2. Lower into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees.
3. Explode upward into a vertical jump, extending hips and knees.
Safety cue: Brace the core and land softly with knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands by your sides and knees bent.
2. Curl your hips off the floor by pulling your knees toward your chest.
3. Lower your hips slowly without letting your feet touch the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift hips with controlled lower abdominal contraction and avoid swinging the legs

Health benefit: Improves core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and hang with legs extended.
2. Brace your core and exhale while lifting your knees toward your chest.
3. Pause at the top and squeeze your abs.
4. Lower your legs with control back to the hang and repeat.
