Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and lift knees with core control, avoiding momentum

Health benefit: Combines upper body strength with shoulder stability and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor while driving your right knee to your right elbow.
3. Push back up to plank and return the right leg.
4. Repeat the movement on the left side, alternating each rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops shoulder strength and vertical pressing control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward the floor.
3. Push through your shoulders to return to the pike position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine, tuck the chin, and lower with controlled shoulder engagement

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and oblique endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop up on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to feet.
3. Hold the position, keeping hips elevated and core engaged.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple feet in front of a bench and place the top of your back foot on the bench.
2. Lower your back knee toward the floor by bending the front knee until the front thigh is near parallel.
3. Push through your front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat for reps then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee aligned over the toes and torso upright with the core engaged

Health benefit: Increases lower body strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a large step forward with one foot.
2. Lower your hips until both knees are near 90 degrees and the back knee moves toward the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place your hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward until you reach a full plank with a straight line from head to heels.
3. Pause briefly in the plank with core engaged.
4. Walk your feet toward your hands, stand up, and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hips low and knees bent under hips.
2. Move one hand and the opposite foot forward a small step.
3. Continue alternating hand and foot while keeping hips steady and eyes forward.
4. Crawl forward for distance or time using controlled, quick steps.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and brace the core while moving with control

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and enhances hip extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drive one heel toward the ceiling while keeping the knee bent.
3. Extend the leg upward into a high kick, squeezing the glute at the top.
4. Return the foot under the hip and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core engaged as you extend the leg

Health benefit: Enhances explosive leg power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a standing squat with hands on the floor between your feet.
2. Jump both feet back into a plank position and immediately jump them forward toward the hands.
3. From the squat, explode forward into a small forward jump.
4. Land softly into the squat and repeat the pattern continuously.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box or bench with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step one foot fully onto the box and press through the heel to drive the body up.
3. Bring the trailing foot up and stand tall on the box with hips extended.
4. Step down controlled with the same lead foot and repeat, then switch lead legs.
Safety cue: Press through the heel and keep your torso upright as you step up

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a deep lunge with the front knee over the ankle.
2. Twist your torso toward the front leg while keeping the hips facing forward.
3. Push through the front heel to stand and bring the back foot forward.
4. Repeat the lunge and twist on the other leg as you walk forward.
Safety cue: Keep front knee over the ankle and rotate from the torso not the knees

Health benefit: Improves high intensity cardiovascular fitness and leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Assume an athletic stance with hips low and chest forward.
2. Drive explosively forward using powerful strides and high knee lift.
3. Maintain full speed for the set distance or time and decelerate gradually.
Safety cue: Lean slightly from the ankles with a tall chest and quick controlled strides

Health benefit: Increases running cadence and hamstring activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and jog in place or move forward with quick steps.
2. Pull your heel up to touch the glute on each stride.
3. Keep a rapid cadence and relaxed arms while continuing the movement.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and drive heels toward glutes with soft landings

Health benefit: Improves sprint mechanics and cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin jogging in place or moving forward.
2. Drive one knee up toward hip level with a quick, forceful motion.
3. Alternate knees rapidly while pumping your arms and maintaining upright posture.
Safety cue: Drive knees up with an upright posture and relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Develops core stability and quick full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low crouch or from the floor with hands near the toes.
2. Explode up and pop one foot forward and the other back into a staggered surfer stance.
3. Rotate the torso toward the front leg and reach arms for balance.
4. Return to the crouch or repeat the pop-up rhythmically on the other side.
Safety cue: Move smoothly keeping a neutral spine and land with soft knees

Health benefit: Combines lower body strength with aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a shoulder-width squat with knees bent and chest up.
2. Jump feet wide while keeping hips low and arms overhead.
3. Jump feet back together into the squat and continue at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, core braced and land softly with knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and glute activation while enhancing core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind your hips.
2. Lift your hips off the ground into a tabletop position.
3. Step your right hand and left foot forward together.
4. Continue alternating hand and foot steps to move forward or backward.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and core braced while moving with slow controlled steps

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and strengthens hamstrings and posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while reaching toward the standing foot.
3. Raise the free leg behind you so your torso and lifted leg form a straight line.
4. Drive the hips forward and return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder endurance while improving resistance to rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Brace your core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder.
3. Alternate taps while minimizing hip rotation.
Safety cue: Brace your core and minimize hip rotation while alternating shoulder taps

Health benefit: Builds lower body muscular endurance and improves hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a lunge with both knees at about 90 degrees.
2. Lower and raise your hips in small pulses within the lower half of the lunge.
3. Repeat pulses for the set then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the toes and pulse with controlled depth

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift your legs a few inches off the floor.
2. Point your toes and perform quick alternating up-and-down kicks.
3. Keep your lower back pressed lightly into the floor throughout.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and use small controlled kicks while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Develops lateral power, agility, and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot and bend the knee slightly.
2. Jump laterally to the opposite side and land on the other foot.
3. Swing the trailing leg behind and reach toward the landing foot with the opposite arm.
4. Push off immediately and repeat the lateral hops.
Safety cue: Land softly on the midfoot with knees slightly bent and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves oblique strength and spinal rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift both legs toward the ceiling with knees slightly bent.
2. Tighten your core and lower both legs to one side until they hover over the floor.
3. Bring the legs back through center and lower them to the opposite side.
4. Control the motion and repeat side-to-side wipers.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds high level core strength and full trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and grip behind your head with both hands.
2. Press through your shoulders and lift your torso and legs into a straight line.
3. Lower your body slowly by hinging at the shoulders while keeping your body rigid.
4. Stop just before your back touches the bench and repeat the lift.
Safety cue: Maintain a rigid straight line from shoulders to toes and lower with slow controlled tension

Health benefit: Develops abdominal strength and hanging grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and legs together.
2. Engage your core and lift your legs toward the bar.
3. Touch the bar or bring your toes as close as possible to it.
4. Lower your legs back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Engage your lats and core to reduce swing and lift toes with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves full body conditioning, cardiovascular fitness, and explosive power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then lower into a squat and place your hands on the floor.
2. Kick your feet back into a plank and perform a push-up.
3. Jump your feet back to the squat position.
4. Explode upward into a jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Keep a braced core through the plank and land the jump softly with bent knees

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Bend into a quarter squat and swing your arms back.
3. Explode upward and pull both knees toward your chest.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and reset.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest up

Health benefit: Builds explosive leg strength and confidence in landing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy high box with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips and swing your arms while loading your legs.
3. Explode up and land both feet fully on the box with soft knees.
4. Step down slowly and prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and land softly with knees and hips aligned

Health benefit: Enhances single leg strength and balance through deep range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended straight in front.
2. Reach your arms forward and keep your chest tall.
3. Lower slowly into a single-leg squat, keeping the extended leg off the ground.
4. Push through the heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep weight on the heel and maintain a tall neutral spine

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and improves knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with knees hip-width and feet anchored or toes tucked.
2. Push your knees forward while leaning your torso back and extending your knees.
3. Control the descent by keeping hips forward and chest upright.
Safety cue: Control the descent and keep the torso upright with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves reactive strength and fast force production for better explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a box with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Step off the box and land softly on both feet with bent knees.
3. Immediately explode upward into a maximal vertical jump.
4. Land softly and step back onto the box to repeat.
Safety cue: Step off under control and absorb the landing by bending at the hips and knees

Health benefit: Increases horizontal power and coordination for long distance jumping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips.
2. Swing your arms and load your legs into a powerful countermovement.
3. Explode forward into a two-footed jump for maximum distance.
4. Land on both feet and absorb the impact through hips and knees.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips and swing the arms while landing with soft knees

Health benefit: Develops rotational power and rapid change of direction ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Drop into a shallow squat while preparing your arms for an upward drive.
3. Explode into a jump and rotate your body 180 degrees in the air.
4. Land softly facing the opposite direction and absorb the landing.
Safety cue: Spot the landing and land with knees soft to control the 180 degree rotation

Health benefit: Combines cardiovascular conditioning with unilateral strength and stability demands
Steps to perform:
1. Stand balanced on one leg with the other knee slightly bent off the ground.
2. Place hands on the floor and kick the free leg back into a plank position.
3. Jump your feet forward toward your hands, landing on the same single leg.
4. Explode upward into a single-leg jump and repeat.
Safety cue: Move slowly through transitions and keep hips level during the single-leg phases

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance for side to side movements
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight athletic squat with feet hip-width.
2. Bound laterally onto one leg, landing wide and reaching the opposite leg behind you.
3. Push off that leg and explode to the opposite side for maximum lateral width.
Safety cue: Push off powerfully and land with hips square and knees tracking forward

Health benefit: Builds explosive single leg strength and improves hip extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge with one foot forward and one foot back.
2. Bend both knees into the lunge while keeping your torso upright.
3. Explode upward and switch legs in midair.
4. Land softly in the opposite lunge and repeat.
Safety cue: Land with the front knee over the ankle and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Develops core strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands beside your hips on parallettes or on the floor.
2. Press down through the hands and lift the hips off the ground.
3. Extend the legs straight out in front to form an L shape.
4. Hold the position and keep the shoulders packed.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and press shoulders down away from the ears

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and body tension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms overhead and legs extended.
2. Engage the core and lift the shoulders and legs slightly into a hollow position.
3. Rock back and forth using small controlled motions while keeping the hollow shape.
Safety cue: Maintain a hollow shape with the lower back pressed to the floor and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet lifted off the ground, leaning back slightly.
2. Hold your hands together or a weight at chest height.
3. Rotate the torso and move the hands to one side of the hips.
4. Twist through the midline to the opposite side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Rotate from the ribs with a tall spine and control the movement

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower body power and jumping coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on the floor with a tall chest and hands by your sides.
2. Swing the arms and explosively jump up to land on your feet.
3. Absorb the landing softly and return to kneeling to repeat.
Safety cue: Explode up and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core strength while enhancing stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a plank with your feet against a wall and hands under shoulders.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer to the wall until your chest approaches vertical.
3. Walk your hands back out and down the wall to return to the starting plank.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over wrists and keep the core engaged

Health benefit: Develops balance shoulder strength and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick or press into a freestanding handstand with straight arms and a tight body.
2. Find balance by engaging the shoulders and core.
3. Shift weight onto one hand and then onto the other to take a small step forward.
4. Continue alternating hand steps to walk while maintaining alignment.
Safety cue: Shift weight deliberately through the shoulders while keeping a tight core

Health benefit: Enhances single leg power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge position with one foot forward and hands by your hips.
2. Drive through the front leg and explode upward while switching the leg positions mid-air.
3. Land softly into the opposite lunge and repeat continuously.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees flexed and chest up

Health benefit: Improves lateral power agility and dynamic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a slight hip hinge and weight on one leg.
2. Explode laterally off the standing leg and land on the opposite leg.
3. Absorb the landing with a soft bend and immediately bound back to the other side.
Safety cue: Push off through the standing hip and land quietly with hips square

Health benefit: Enhances lower body control and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and lower to the knees while reaching hands back toward the floor.
2. Sit back and slowly collapse onto your back while keeping control.
3. Roll to your chest and use your hands to pull your torso forward to a kneeling position.
4. Drive through the knees to stand up tall and reset.
Safety cue: Control the descent and keep a neutral spine as you return to standing

Health benefit: Builds lower body muscular endurance and cardiovascular stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the balls of your feet with heels slightly raised and hands clasped in front.
2. Bend the knees and drop the hips back and down while keeping the chest upright.
3. Drive through the balls of the feet to return to the starting upright position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and ensure knees track over toes through the full range

Health benefit: Improves lower body power and explosive jumping ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and bend knees slightly.
2. Jump vertically three times in quick succession using a quick recoil.
3. Land softly on both feet and bend knees to absorb impact.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and coordination during side-to-side movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside the box with feet shoulder-width.
2. Swing arms and jump laterally over the box using both feet.
3. Land softly and immediately rebound back across the box.
Safety cue: Step or hop over the box with controlled foot placement and an upright chest

Health benefit: Increases core strength and dynamic stability through explosive lateral loading
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift hips into a straight line and brace your core.
3. Push your hips up explosively and lower back down with control.
4. Repeat for the desired reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced during each push and landing

Health benefit: Builds single-leg strength and hip mobility for controlled deep squatting
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and hands in front for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and step the other leg diagonally behind you.
3. Lower into a deep single-leg squat while keeping chest upright.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a tall chest and control the descent

Health benefit: Improves shoulder control and upper body balance during inverted skill practice
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge with hands on the ground shoulder-width apart.
2. Kick the back leg up and follow with the front leg toward vertical.
3. Reach a straight handstand line while keeping core tight.
4. Control the descent by lowering one leg back to the lunge.
Safety cue: Kick up with control and maintain a hollow core and straight shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and enhances spinal extension mobility through active movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Press hips up into a full bridge and lift chest.
3. Walk your hands toward your heels until you feel a full arch.
4. Walk hands back, lower hips, and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and neck neutral while controlling each walk-out step

Health benefit: Develops rotational power and spatial awareness during multi-directional explosive movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and bend knees slightly.
2. Swing arms and explode upward while rotating your body 360 degrees.
3. Spot your landing and land softly with knees bent.
Safety cue: Rotate under control and absorb the landing with soft, bent knees

Health benefit: Promotes unilateral leg control and load distribution with enhanced glute and adductor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and arms out for balance.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while straightening the other leg.
3. Sit back into the bent leg keeping chest up and depth controlled.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit back onto the working heel with chest upright and knee tracking the toes

Health benefit: Improves single-leg power and balance while training sprint mechanics at high intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and arms ready.
2. Drive the knee up and sprint in place or forward using quick contacts.
3. Maintain fast ground contact and switch legs after the set.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall torso and control each foot strike on the sprint leg

Health benefit: Enhances full-body coordination and functional strength through complex positional transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back holding one arm straight up and the same-side knee bent.
2. Press the weighted arm up and roll to the opposite elbow then to your hand.
3. Push through the planted foot to come to a lunge and stand tall.
4. Reverse the steps to return to the starting lying position.
Safety cue: Move slowly with the shoulder packed and stabilize each position

Health benefit: Strengthens upper abdominal muscles and improves core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place hands lightly behind your head without pulling on the neck.
3. Curl your shoulders toward your knees using your abdominal muscles.
4. Lower your upper back with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck chin and use abs to lift, keeping hands light on your head

Health benefit: Enhances neck mobility and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with shoulders relaxed and spine straight.
2. Tuck your chin slightly and roll your head slowly in a smooth circular motion.
3. Complete the circle by bringing your head back to center and reverse direction.
Safety cue: Rotate the neck slowly with control and keep shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal muscles and challenges hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat with legs extended and hands under your hips.
2. Lift your head and shoulders off the mat and brace your core.
3. Raise both legs up toward vertical while keeping them straight.
4. Lower your legs slowly without letting your feet touch the ground and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and chest mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with hands under your shoulders and toes on the mat.
2. Press through your palms to lift your chest and arch your upper back.
3. Tilt your head back and look upward while keeping shoulders down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with arms extended forward and forehead facing down.
2. Simultaneously lift your chest, arms, and legs while keeping your gaze forward.
3. Hold briefly at the top and lower all limbs back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility while encouraging relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and feet flexed toward your shins.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your hands toward your feet.
3. Allow your head to hang heavy and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves upper trapezius activation and shoulder elevation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Shrug your shoulders upward toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Lower your shoulders back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Raise shoulders slowly and lower with control, keeping the neck long and breathing steadily

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinated breathing with movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Inhale and drop your belly, lift your chest, and look up for the cow position.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tuck your chin toward your chest, and press your mid-back up for the cat.
4. Flow slowly between the two positions with each breath.
Safety cue: Move smoothly between positions, keep core braced and avoid forcing an extreme neck arch

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and trunk coordination during twisting
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands on your hips or extended in front.
2. Rotate your torso to one side and turn your head to follow your chest.
3. Return to center and rotate to the opposite side with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activation and improves hip flexor coordination when performed briskly
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee sharply toward your chest while swinging the opposite arm.
2. Lower that leg quickly and lift the other knee in the same jerky motion.
3. Continue alternating knees in a brisk, marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core stability and spinal coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees while looking up.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until they are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold briefly and keep your gaze upward.
4. Lower both limbs back and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep neck aligned with your spine and maintain a neutral gaze

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and lower body muscular stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Start with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart, pressing the back of your head to the wall.
2. Slide down until your knees are about 90 degrees while keeping your head pressed.
3. Hold the squat position and breathe evenly.
4. Push through your heels to slide up and stand tall while maintaining head contact with the wall.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances cardiovascular fitness and full body movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump your feet out wide while raising your arms overhead.
3. Jump your feet back together while lowering your arms to your sides.
4. Continue at a steady pace and land softly on each jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back to absorb impact

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and oblique muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width apart and drop your head forward.
2. Place one hand on your thigh and reach the other arm overhead.
3. Bend your torso to the side toward the hand on your thigh.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs stacked over hips and hinge from the waist while controlling the side bend

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and hip flexors while improving endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying face down with legs extended and chest lifted while keeping your head up.
2. Engage your core and lift both legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Alternate quick, small kicks up and down with straight legs.
4. Keep your head lifted and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates glutes and hamstrings to support posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying on your back with knees bent and feet flat while tucking your chin to your chest.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top while keeping your chin tucked.
4. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances spinal extension control and strengthens posterior chain muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
2. Press through your feet and lift your hips high while driving your shoulders into the mat.
3. Hold the high position and actively squeeze your glutes and core.
4. Lower your hips slowly with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders grounded and neck long while lifting through the hips with control

Health benefit: Improves lower body power and cardiovascular conditioning through functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start at the base of the stairs with your eyes directed downward.
2. Step up one stair with your right foot and follow with your left foot.
3. Step back down one stair leading with your right foot and lower the left.
4. Continue climbing at a steady pace while keeping your gaze downward.
Safety cue: Lift your chest, look forward, and drive through the whole foot on each step

Health benefit: Promotes core stability and coordinated limb movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying on your back with knees bent and your head lifted off the floor.
2. Extend one leg and the opposite arm slowly toward the floor.
3. Return both limbs to the starting position while keeping your head lifted.
4. Repeat with the opposite arm and leg in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and brace your core while moving limbs slowly to protect the neck

Health benefit: Encourages relaxation and gentle spinal elongation in a resting posture
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on the floor and sit back on your heels.
2. Reach your arms forward and lower your torso toward your thighs while lifting your chest.
3. Extend your neck and lift your gaze upward.
4. Breathe calmly and hold the position.
Safety cue: Rest your forehead on the mat and lengthen the neck while breathing deeply

Health benefit: Strengthens lower body muscles and improves unilateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step one foot straight back into a lunge position.
3. Lower your back knee toward the floor.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and gaze forward to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and hip extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee.
2. Reach back and grab your ankle.
3. Pull the heel toward your glute while keeping knees close.
Safety cue: Stand tall, pull heel to glute and keep the knee tracking over the ankle

Health benefit: Opens chest and enhances shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place forearms on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the doorway.
3. Allow the chest to open and gently bring the neck forward.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Draw shoulder blades down and back and retract the chin to lengthen the neck

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and leg muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Set the treadmill to a moderate incline and a steady pace.
2. Walk with upright posture and quick, controlled steps.
3. Maintain the effort until breathing becomes heavy.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply from the diaphragm and stay upright with relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine mobility and trunk rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms extended to the sides.
2. Drop both knees to one side while rotating your head the opposite way.
3. Return knees to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders grounded and rotate through the thoracic spine while stabilizing the hips

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and enhances lower abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and hands under your hips.
2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly and brace your core.
3. Alternate lifting one leg while lowering the other in a scissor motion.
4. Continue alternating with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Support your head with your hands and keep the neck long while engaging the core

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and reinforces hip and knee coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat.
3. Drive through your heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Sit back into the hips, keep chest up and eyes forward to preserve spinal alignment

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh strength and hip adductor mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned outward.
2. Bend knees and lower hips into a plie while keeping your back straight.
3. Push through heels to rise and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine, lengthen the neck and control the descent with the glutes

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder girdle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands under shoulders and step feet back into a straight line.
2. Engage your core and keep hips level.
3. Keep your head aligned with your spine.
4. Hold the position with steady breaths.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Stretches posterior chain and promotes hamstring and calf flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift hips toward the ceiling into an inverted V.
2. Press hands into the mat and straighten your legs as comfortable.
3. Let your head hang between your arms.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational strength and oblique muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet lifted, torso leaning back.
2. Twist your torso to the right and reach both hands beside your hip while looking over your right shoulder.
3. Twist to the left and reach both hands beside your hip while looking over your left shoulder.
4. Continue alternating controlled twists while keeping the core engaged.
Safety cue: Rotate from your torso with a neutral neck

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips and tilt your head toward your right shoulder.
2. Lift your left leg out to the side with a straight knee and toes pointed forward.
3. Lower the left leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall with shoulders level and head aligned over the spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and quick movement efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low athletic stance with knees bent and weight on the balls of your feet.
2. Push off with your right foot and take a quick, jerky shuffle to the left.
3. Reverse the motion by pushing off with your left foot and shuffle back to the right.
4. Maintain a low position and repeat lateral shuffles.
Safety cue: Use controlled small steps to maintain rhythm and balance

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and cross your right leg over your left while lifting it slightly.
2. Reach your left hand down and toward your right toe, hinging at the hips.
3. Lower your leg and hands, then repeat the movement on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine as you reach toward the toe

Health benefit: Increases abdominal endurance and oblique muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees lifted.
2. Lift your shoulders and extend your right leg while bringing your left elbow toward your right knee.
3. Quickly switch sides by extending your left leg and bringing your right elbow toward your left knee.
4. Continue alternating rapidly with controlled shoulder lifts.
Safety cue: Slow the tempo and control each rep with a braced core

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with shoulders over wrists and head relaxed slightly lower.
2. Drive your right knee toward your chest and then quickly switch, driving your left knee forward.
3. Continue alternating knees at a steady, quick pace while keeping your hips stable.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and neck in line with the spine

Health benefit: Provides full body conditioning with reduced joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, squat down and place both hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Step your right foot back and then your left foot back into a plank.
3. Step your right foot forward and then your left foot forward back into a squat.
4. Rise up and reach your arms overhead to complete the modified burpee.
Safety cue: Move deliberately through each phase and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds core strength and improves static balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit and lean back slightly while lifting both legs to form a V shape.
2. Reach your hands toward your toes with your head leaning forward.
3. Hold the balanced V position and then lower with control.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin and lift through the chest to keep a long spine

Health benefit: Develops deep core endurance and spinal stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor while lifting your shoulders and legs a few inches.
2. Extend your arms overhead and engage your core, keeping your head slightly raised.
3. Hold the hollow position and maintain steady breathing.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and breathe steadily while bracing the core

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with light cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Jump both feet out wide and then back together, maintaining plank position.
3. Keep your hips level and core tight throughout the jumps.
4. Continue jumping feet in and out at a controlled speed.
Safety cue: Maintain a tight plank and land lightly to reduce impact

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and bend the knee slightly.
2. Explode sideways into a lateral jump while swinging your arms.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot and absorb with a bent knee.
4. Push off immediately and repeat to alternate sides.
Safety cue: Land softly on a bent knee and keep chest up to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lower-body power and teaches force absorption during landing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and lower into a shallow squat.
2. Explode upward into a controlled vertical jump.
3. Land softly on midfoot and bend knees to absorb impact.
4. Reset posture and repeat with light, controlled landings.
Safety cue: Absorb the landing through hips and knees with a controlled soft bend

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal control while promoting safe neck stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hands by your sides.
2. Engage your core and curl your hips toward your ribs to lift your lower back off the floor.
3. Lower your hips with control until your feet return near the mat.
4. Keep your neck relaxed and maintain a steady breath throughout.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and keep the neck long while lifting with the abs

Health benefit: Develops core and hip flexor strength while improving swing control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar and hang with shoulders engaged.
2. Brace your core and drive your knees up toward your chest.
3. Lower your legs slowly while controlling any swinging motion.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom before initiating the next raise.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lift without swinging to control the movement

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and hip mobility through integrated core movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor while bringing one knee to its same-side elbow.
3. Push back up and return the leg to plank, then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core tight as you drive the knee toward the elbow

Health benefit: Builds overhead pressing strength and shoulder endurance in a forehead-down position
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a pike position with hips high and arms straight.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor with control.
3. Push through your shoulders to extend your arms and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral neck and gaze slightly forward while pressing through the shoulders

Health benefit: Improves lateral core endurance while challenging neck and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side and prop your torso on your elbow with feet stacked.
2. Lift your hips into a straight line and tilt your head slightly toward your shoulder.
3. Hold the straight body line while breathing and keeping hips elevated.
Safety cue: Keep your neck in line with your spine and shoulders stacked

Health benefit: Increases single-leg strength and balance while improving hip and knee control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a step in front of a bench and place the top of your rear foot on the bench.
2. Lower into a lunge by bending your front knee until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core to maintain balance.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep your torso upright, front knee tracking over the foot, and lower with control

Health benefit: Enhances functional leg strength and trains controlled forward impact absorption
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a long step forward.
2. Lower until both knees form roughly 90-degree angles and land softly.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Step through with control, land softly, and keep the front knee aligned over the ankle

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder and hamstring mobility while reinforcing core stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place your hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward into a plank while keeping your head aligned with your spine.
3. Walk your feet toward your hands by small steps while maintaining a neutral head position.
4. Walk your hands forward again into plank and then walk your feet back to stand.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds full body strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hips low and eyes forward.
2. Move the opposite hand and foot forward together in small steps.
3. Keep core tight and maintain a steady, controlled pace.
4. Continue crawling forward for the desired distance or time.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and core braced while moving with controlled steps

Health benefit: Activates glutes and improves hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral neck and core braced.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling by extending the hip with a bent knee.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower the knee with control to just above the floor and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and core engaged to prevent head snapping

Health benefit: Enhances explosive power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with hands on the floor between your feet.
2. Kick both feet back into a plank position quickly.
3. Jump both feet forward back to your hands and explode upward into a small jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens legs and improves unilateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step one foot fully onto the box and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to stand tall on the box.
4. Step down with the same leading foot and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Step up through the heel and stand tall with a braced core

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and rotational core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and eyes forward.
2. Step forward into a deep lunge and lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping the core tight.
4. Push through the front heel to rise and step forward into the next lunge, alternating legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted, core braced, and rotate from the torso not the neck

Health benefit: Boosts anaerobic capacity and sprinting speed
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with a slight forward lean from the ankles and eyes forward.
2. Accelerate by driving knees up and pumping arms aggressively.
3. Maintain a rapid leg turnover and sprint for the desired distance or time.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral head and tall posture while driving with powerful arm swings

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and leg turnover
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin a light jog in place or forward.
2. Pull each heel up toward the glute on every step.
3. Pump your arms and land lightly on the balls of your feet while keeping a quick pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and pull heels toward glutes with controlled cadence

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular conditioning and hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and run in place or forward.
2. Drive each knee up toward hip level on every step.
3. Pump your arms and land on the balls of your feet with quick turnover.
Safety cue: Drive knees high from the hips while keeping chest upright and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves explosive standing transitions and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying prone with hands under your shoulders and eyes forward.
2. Push up explosively and bring one foot forward under your body near your hand.
3. Bring the back foot forward to land in a low, stable athletic stance.
4. Stabilize briefly, then return to prone or repeat, alternating lead foot.
Safety cue: Pop up smoothly with a neutral spine and absorb landing through the knees

Health benefit: Combines strength and cardio for improved lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while lowering into a squat with chest up and knees tracking.
3. Jump feet back together and return to standing, then repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder and core stability while strengthening posterior chain muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat, knees bent, and hands on the floor behind you with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press into your hands and feet and lift your hips until your torso forms a tabletop.
3. Step one hand and the opposite foot backward together, then bring the other hand and foot to follow.
4. Keep hips lifted and move in controlled steps while facing forward.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and gaze forward with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops single-leg balance and hamstring and glute strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg, hinge at the hips, and lift the other leg straight back.
2. Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and maintain a flat back as you lower your torso.
3. Reach your hands toward the floor or a weight while the raised leg stays in line with the torso.
4. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the standing glute to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds core stability and anti-rotation control while improving shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while bracing the core and minimizing hip rotation.
3. Alternate taps in a controlled rhythm and keep hips stable throughout.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep hips level as you tap each shoulder

Health benefit: Increases muscular endurance in quads and glutes while reinforcing knee and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Step one foot forward into a lunge and lower until both knees are about 90 degrees.
2. Pulse up and down a few inches by bending and straightening the front knee while keeping weight centered.
3. Complete the pulses, then step back and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and front knee tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control while encouraging neck stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands lightly supporting the base of your skull and elbows wide.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the ground and engage the core.
3. Flutter the legs up and down in small, rapid scissor-like motions while keeping the lower back pressed to the floor.
4. Keep the neck supported by the hands and maintain steady breathing.
Safety cue: Press the head gently into your hands and engage the core to protect the neck

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and single-leg balance while enhancing coordination and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a quarter squat on one leg with the other leg slightly behind you.
2. Leap laterally to the opposite side, landing softly on the other foot and sweeping the trailing leg behind.
3. Absorb the landing with a bent knee and immediately push off into the next hop.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and keep hips level during each lateral hop

Health benefit: Improves core rotational control and oblique strength while enhancing hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides and legs raised toward the ceiling.
2. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and lower both legs together to one side in a controlled motion.
3. Draw the legs back up to center and lower them to the opposite side with the same control.
4. Continue alternating sides while stabilizing through the core and shoulders.
Safety cue: Move slowly keeping the lower back pressed to the floor and legs controlled

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and upper back strength while improving balance and spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Face away from the wall, place hands on the floor shoulder-width apart, and kick up so your heels touch the wall.
2. Keep arms straight, shoulders active, and body in a straight line from wrists to heels.
3. Engage the core and glutes to maintain alignment and avoid arching the back.
4. Hold the position for the desired time, then step one foot down to exit.
Safety cue: Reach through the shoulders and maintain a hollow body with ribs down

Health benefit: Increases overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability while challenging core control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick into a handstand with your back to the wall and hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Bend the elbows and lower your head toward the floor in a controlled manner.
3. Pause briefly at the bottom with eyes near the floor.
4. Press through the hands to straighten the arms and return to the handstand.
Safety cue: Lower with control keeping elbows tucked and core braced

Health benefit: Builds abdominal and hip flexor strength while improving grip endurance and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and engage the lats and core.
2. Swing your legs up and raise your toes toward the bar by curling the hips and contracting the abdominal muscles.
3. Control the descent back to a full hang and reset before the next repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances full body power and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Kick feet back into a plank and perform a quick push-up.
3. Jump feet forward under your hips and explode upward into a high jump.
4. Land softly into a squat and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Brace your core and maintain a neutral spine while landing softly

Health benefit: Develops lower body explosiveness and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and bend knees slightly.
2. Swing arms and jump up while pulling knees toward your chest.
3. Land softly on midfoot and immediately prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and keep chest tall

Health benefit: Improves leg power and reactive strength for dynamic movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet shoulder-width and bend knees.
2. Swing arms and explode upward onto the box, landing with both feet.
3. Land softly with knees bent and hold balance.
4. Step down carefully one foot at a time to reset.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens core control and posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and grip the bench edges behind your head.
2. Raise legs and hips so your body forms a straight line from shoulders to feet.
3. Lower the body slowly while keeping the core rigid and shoulders on the bench.
4. Stop before the hips touch and press upward to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and core tight to control the lowering phase

Health benefit: Enhances single leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and extend the other leg forward at hip height.
2. Reach arms forward and hinge at the hips while lowering into a single-leg squat.
3. Keep the supporting knee tracking over the toes and control the descent.
4. Push through the heel to stand back up while keeping the extended leg straight.
Safety cue: Sit back onto the working heel and keep the chest upright with controlled balance

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps development and knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a stable support if needed.
2. Rise onto your toes and lean the knees forward while keeping the torso upright.
3. Lower the knees forward until you feel tension, then return to the starting upright position.
Safety cue: Keep the torso upright, brace the core, and control the descent

Health benefit: Boosts reactive strength and improves power production off surfaces
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a sturdy box and step off forward with both feet together.
2. Absorb the landing by bending your knees and hips softly.
3. Immediately explode upward into a maximal vertical jump.
4. Land softly and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Step down with control and absorb impact through hips and knees

Health benefit: Increases horizontal explosive strength and coordination for athletic movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and load the hips by swinging the arms back.
2. Explode forward with a powerful double-leg jump and drive the arms forward.
3. Land on both feet with bent knees and step back to the start.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances rotational power and lower body explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and lower into a squat.
2. Explode upward while rotating your hips and feet 180 degrees in midair.
3. Land softly into a squat facing the opposite direction.
4. Reset your stance and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips, spot your landing, and absorb the landing with bent knees

Health benefit: Combines unilateral strength and cardiovascular challenge for functional fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg and place hands on the floor as you lower into a single-leg squat.
2. Kick the free leg back into a plank while keeping weight on the supporting leg.
3. Perform a push-up, then pull the foot forward toward your hands.
4. Explode upward from the supporting leg into a jump and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace the core, move deliberately through each phase, and land softly on the working leg

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and agility through explosive side to side movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent.
2. Push off laterally and leap to the opposite foot.
3. Land softly on the foot and sweep the other foot behind.
4. Repeat the movement explosively toward the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and hips engaged

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg power and hip stability through dynamic plyometric lunges
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a staggered lunge with one foot forward.
2. Bend both knees into a deep lunge.
3. Explode upward and switch feet midair.
4. Land softly with the opposite foot forward and continue.
Safety cue: Control the descent and keep the front knee aligned over the ankle

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and shoulder stability while challenging hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit between parallel bars or on the floor with hands beside hips.
2. Press down through hands to lift hips and extend legs straight in front.
3. Shrug shoulders upward while maintaining the L position.
4. Hold the position with legs extended and shoulders elevated.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders depressed and neck long while holding the L‑sit

Health benefit: Reinforces deep core stability and spinal alignment through sustained hollow position
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs to create a hollow shape.
3. Reach your arms overhead and maintain a long body line.
Safety cue: Press your lower back toward the floor and keep ribs down to protect the spine

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and oblique strength for better torso control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet lifted or planted and hold a weight.
2. Lean back slightly to engage the core and brace the torso.
3. Rotate explosively to one side and then immediately to the other.
4. Continue alternating powerful twists with control.
Safety cue: Brace the core and rotate from the ribs with controlled movements

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower limb power and reactive takeoff for improved jumping ability
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on the ground with torso upright.
2. Swing your arms back to load the hips.
3. Drive arms forward and explosively jump to land on your feet.
4. Absorb the landing with bent knees and reset to kneeling if repeating.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and absorb the force through your hips

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder strength and core coordination while practicing vertical body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with feet against a low wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer to the wall.
3. Continue until your body is vertical or near vertical.
4. Reverse the movement by walking hands away and feet down to start.
Safety cue: Keep the core tight and shoulders stacked over the wrists as you climb

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and dynamic balance while enhancing spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a handstand and find a stacked shoulder position.
2. Balance and press through the shoulders to stabilize the line.
3. Take small controlled steps with your hands to move forward.
4. Stop by returning feet to the floor and lowering under control.
Safety cue: Maintain stacked shoulders over wrists and a braced core while stepping

Health benefit: Increases single leg power and coordination through alternating explosive scissor jumps
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot slightly forward and knees bent.
2. Explode upward and switch leg positions midair.
3. Land softly into the opposite lunge and repeat the scissor motion.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees tracking toes while controlling the leg switch

Health benefit: Develops lateral explosiveness and single leg stability for improved change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight knee bend.
2. Push off strongly and bound laterally as far as possible.
3. Land on the opposite foot with a bent knee and absorb the impact.
4. Immediately explode back to the other side.
Safety cue: Drive through the standing leg and land softly with knees aligned over toes

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and posterior chain control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and clasp hands behind your neck.
2. Sit back to the heels and lower your back to the floor in a controlled roll.
3. Roll back onto your shoulders and use your legs to push up to a seated position.
4. Tuck the chin and gently roll the neck as you rise to standing.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and control the roll through your spine

Health benefit: Builds muscular endurance and enhances ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands clasped at chest.
2. Bend the knees and drive the hips back into a deep, rhythmic squat.
3. Rise explosively onto the balls of your feet while swinging the arms.
4. Keep the torso upright and repeat the squat cycle.
Safety cue: Keep your chest upright and knees tracking over your toes

Health benefit: Develops lower body explosive power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Take a moderate running approach and plant on the takeoff foot.
2. Perform a powerful hop and land on the same foot for the first phase.
3. Transition immediately into the step and then drive into the final full jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and absorb each hop through the hips

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and agility for multidirectional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a plyo box with feet shoulder-width.
2. Explode laterally and land both feet softly on top of the box.
3. Step or jump down to the opposite side with soft knees.
4. Reset and repeat the lateral movement in one smooth motion.
Safety cue: Explode laterally and control the landing with soft, stable knees

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core power and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a strong side plank on one forearm with feet stacked.
2. Push through the forearm to lift the hips explosively off the ground.
3. Land softly back into the side plank and hold a tight core.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced to control each explosive rep

Health benefit: Increases single leg strength and deep hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and extend the other leg behind on the toes.
2. Bend the standing knee and lower into a deep squat while keeping the trailing leg extended.
3. Drive through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Maintain an upright torso and switch legs after the set.
Safety cue: Keep weight on the front foot and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and balance awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and interlace fingers to form a stable triangular head base.
2. Place the crown of the head on the floor and position forearms to support.
3. Lift the hips, walk the feet closer, and engage the core to stack the legs.
4. Press through the shoulders and extend the legs straight overhead.
Safety cue: Engage shoulders and core to lift weight off the head and align the spine

Health benefit: Enhances rotational explosive power and spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and bend the knees slightly.
2. Swing the arms and jump upward while rotating your body 360 degrees in the air.
3. Spot the landing and absorb impact with soft, bent knees.
Safety cue: Spot the landing, tighten your core, and control the rotation

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and extend one arm out to the side.
2. Shift your weight to the same-side leg and lower into a deep squat toward that leg.
3. Push through the planted heel to return to standing and switch sides.
4. Keep the opposite leg lightly bent and the extended arm steady throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall chest and drive the bent knee in line with the foot

Health benefit: Develops combined pulling and pushing upper body strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with a false grip and hang with shoulders engaged.
2. Pull explosively to bring your chest to the bar and lean forward into the transition.
3. Rotate your chest over the bar and press down to lock out into a dip.
4. Lower with control back to the hang and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders engaged and core tight during the pull-to-transition

Health benefit: Enhances spinal extension and upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Press into your hands and lift your chest while keeping hips on the floor.
3. Hold the lift for several breaths, then lower back down.
Safety cue: Anchor pelvis and lift chest using upper back while keeping neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and lengthens the lateral torso
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Reach both arms straight overhead and extend through your fingertips.
3. Hold the reach while breathing, then lower your arms.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and core braced as you reach overhead

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinated breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Inhale and drop your belly, lift your tailbone, and lift your gaze.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tuck your chin, and tuck your tailbone.
4. Repeat the arch and round movements in a smooth flow.
Safety cue: Move slowly, articulating each spinal segment and avoid forcing the range

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotational mobility and engages core oblique muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands relaxed on your thighs.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and place your left hand on the outside of your right thigh and your right hand behind you.
3. Hold the twist, return to center, and repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Sit tall, rotate from the thoracic spine and keep hips square

Health benefit: Enhances scapular mobility and shoulder stability with back contact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and heels a few inches from the wall.
2. Bend elbows to 90 degrees and press your forearms and hands to the wall.
3. Slide your arms up overhead while keeping your back and forearms in contact with the wall.
4. Slide your arms back down and repeat.
Safety cue: Press lower back and head into the wall and glide arms with control

Health benefit: Increases thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side with knees bent and right arm extended in front.
2. Sweep your left arm up and back, rotating your chest toward the ceiling.
3. Keep your knees stacked and follow the movement with your eyes.
4. Return your arm and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Support the lower ribs on the floor and lift the chest through thoracic extension

Health benefit: Improves lateral spinal flexion and stretches the oblique muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Reach your right arm overhead and bend your torso to the left without shifting your hips.
3. Hold the side bend, return to center, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and bend only through the spine while breathing smoothly

Health benefit: Lengthens the latissimus and gently stretches the lower back and shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back onto your heels, then reach both arms forward into child’s pose.
2. Walk both hands to the right and lower your chest toward the floor to feel a side stretch.
3. Hold the position, walk your hands back to center, and repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine, anchor hips toward heels and reach from the ribs

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and contralateral coordination through controlled limb extension
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and shoulders over wrists.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg straight back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your hips level and core engaged while holding the full extension.
4. Lower both limbs and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine, extend limbs slowly and avoid letting the hips rotate

Health benefit: Opens the anterior chest and shoulders to improve posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on the door frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest gently through the doorway to open the chest.
3. Hold the stretch, then step back and relax.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down, draw shoulder blades together and avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility while challenging balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms extended, one arm up and one arm down.
2. Hinge at the hips and slowly reach the lowered hand toward the opposite foot.
3. Rotate your torso to keep the top arm pointing up as you reach.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to return upright and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a braced core and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens lower trapezius and improves scapular upward rotation and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and palms facing down.
2. Lift arms and upper chest a few inches while squeezing the shoulder blades.
3. Lower the arms slowly to the mat with control.
Safety cue: Lift through the shoulder blades with thumbs up and keep your neck long

Health benefit: Strengthens middle trapezius and rhomboids to improve scapular retraction and upper back strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms out to the sides in a T and palms facing down.
2. Lift arms and upper chest while squeezing the shoulder blades toward the spine.
3. Lower the arms slowly to the mat with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and serratus anterior activation to promote shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with arms straight and hands under shoulders.
2. Keep elbows locked and let your chest sink by retracting the shoulder blades.
3. Push through your hands to protract the shoulder blades and return to the start.
Safety cue: Protract and retract the scapula only while holding a straight plank line

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor endurance and core engagement while enhancing dynamic rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee toward hip level.
2. Rotate your torso toward the lifted knee and reach the opposite elbow across.
3. Lower the leg and repeat on the other side in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility while challenging single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and extend one arm across your body at shoulder height.
2. Rotate your torso toward the reaching arm as you reach across.
3. Return the arm to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Reach across with controlled shoulder motion while keeping the spine neutral and hips square

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and hip mobility while reinforcing proper squat movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Sit back into your hips and lower into a deep squat while keeping your chest up.
3. Press weight into your heels and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Drive through your heels to stand back up and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and spinal extensors to improve back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground while squeezing glutes and upper back.
3. Hold briefly, then lower all limbs back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Stretches quadriceps and encourages hip extension while promoting upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee to bring your heel toward your glute.
2. Reach back with the same-side hand and grip your ankle.
3. Pull the heel toward the glute and tilt your head back to look up.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates upper trapezius and improves shoulder elevation control and kinesthetic awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears and squeeze.
3. Lower the shoulders back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Elevate and lower the shoulders slowly with control while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and overhead mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot back into a lunge while lifting both arms straight overhead.
3. Lower your back knee toward the floor until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Step back with control and keep your torso tall and core braced

Health benefit: Increases hip joint mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees soft.
2. Place hands on hips and shift weight slightly to one side.
3. Rotate your hips in a smooth circular motion and then repeat the circle in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and move the hips slowly through controlled circles

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with knees under hips and hands under shoulders.
2. Thread one arm under the opposite side, lowering your shoulder and head toward the floor.
3. Reach the other arm overhead or rest it on the floor, then slide back to the starting position and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips grounded and rotate from the thoracic spine with core engaged

Health benefit: Combines light cardio with shoulder mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Walk forward with an upright posture and relaxed shoulders.
2. Extend both arms out to the sides and make small forward circles.
3. Gradually increase the circle size and continue walking while maintaining steady movement.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep shoulders down and make steady controlled arm circles

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands under shoulders and extend legs back into a straight line.
2. Press through your palms and toes to lift your body into a straight plank.
3. Keep your core engaged and hold a steady, neutral spine.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels with core braced and shoulders stacked

Health benefit: Lengthens hamstrings and calves while promoting shoulder activation
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips high, straightening legs to form an inverted V.
3. Press your palms into the floor and draw your hips back and up.
4. Push your heels gently toward the floor while lengthening the spine.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs extended and the top arm resting on your hip.
2. Lift the top arm and rotate your torso to swing the arm down and through toward the opposite side.
3. Open your chest as you continue the motion and let the arm follow the arc.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and calf flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel flat and keep the back leg straight.
3. Lean into the wall until you feel a stretch in the calf of the back leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Supports hip external rotation and promotes upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs crossed and sit bones grounded.
2. Sit tall and lengthen your spine from tailbone to crown.
3. Rest your hands on your knees and relax your shoulders while keeping an upright posture.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine, relax the shoulders and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Opens the chest and encourages improved thoracic posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms by your sides.
