2. Clasp your hands behind your back and straighten your arms.
3. Lift the clasp slightly and draw your shoulder blades together to open the chest.
Safety cue: Draw the shoulder blades together and lengthen the spine while keeping the chin neutral

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and releases upper back tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Roll shoulders back and down in a smooth circular movement.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders in slow controlled circles keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Builds full body coordination and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift knees a few inches off the ground.
2. Step your right hand and left foot forward, then bring your left hand and right foot forward.
3. Keep hips low and core tight while moving slowly and deliberately.
4. Maintain a steady, controlled crawl for the desired distance or time.
Safety cue: Maintain a braced core and neutral spine while moving slowly

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate while improving whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while raising both arms straight overhead to touch or clap.
3. Land softly with knees slightly bent and return to the start position.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control arms overhead

Health benefit: Stretches hamstrings and promotes spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips.
2. Slide hands down your legs keeping your back long and flat.
3. Stop when your torso is parallel to the floor and hold the flat-back position.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips keeping a flat back and soft knees

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs lifted and bent.
2. Lift shoulders and bring your right elbow toward your left knee while extending the right leg.
3. Switch sides by bringing your left elbow toward your right knee in a full twisting motion.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled, cycling rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and rotate from the torso with control

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness while engaging core and hip flexors
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs as if running.
3. Keep hips low and maintain a steady, rapid pace.
Safety cue: Hold a strong plank with hips low and drive knees toward the chest under control

Health benefit: Improves upper body strength while increasing thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor while bringing your right knee to your right elbow.
3. Push back up to plank and return the right leg.
4. Repeat lowering with the left knee to the left elbow on the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and core tight as you bring knee toward elbow

Health benefit: Targets shoulder strength and overhead pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Bend elbows and lower your head toward the floor while keeping hips elevated.
3. Push through your hands to straighten arms and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Keep hips high and neck neutral as elbows track back in a controlled descent

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and activates core and shoulder stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge forward to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk hands forward until you reach a full plank position.
3. Keep legs as straight as possible and hold the full extension.
4. Walk hands back toward your feet and stand up to repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops single leg strength and improves trunk rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step your right foot back into a reverse lunge.
2. Rotate your torso toward the left (front) leg while keeping your core engaged.
3. Drive through the left heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping your left foot back.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your body on your forearm under the shoulder.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Rotate your torso and lift your top arm toward the ceiling to form a T.
4. Return to the side plank and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced while rotating

Health benefit: Boosts core endurance and increases dynamic hip and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Jump your feet out wide and then back together quickly like a jumping jack.
3. Maintain a steady core and a neutral spine throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and avoid letting hips drop

Health benefit: Improves lateral power balance and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a slight squat and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Leap laterally to the other leg, landing softly on the outside foot.
3. Swing the opposite arm across your body and repeat the motion side to side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest up

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower-body power and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and place hands behind your head.
2. Lower into a squat by pushing hips back and keeping chest up.
3. Explode upward into a jump while keeping hands behind your head.
4. Land softly and descend immediately into the next squat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and land softly with knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Strengthens deep abdominal muscles and hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and hang with arms extended.
2. Engage your core and bend your knees to lift them toward your chest.
3. Pause briefly at the top with control.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the hanging start position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders engaged and use core control to minimize swinging

Health benefit: Increases core flexion strength and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat on your back with arms extended overhead and legs together.
2. Simultaneously lift your torso and legs to meet in a V, reaching hands toward toes.
3. Lower back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and lift with controlled movement

Health benefit: Teaches full-body tension and enhances anterior core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs slightly off the ground and extend arms overhead.
3. Tilt your pelvis, pull ribs down, and hold the hollow shape steadily.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench and place the top of your back foot on the bench.
2. Keep your chest up and shoulders back with your front foot flat.
3. Bend your front knee to lower until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and front knee aligned over your toes

Health benefit: Combines lower-body strength with overhead mobility and posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and reach both arms overhead with hands together.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower until the front knee is about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and brace your core as you reach overhead

Health benefit: Raises cardiovascular fitness while offering scalable full-body conditioning options
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Squat and place hands on the floor, then step back one foot at a time into a plank.
3. Step your feet forward back to your hands and rise into a squat.
4. Stand up and reach your arms overhead to finish the rep.
Safety cue: Land softly and reset to a neutral spine between reps

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep core tight and bend one knee to 90 degrees.
3. Drive the bent knee upward and back so the heel reaches toward the ceiling.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and pelvis level as you drive the heel up

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower body power and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Jump both feet forward outside the hands into a low squat.
3. Immediately jump both feet back to plank.
4. Repeat the jump-forward and jump-back sequence quickly.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted to absorb impact

Health benefit: Develops leg strength while promoting core rotation stability
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward with one foot into a deep lunge.
2. Lower the back knee toward the floor until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg while keeping the hips square.
4. Push through the front heel to stand and step forward into the next lunge.
Safety cue: Step firmly with knee tracking over the toe and rotate from the torso

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength while challenging shoulder mobility and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable box or step with feet hip-width.
2. Step one foot onto the box and press through the heel while raising both arms overhead.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to stand tall on the box with arms extended.
4. Step down one foot at a time and repeat leading with the same leg or alternate.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel, keep chest tall and avoid leaning forward

Health benefit: Boosts anaerobic capacity and fast twitch muscle recruitment
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with a slight forward lean.
2. Drive one knee and the opposite arm forward with explosive force.
3. Maintain quick, long strides and pump the arms to accelerate.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall posture, drive hips forward and breathe rhythmically

Health benefit: Encourages hamstring flexibility and improves running cadence
Steps to perform:
1. Start running with a quick light stride.
2. Drive heels up toward your glutes on each stride.
3. Keep a fast cadence and pump your arms to maintain speed.
Safety cue: Stay upright, pull heels toward glutes with quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Raises heart rate and enhances hip flexor strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start running in place with an upright posture.
2. Drive each knee up toward hip level on alternating legs.
3. Maintain a quick cadence and swing the opposite arm with each knee drive.
Safety cue: Lift knees to hip height with a tall spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Combines core stability and dynamic balance for quick positional transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low prone position or plank on your hands.
2. Push through your hands to bring one foot forward under your body, then the other, landing in a low crouch.
3. Stand or rebound lightly while keeping hands ready for the next pop-up.
4. Repeat the quick pop-up motion with controlled landings.
Safety cue: Use core tension to pop up and land softly with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Increases lower body endurance while promoting cardiovascular fitness and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together.
2. Jump feet wide and drop hips into a squat with knees tracking over toes.
3. Jump feet back together and return to a standing position.
Safety cue: Sit back into your hips, keep chest up and control the tempo

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and shoulder stability while improving mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind hips fingers pointing toward feet.
2. Press through hands and feet to lift hips until torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Walk using hands and feet by moving one hand and the opposite foot, keeping hips elevated.
4. Continue moving forward or backward while maintaining the lifted position.
Safety cue: Keep hips elevated, engage the core and move with deliberate control

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the knee slightly bent and the other foot lifted behind you.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while reaching the lifted hand toward the standing shin.
3. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glute to return to standing.
4. Repeat for reps and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips keeping a neutral spine and soft knee

Health benefit: Enhances core stability while challenging shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Brace the core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while minimizing hip rotation.
3. Return the hand to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and minimize hip rotation with slow controlled taps

Health benefit: Builds lower body muscular endurance and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a lunge and position the front knee over the ankle with the chest up.
2. Pulse by lowering and rising a few inches while maintaining an upright chest.
3. Repeat pulses for the set then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and front knee aligned over the ankle while pulsing

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended a few inches off the floor.
2. Flutter the legs in a quick alternating up-and-down motion while keeping the core engaged.
3. Maintain steady breathing and control the movement for the set.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and breathe steadily to avoid low back arching

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight bend in the knee and hinge the arms for momentum.
2. Leap laterally to the opposite foot, landing softly and absorbing impact with a bent knee.
3. Immediately push off the landing leg and repeat the lateral hop to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips square to absorb impact

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and enhances spinal rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended up toward the ceiling and arms by your sides.
2. Lower both legs together toward one side while keeping the shoulders on the floor.
3. Return the legs to center and lower them to the other side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Stabilize your pelvis by engaging the core and move legs with control

Health benefit: Combines upper body strength with thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Swoop your chest forward and lower your hips toward the floor into a low cobra.
3. Push back through your hands to return to downward dog.
4. Flow the movement smoothly and repeat.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest and maintain a long spine through the fluid arc

Health benefit: Improves shoulder endurance and proprioceptive balance
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands on the floor shoulder-width and face the wall a step away.
2. Kick up and place your heels against the wall to establish a vertical hold.
3. Press through the shoulders and align the body in a straight line from wrists to ankles.
4. Hold the position while maintaining steady breathing.
Safety cue: Press through your shoulders and keep ribs down to avoid sagging

Health benefit: Builds overhead pressing strength and upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width and feet against the wall.
2. Bend the elbows to lower the head toward the floor with control.
3. Press through the palms to extend the elbows and return to the top of the handstand.
4. Repeat the lowering and pressing motion for the set.
Safety cue: Maintain shoulder-over-wrist alignment and control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances core strength and active hip flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Engage the core and lift the legs by flexing the hips to bring the toes toward the bar.
3. Touch the bar with the toes or reach as high as possible.
4. Lower the legs back to a dead hang with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Engage the lats and core to control the swing and avoid excessive swinging

Health benefit: Boosts full body conditioning and aerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Lower into a squat and place hands on the floor.
3. Kick feet back into a plank, perform a push-up, then jump feet forward.
4. Explode upward into a vertical jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Brace your core and land each jump softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower body power and vertical jump height
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with knees slightly bent.
2. Jump up forcefully and pull knees toward your chest.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and reset.
Safety cue: Pull your knees up with a tall chest and absorb the landing with bent knees

Health benefit: Enhances lower limb power and reactive strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing facing the box with feet hip-width apart.
2. Dip into a quick squat and swing arms back.
3. Explode upward and drive knees up to clear the box.
4. Land softly on the box with both feet and step down carefully.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and land fully on the box with soft, bent knees

Health benefit: Develops advanced core strength and eccentric control
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying on a bench and grip the bench behind your head.
2. Raise your legs and hips to a straight vertical line.
3. Lower your body slowly while keeping the torso rigid and shoulders anchored.
4. Pause just above the bench and pull back to the vertical position.
Safety cue: Keep a rigid straight line from shoulders to hips and lower with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg with arms extended forward.
2. Push hips back and lower into a single-leg squat while keeping the free leg straight.
3. Descend slowly until the thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Drive through the heel to stand and extend the free leg forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and knee mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width and hands on hips or held forward.
2. Rise onto your toes and hinge back while bending the knees forward.
3. Lower knees forward until tension in the quads, then push through toes to return upright.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and control the forward knee movement on the descent

Health benefit: Improves reactive power and rate of force development
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on a box or elevated platform.
2. Step off and land softly on both feet with knees bent.
3. Absorb the landing briefly and then explode upward into a maximal jump.
4. Land softly and reset.
Safety cue: Step off under control and absorb the landing by sinking through hips and knees

Health benefit: Increases horizontal explosive power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a partial squat with feet shoulder-width and arms back.
2. Swing arms forward and explode forward into a long horizontal jump.
3. Land with knees bent and absorb impact, then reset.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips and land softly with feet shoulder-width and knees bent

Health benefit: Enhances rotational explosive power and dynamic agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a squat stance with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Dip into a quick squat and swing arms down and back.
3. Explode upward, rotate 180 degrees in the air, and spot the landing.
4. Land softly in a squat and maintain balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Combines unilateral strength work with conditioning and balance challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg with the other leg slightly off the ground.
2. Kick the free leg back and place both hands on the floor, landing in a single-leg plank.
3. Perform a quick push-up, then hop the foot forward under your chest.
4. Explode upward on the supporting leg into a jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and single-leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Push off laterally and bound as wide as possible to land on one foot.
3. Swing the trail leg behind and lightly touch the floor for balance.
4. Explode laterally to the opposite side and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly and absorb impact through hips and knees

Health benefit: Builds explosive lower-body strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a staggered split stance with one foot forward.
2. Lower into a lunge until both knees form roughly 90-degree angles.
3. Explode upward and switch legs midair.
4. Land softly in a split stance and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and control the descent with your front knee

Health benefit: Strengthens core and hip flexors while improving seated posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs straight and hands planted beside your hips.
2. Press into your hands and lift hips and legs until your body forms an L.
3. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Press through palms, pull shoulders down and hold legs parallel to floor

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs together.
2. Lift shoulders and legs off the ground into a hollow shape with lower back pressed.
3. Rock forward and backward using your core while maintaining the hollow position.
Safety cue: Keep lower back glued to the ground and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Develops rotational core power and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and torso leaned back at about 45 degrees.
2. Hold a weight or clap hands and brace your core.
3. Twist explosively to one side, moving the hands quickly.
4. Reverse explosively to the other side and continue.
Safety cue: Rotate from the ribs with a braced core and control the return

Health benefit: Improves vertical power and ankle responsiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on both knees with chest upright.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward to land on your feet with knees slightly bent.
3. Absorb the landing softly and return to kneeling or reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and full-body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the wall and place hands on the floor shoulder-width apart.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer to the wall.
3. Continue until your body is vertical and arms are straight.
4. Walk your feet down and hands back out to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep body tight, stack hips over shoulders and move deliberately

Health benefit: Improves upper-body strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a freestanding or supported handstand with straight arms.
2. Shift weight to your fingers and stabilize your shoulders.
3. Take small hand steps forward while keeping the body aligned.
4. Stop by planting both hands and lowering your feet to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line through shoulders hips and toes and move with control

Health benefit: Increases hip extension power and plyometric coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an alternating split stance with one foot forward and one back.
2. Bend both knees and explode upward, switching leg positions midair like a scissor.
3. Land softly in the opposite split stance and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through your front foot, keep chest up and control the landing

Health benefit: Enhances lateral explosiveness and agility for quick directional changes
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with knees bent and weight centered.
2. Push off one foot and bound laterally as far as possible, driving arms for momentum.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot with a bent knee and immediately bound back.
Safety cue: Push off aggressively but land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and safe controlled descent mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Bend knees and push hips back while reaching hands toward the floor.
3. Sit back onto your heels and lower onto your upper back if needed.
4. Push through your heels and roll or drive up to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral as you lower and sit back

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps endurance and fluid hip and knee mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands in front of your chest.
2. Bend knees and sink hips down while keeping chest upright.
3. Rise explosively onto the balls of your feet and extend knees.
4. Land softly with knees bent and continue the rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Drive knees to track over toes and keep chest upright

Health benefit: Improves explosive power and coordination across sequential lower limb actions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with a slight knee bend.
2. Hop forward on the same foot and land lightly.
3. Step forward onto the opposite foot and immediately push off.
4. Finish with a two-foot jump and land with knees bent.
Safety cue: Land softly with bent knees and absorb force through hips and ankles

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and quickness while challenging balance and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to the box with feet hip-width.
2. Bend knees and swing arms back to load power.
3. Jump laterally onto the box and immediately continue over to the other side.
4. Land softly with knees bent and reset before the next rep.
Safety cue: Control lateral push-off and land softly with hips back and knees bent

Health benefit: Builds lateral core stability and dynamic shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Settle into a forearm side plank with feet stacked.
2. Dip your hips toward the floor in a controlled motion.
3. Explode the hips upward to lift as high as possible and hold briefly.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace the core before each hop

Health benefit: Increases single leg strength and deep hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended behind and toes touching the ground.
2. Shift hips back and reach the opposite hand toward the floor.
3. Lower until your thigh is near parallel or your hand touches the floor.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves glute and hamstring engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width.
2. Lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Walk your feet slowly forward one step at a time until legs are nearly straight.
4. Walk feet back to the start and lower hips with control.
Safety cue: Keep glutes engaged and maintain a neutral spine as you walk out

Health benefit: Enhances rotational power and proprioception during multidirectional jumping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Wind up your arms and rotate your torso toward the jump direction.
3. Jump explosively and rotate 360 degrees in the air.
4. Spot your landing and absorb the impact with bent knees.
Safety cue: Rotate under control and land softly with knees bent while spotting the landing

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves balance under load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a wide stance with toes slightly turned out.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Lower until the bent thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and shift weight smoothly to the working leg while controlling the descent

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination strength and controlled movement transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one arm extended overhead and the same-side knee bent.
2. Roll onto the opposite elbow, press up onto your hand, and lift your hips.
3. Sweep the straight leg back into a kneeling lunge and stand up while keeping the arm overhead.
4. Reverse the sequence with control to return to the lying start position.
Safety cue: Move deliberately through each step keeping the shoulder packed and core engaged

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows.
3. Push back up to the starting position while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
4. Breathe steadily and maintain steady, controlled reps.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral throughout the movement

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and warms shoulder muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Rotate both arms forward in large, controlled circles.
3. Reverse the direction and rotate both arms backward in large, controlled circles.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and move with slow controlled arcs

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius muscles and improves shoulder support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears in a shrugging motion.
3. Lower your shoulders fully back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift and lower shoulders slowly while keeping neck long

Health benefit: Improves chest flexibility and promotes better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place forearms on the frame at elbow height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest gently through the doorway.
3. Keep your spine neutral and shoulder blades down.
4. Hold the position while breathing calmly.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and draw shoulder blades back to avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and thoracic mobility while encouraging full body extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Reach both arms straight overhead until your biceps are by your ears.
3. Lengthen up through your sides and reach higher.
Safety cue: Reach overhead while keeping ribs down and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and improves spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Engage your core and glutes to prevent sagging or hiking of the hips.
3. Hold the plank position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and avoid sagging hips

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and coordination in a supported position
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and the lower arm supporting your head.
2. Swing the top arm forward and then back in a controlled arc across your body.
3. Keep your hips stable and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged to stabilize the torso

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and heels against a wall and arms bent at 90 degrees.
2. Press your arms into the wall and slide them upward until fully extended.
3. Maintain contact of your lower back and wrists with the wall.
4. Slide your arms back down to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep low back flat to the wall and slide arms slowly with control

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump your feet out wide while simultaneously raising your arms overhead.
3. Jump your feet back together while lowering your arms to your sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain a tall chest

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and balance through contralateral limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your hips and shoulders square to the floor while reaching.
4. Hold briefly, return to the start, and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping hips square and core braced

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and scapular upward rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and lift both arms diagonally overhead into a Y with thumbs up.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades and hold the top position briefly.
4. Lower arms slowly to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and lift arms in a controlled Y with shoulders down

Health benefit: Improves posterior shoulder strength and scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms out at shoulder height.
2. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and palms facing down.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades and hold the T position briefly.
4. Lower arms slowly to the start position.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and open arms to a T with palms facing down

Health benefit: Increases shoulder flexibility and stretches posterior shoulder tissues
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with spine long and shoulders relaxed.
2. Bring one arm straight across your chest at shoulder height.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the arm closer and hold.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances spinal flexion-extension mobility and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a small weight centered on your hands.
2. Inhale and drop your belly while lifting your chest and tailbone (cow).
3. Exhale and round your spine while tucking your chin and tailbone (cat).
4. Move slowly between the two positions with control.
Safety cue: Move slowly and keep a neutral spine while distributing weight evenly through the palms

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain including lumbar extensors and glutes
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift your chest, arms, and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly while squeezing the back and glutes.
4. Lower slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Raise chest and limbs with controlled breaths and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and engages core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hinge forward at the hips.
2. Place your hands on the ground and walk them forward partway.
3. Pause in a half-plank position keeping hips high.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet and return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep core engaged and walk hands slowly without letting the hips sag

Health benefit: Develops core stability and coordinated full body movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and feet with knees bent and hips low.
2. Move your right hand and left foot forward a short step.
3. Follow with your left hand and right foot, keeping movement slow.
4. Continue alternating steps while keeping hips stable and low.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and shoulders stacked over hands while moving deliberately

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair with hands gripping the edge beside your hips.
2. Slide your hips forward off the chair and bend your elbows to lower your body.
3. Stop when your elbows reach about 90 degrees.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Lower until elbows reach about 90 degrees and keep shoulders pulled back and down

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and gentle spinal flexion mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs extended straight in front of you.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach both arms forward toward your feet.
3. Keep a long spine as you fold forward and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and hinge from the hips rather than rounding the upper back

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility while challenging core control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Rotate your torso and reach one arm down toward the opposite foot while sliding the other arm up.
3. Return to center and repeat the movement slowly to the other side.
4. Keep movements controlled and maintain balance throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and calf flexibility while engaging shoulder and core muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips back and up to form an inverted V shape.
3. Press palms into the floor, extend the spine, and push heels toward the ground.
4. Hold the position while keeping a long neck and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, push hips up and back, and keep a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on your side with knees bent and forearm under your shoulder.
2. Lift hips until body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Reach the top arm up and keep hips stable while holding the position.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over the elbow, lift hips from the knees, and brace the core

Health benefit: Promotes leg strength and dynamic balance through coordinated hip and knee movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a long step forward with one foot.
2. Lower your body until the front thigh is parallel to the floor and the back knee nears the ground.
3. Swing your arms forward as you step and backward as you lower.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Raises heart rate and improves gait coordination and lower limb activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and march in place lifting each knee toward hip level.
2. Pump the opposite arm vigorously as each knee rises.
3. Land softly and continue alternating knees and arms with an upright torso.
Safety cue: Stand tall, drive knees up with controlled core engagement and swing arms from the shoulders

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves shoulder mobility and posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Interlace fingers behind your back and straighten your arms.
3. Lift your chest and squeeze the shoulder blades together while keeping the neck neutral.
Safety cue: Draw shoulder blades down and back, lift the chest and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and aids rotational range of motion for the upper back
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with both knees bent and arms extended in front on the floor.
2. Rotate the top arm and torso open to the opposite side while keeping the hips stacked.
3. Keep the bottom arm steady and let the thoracic spine twist through the movement.
4. Return to the start and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Rotate from the thoracic spine with controlled movement, keeping hips stable and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and enhances shoulder blade control during upper body movements
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under the shoulders.
2. Without bending the elbows, pinch the shoulder blades together to lower the chest slightly.
3. Push through the palms to protract the shoulder blades and return to the start.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops inner thigh strength and core engagement while promoting hip mobility and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out, arms extended forward.
2. Bend the knees and lower into a plie while keeping the chest upright.
3. Reach the arms forward to help maintain balance and depth.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder joint mobility and releases tension through controlled circular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift the shoulders toward the ears.
2. Roll the shoulders back and down through their full range in a controlled motion.
3. Repeat the motion in the opposite direction with forward shoulder rolls.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the full range, keeping the neck long and shoulder blades gliding smoothly

Health benefit: Lengthens quadriceps and enhances knee flexibility while encouraging hip extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and balance on one leg.
2. Reach back with the same-side hand and grasp the ankle or foot.
3. Pull the heel toward the glute while keeping knees close and hips level.
4. Hold the stretch, release, and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder and upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the mat and sit back onto your heels.
2. Reach both arms forward and place your forehead on the mat.
3. Walk your hands farther forward and spread your fingers.
4. Press into your fingertips and extend through the arms.
Safety cue: Keep hips back and lengthen the spine as you reach the arms

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and increases lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Step onto the incline treadmill and set a brisk walking pace.
2. Stand tall with a slight forward lean from the ankles.
3. Drive your arms from the shoulder with 90-degree elbow bends.
4. Maintain a quick arm swing in sync with each step.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and drive the arms from the shoulders

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and opens the chest
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders.
2. Press into your palms and straighten your arms to lift your chest high.
3. Keep your shoulders down and your neck neutral while holding.
Safety cue: Lift through the upper back and draw the shoulder blades down without craning the neck

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and stretches the obliques
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Raise one arm straight overhead with palm facing inward.
3. Lean away from the raised arm at the waist while keeping hips stable.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged as you reach the arm overhead

Health benefit: Builds shoulder strength and improves upper body pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward the floor.
3. Push through your shoulders to extend the elbows and return to pike.
4. Keep your neck neutral and core engaged throughout.
Safety cue: Keep hips high, core braced, and elbows slightly tucked

Health benefit: Develops core stability while improving hip and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Bend elbows and lower your chest while bringing one knee to the same-side elbow.
3. Push back up to plank and return the leg to start.
4. Alternate sides with each repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the hip as the knee reaches toward the elbow

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Jump or step your feet out wide to the sides.
3. Jump or step your feet back together and continue repeatedly.
Safety cue: Hold a straight line from head to heels and move the feet with control

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate while enhancing core stability and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest in a quick running motion.
3. Switch legs rapidly and continue alternating at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and shoulders stacked while driving the knees forward

Health benefit: Provides full body conditioning and enhances functional strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and squat down placing hands on the floor.
2. Step back one foot at a time into a plank position.
3. Step both feet forward to the squat and stand up reaching overhead.
4. Repeat the sequence at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Brace your core and step back into the plank with control

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands behind hips fingers pointing toward feet.
2. Press through hands and feet to lift hips into a tabletop position.
3. Walk forward or backward on hands and feet while keeping hips lifted.
Safety cue: Lift the chest, pack the shoulders, and keep hips elevated to protect the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lateral core strength and spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with feet stacked and elbow under your shoulder.
2. Press your forearm into the ground and lift hips until the body forms a straight line.
3. Keep feet stacked and hold the top position.
4. Lower hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips and shoulders stacked and body in a straight line

Health benefit: Improves core stability and shoulder coordination while resisting rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Shift weight and tap your left shoulder with your right hand.
3. Return the hand and tap the right shoulder with your left hand.
4. Maintain a stable pelvis and minimize body sway.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep hips level while tapping shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles and enhances hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed slightly behind hips.
2. Press through heels and hands to lift hips until the body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the elevated position with glutes engaged and lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Press through heels and lift hips while keeping a neutral neck

Health benefit: Increases lateral power and agility while challenging single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a slight squat with feet hip-width and arms relaxed.
2. Push off sideways onto one foot while swinging the opposite arm across your body.
3. Land softly on the outside foot with the other foot behind you and repeat laterally.
Safety cue: Land softly with bent knees and maintain a braced core

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and improves vertical jump capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and sink into a squat while swinging arms back.
2. Explode upward into a jump and reach both arms overhead.
3. Land softly into a squat with knees bent and arms back.
4. Repeat the jump with controlled, continuous motion.
Safety cue: Absorb landing with soft knees and keep chest upright

Health benefit: Builds abdominal strength and enhances trunk control and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands placed behind your head and legs extended.
2. Simultaneously lift your upper body and legs into a V shape while keeping hands behind your head.
3. Hold the V position with chest lifted.
4. Lower back down slowly with control.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and exhale to engage abs as you lift

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and cultivates whole body tension for stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat and press your lower back into the floor with arms extended overhead.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs slightly off the ground to create a hollow shape.
3. Hold the hollow position and then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and lower abdominal muscles while improving hanging endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with arms fully extended and feet off the ground.
2. Brace your core and curl both knees up toward your chest.
3. Pause at the top with knees close to the torso.
4. Lower the legs back down with control until arms are straight.
Safety cue: Control the swing and exhale as you lift knees toward chest

Health benefit: Improves grip strength and supports shoulder stability through sustained hanging
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp the bar with a shoulder-width grip and hang with arms straight.
2. Retract your shoulder blades and hold the hanging position.
3. Hold for the desired time then release your grip and step down.
Safety cue: Retract shoulders and avoid shrugging while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and shoulder flexibility while reinforcing core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place your hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward until you reach a full plank with the body straight.
3. Pause then walk your hands back toward your feet while keeping legs as straight as possible.
4. Stand up by lifting your chest and repeat.
Safety cue: Walk hands out slowly keeping a braced core and a straight spine

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination and elevates heart rate for metabolic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high tabletop with hands under shoulders and knees hovering.
2. Drive the opposite hand and foot forward quickly while keeping hips low.
3. Move the opposite hand and foot in a continuous fast rhythm.
4. Maintain a light, quick pace and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and drive movement with a braced core

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands planted under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling by extending the hip while keeping the knee bent.
3. Lower the knee back under control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square to the floor and brace your core to prevent lumbar arching

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower body power and agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with hands on the floor between your feet.
2. Explosively jump both feet back into a plank position.
3. Immediately jump feet forward toward hands into a low squat.
4. Repeat the sequence with quick, explosive movements.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest lifted to protect the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and promotes rotational core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward into a deep lunge with front knee over ankle.
2. Twist your torso toward the front leg while extending your arms out to the sides.
3. Push through the front heel to stand and bring the back foot forward.
4. Repeat on the opposite leg while maintaining the arm twist.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and front knee stacked over the ankle while rotating from your torso

Health benefit: Improves dynamic balance and quick full body transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying face down with hands near shoulders as if paddling.
2. Explode up by pushing through hands and swinging one leg under to a low squat.
3. Plant both feet and stand into a ready surfing stance.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat the pop-up motion.
Safety cue: Explode from the hips and land softly with shoulders packed and spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases triceps and chest strength while challenging upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a plank with hands close together forming a diamond under your chest.
2. Lower your chest toward the diamond by bending elbows close to your body.
3. Push back up to full arm extension while keeping core tight.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked and core braced while maintaining a neutral neck

Health benefit: Develops upper body mobility and full range pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an inverted V with hips high and hands and feet on the floor.
2. Lower your chest in a sweeping arc toward the floor while moving hips down.
3. Arch the upper back and lift the chest forward into an upward dog position.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the inverted V and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and dynamic spinal mobility through flowing movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend elbows and sweep your chest forward and down toward the floor.
3. Continue the motion by moving the chest forward and up into a cobra-like position.
4. Push back and lift hips to return to the starting pike and repeat.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest and drive hips back while keeping scapulae controlled and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core and improves shoulder stability through controlled rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on one forearm with body in a straight line.
2. Rotate your top arm down and under your torso, then lift it back up toward the ceiling.
3. Hold the rotated position briefly and repeat rotations, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift through the ribs while rotating from the upper spine

Health benefit: Elevates cardiovascular fitness while promoting lower body power and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and chest up.
2. Jump feet out wide while lowering into a squat with hips back.
3. Jump feet back together and stand tall to complete each rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves unilateral posterior chain strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly lifted and arms extended out.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while reaching hands toward the floor and extending the lifted leg back.
3. Squeeze the standing glute and drive hips forward to return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves core rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift your shoulders and pull your right elbow toward your left knee while extending your right leg.
3. Switch sides by pulling your left elbow toward your right knee and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and lead each rotation from your core

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight up.
2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly and lower one leg toward the floor while keeping the other leg raised.
3. Alternate quick, small fluttering kicks while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor.
Safety cue: Keep your lower back pressed into the floor

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance for agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and arms ready.
2. Leap laterally to the opposite leg while swinging your arms aggressively across your body.
3. Land softly on the opposite leg and immediately push off into the next lateral hop.
Safety cue: Land softly with a slight knee bend

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and integrates full body core control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in downward dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Shift forward by bringing shoulders over wrists into a high plank.
3. Press back into downward dog and repeat the flow.
Safety cue: Maintain a long neutral spine throughout the transition

Health benefit: Builds wrist strength and improves arm balance proficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Squat with feet close together and place hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Bend elbows slightly and place knees onto the upper arms near the triceps.
3. Lean forward to transfer weight into your hands while keeping gaze forward.
4. Lift one foot then both feet off the ground and balance on your hands as able.
Safety cue: Shift weight into your palms and engage your core to balance

Health benefit: Increases oblique strength and spinal rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides and legs straight up.
2. Lower both legs to one side in a controlled motion while keeping shoulders on the floor.
3. Pull legs back to center and lower them to the opposite side and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and control the legs with your obliques

Health benefit: Develops shoulder endurance and vertical body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Face away from the wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor a few inches from the wall.
2. Kick one leg up and press the other up to meet the wall, coming into a supported handstand.
3. Press through your shoulders and hold the straight body position against the wall.
Safety cue: Stack your shoulders over your wrists to maintain alignment

Health benefit: Builds overhead pressing strength and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Kick into a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width and body straight.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor while maintaining a tight core.
3. Push through your hands to fully extend the arms and return to the handstand.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from wrists to hips as you control the descent

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and total body power output
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and then squat down placing your hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Jump your feet back into a plank and immediately lower your chest toward the floor.
3. Push through your hands to return to plank and jump your feet forward toward your hands.
4. Explode upward into a vertical jump and clap overhead before repeating.
Safety cue: Land softly and use steady breathing through the sequence

Health benefit: Develops explosive upper body power and fast twitch muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower chest to the floor with elbows at about 45 degrees.
3. Explode upward to lift hands off the ground and land softly.
Safety cue: Land softly to absorb impact through a braced core

Health benefit: Builds combined pulling and pushing strength with coordinated full body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the bar with a false or overhand grip and hang with straight arms.
2. Pull explosively and drive your chest toward the bar.
3. Transition by rolling your chest over the bar and bringing elbows above it.
4. Push down to extend the arms into a dip and lower back to a hang.
Safety cue: Control the transition by maintaining a hollow body

Health benefit: Enhances back and arm strength while improving vertical pulling endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the bar with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width and hang tall.
2. Pull by squeezing the shoulder blades and bringing your chin over the bar.
3. Lower slowly until arms are straight and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract your shoulder blades before pulling

Health benefit: Strengthens biceps and upper back while supporting functional elbow flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the bar with an underhand grip at shoulder width and hang with straight arms.
2. Pull by flexing the elbows and bringing your chin over the bar.
3. Lower with control until arms are extended and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep your shoulders down throughout the movement

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and core engagement through vertical body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a plank facing the wall with feet a few inches from it.
2. Walk hands toward the wall while walking feet up the wall.
3. Continue until your body approaches vertical.
4. Reverse by walking hands back and lowering feet to return to the plank.
Safety cue: Stack your shoulders over your wrists as you climb

Health benefit: Improves balance and shoulder endurance while developing spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Kick into a freestanding or wall-assisted handstand with straight arms.
2. Shift weight slightly onto one hand and lift the opposite hand to step.
3. Alternate small hand steps while keeping core tight and body aligned.
4. Exit by lowering one leg and returning feet to the ground.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists while walking

Health benefit: Builds exceptional core strength and eccentric control through full body stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and grip the anchor behind your head with both hands.
2. Brace the core and drive feet and hips up until the body is vertical.
3. Lower the body as a single rigid unit toward the bench without arching.
4. Pull the body back to vertical using core strength and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a rigid straight line from shoulders to knees while lowering slowly

Health benefit: Enhances core and hip flexor strength while improving seated posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and hands beside hips or on blocks.
2. Press down through the hands and lift hips and legs to form an L shape.
3. Hold the position with straight legs and engaged core.
Safety cue: Press through your hands to lift and stabilize the L position

Health benefit: Develops abdominal strength and hip flexor coordination with dynamic hanging movement
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with an overhand grip and engage the shoulders.
2. Swing the legs up and contract the abs to touch toes to the bar.
3. Lower the legs back to a dead hang with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Use your core to lift toes to the bar without swinging

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and explosive takeoff mechanics through coordinated arm drive
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the hips.
2. Swing arms forcefully backward then upward and explode into the jump.
3. Land softly on the box with knees bent and step down carefully.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back to absorb impact

Health benefit: Enhances explosive vertical power and hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing both arms forcefully upward as you drive through the balls of your feet.
3. Tuck both knees toward your chest at the top of the jump.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Develops horizontal power and coordination for longer propulsive jumps
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and shift weight slightly back into your heels.
2. Lower into a deep squat while loading your hips and swinging your arms behind you.
3. Explode forward using your hips and arms to jump for maximum distance.
4. Land softly in a squat and step back to the start position.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips and land with knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and dynamic lower body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a quarter squat while preparing to jump.
3. Explode upward and rotate your body 180 degrees in the air.
4. Land softly into a squat facing the opposite direction and stand tall.
Safety cue: Land softly with feet under hips and knees aligned

Health benefit: Builds unilateral strength and full body conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the opposite knee lifted off the ground.
2. Bend forward and place both hands on the floor while extending the free leg back into a plank.
3. Perform a quick push-up or chest touch, then jump the foot forward under your hips.
4. Explode upward from the planted foot and return to standing on the same leg.
Safety cue: Control the descent on the standing leg keeping hips square

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral pressing strength and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands wider than shoulder-width and spread feet for stability.
2. Shift your weight to one side and bend the loaded elbow while keeping the other arm almost straight.
3. Lower your chest toward the loaded hand while the other arm extends out.
4. Push back up and repeat the movement on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight spine and shift weight slowly between sides

Health benefit: Increases single arm pressing strength and core stabilization demand
Steps to perform:
1. Place one hand firmly under your chest and position your feet wider than hip-width.
2. Brace your core and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lower your chest to the floor under control while keeping weight on the single hand.
4. Push explosively through the hand to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and brace the core to prevent rotation

Health benefit: Trains reactive leg power and rapid force development
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with chest upright and hands resting by your sides.
2. Place hands on the floor and use your hands and legs to swing your hips forward toward standing.
3. Land softly on your feet in a quarter squat and absorb the force.
4. Return to the kneeling start by reversing the motion under control.
Safety cue: Absorb the landing with soft knees and land on the midfoot

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination, mobility, and controlled strength transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and weight on one foot.
2. Push off the planted foot laterally to bound explosively toward the opposite side.
3. Land on the opposite foot with a bent knee and absorb the impact.
4. Immediately push back to the other side and continue alternating bounds.
Safety cue: Keep the overhead shoulder packed and move deliberately through each step

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and improves change of direction ability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one arm extended toward the ceiling and the same-side knee bent.
2. Press through the bent foot and elbow, then the hand, to lift your hips off the ground.
3. Sweep the straight leg under you and rise to a tall kneeling position.
4. Stand up from the kneel, then reverse the steps slowly back to the start.
Safety cue: Push off explosively and land softly with knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Develops explosive hip extension and safe recovery mechanics from the ground
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Drop to your knees and fold forward to land chest-first on the floor.
3. Swing your arms overhead and then forcefully down to assist lifting your torso to hands and knees.
4. Use the arm swing to drive up to a standing position and reset.
Safety cue: Control the arm swing and stand with a braced core and neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances explosive lower-body power and rotational coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width, bend knees, and swing arms back.
2. Jump up and rotate your body 360 degrees in the air.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and absorb with bent knees.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips and knees absorbing the impact and chest upright

Health benefit: Develops shoulder and core strength for improved bodyweight control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with hands under shoulders.
2. Lean forward by shifting weight toward your hands and shoulders.
3. Hold a straight body line with toes on the ground.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds unilateral core stability while challenging shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank on one hand with feet together and the other hand behind your back.
2. Jump feet apart and back together while keeping hips level.
3. Maintain a tight core and steady shoulder position.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep hips square to prevent dipping or rotating

Health benefit: Improves oblique strength and spinal mobility in a hanging position
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip and arms straight.
2. Raise legs toward the bar until they are horizontal or higher.
3. Rotate legs to one side in a controlled motion like a windshield wiper.
4. Return to center and rotate to the other side.
Safety cue: Control the movement from the core and keep the shoulders stable as the legs sweep

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and balance through full body tension
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on one hand with feet stacked.
2. Lift your top leg and top arm up to form a straight star line.
3. Keep hips high and body aligned from hand to foot.
4. Hold the position with steady balance.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over hips and hold the core tight to maintain a straight line

Health benefit: Trains upper body strength and spatial awareness for inverted control
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the ground facing a wall or open space.
2. Kick one leg up forcefully while the other follows to reach a vertical line.
3. Find balance by adjusting hand pressure and slight leg positioning.
4. Dismount by returning one leg down and stepping back to standing.
Safety cue: Kick up with a controlled motion and keep the core engaged to avoid arching

Health benefit: Develops explosive upper-body power and fast-twitch muscle recruitment
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands shoulder-width.
2. Lower your chest quickly toward the floor.
3. Explode upward forcefully so hands leave the ground and clap once.
4. Land softly into the next push-up and repeat.
Safety cue: Explode with control and absorb the landing with soft elbows while maintaining a straight torso

Health benefit: Improves reactive leg power and landing control for plyometric performance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a sturdy box and step off forward without jumping.
2. Land on the balls of your feet with knees bent and hips back to absorb the impact.
3. Immediately absorb the force and either stick the landing or explode upward into a rebound jump.
Safety cue: Step off with intent and land softly with hips and knees bent to absorb impact

Health benefit: Increases posterior chain flexibility and glute activation through dynamic extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, then press hips up into a bridge.
2. Place hands on the floor behind your head and walk them forward step by step.
3. Continue until arms are extended and your chest is lifted.
4. Walk hands back toward your feet and lower hips to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength while improving balance and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and extend both arms straight out to the sides.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg mostly straight.
3. Lower hips toward the bent knee until the thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the bent foot to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Raise both arms overhead with palms facing each other.
3. Keep core engaged and ribs gently lowered.
4. Lower arms slowly back to your sides.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral as you lift overhead

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder internal rotation and arm flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a towel behind your back with one hand high and the other low.
2. Reach the top hand down and the bottom hand up to grab the towel.
3. Pull gently with both hands to create a mild shoulder stretch.
4. Release and switch hand positions to repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and shoulders down as you pull the towel behind you

Health benefit: Develops scapular control and upward rotation during arm elevation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and heels against a wall and arms at 90 degrees.
2. Press your forearms and hands into the wall to maintain contact.
3. Slide your arms upward along the wall until fully extended.
4. Lower your arms back to the starting 90-degree position.
Safety cue: Press your head and lower back into the wall while sliding arms up and down

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves anterior shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm high on the door frame.
2. Step forward with the opposite foot until you feel a gentle chest opening.
3. Hold briefly, then step back and switch arms.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets posterior shoulder stretch and increases external rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand and reach one arm up and bend the elbow to drop the hand behind your back.
2. Reach the opposite arm down and bend the elbow to try to clasp the fingers.
3. Use a strap if needed and gently draw the hands closer.
4. Release and switch arm positions.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a long spine and keep shoulders relaxed as you reach behind you

Health benefit: Strengthens lower trapezius and promotes postural scapular alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead in a Y shape and thumbs up.
2. Lift your arms off the ground by squeezing the shoulder blades together.
3. Hold briefly and lower the arms back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift arms using the shoulder blades and keep your neck neutral

Health benefit: Reinforces mid back muscle activation and improves scapular retraction control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with elbows bent and hands near your ears forming a W.
2. Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift the forearms off the ground.
3. Hold briefly and lower the arms back down with control.
Safety cue: Pull elbows toward your hips by retracting the scapulae and keep the spine flat

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and dynamic flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Start rotating your arms backward in big circular motions.
3. Maintain long arms and controlled shoulder movement throughout.
4. After several reps, reverse the direction of the circles.
Safety cue: Circle slowly with shoulders packed and control the movement throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic extension and expands anterior chest mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and interlace your fingers behind your back.
2. Straighten your arms and lift them slightly while opening your chest.
3. Hold briefly then release your hands back to your sides.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and squeeze shoulder blades while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Stretches the posterior chain while encouraging shoulder flexion and lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with knees together or slightly apart.
2. Reach both arms forward and press your palms into the floor.
3. Actively push your hands away while lengthening your spine.
4. Hold the reach, then slowly return your hands and sit up.
Safety cue: Reach forward with a long spine and breathe deeply without collapsing the chest

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Engage core and glutes to maintain a flat spine.
3. Keep neck neutral and gaze just ahead of hands.
4. Hold the position while maintaining steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and pushing power
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and legs straight.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows while keeping a straight body line.
3. Stop when your chest is just above the floor or elbows are about 90 degrees.
4. Push through your hands to return to the start.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lower with elbows tucked about 45 degrees from the body

Health benefit: Improves shoulder flexibility and cross body range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing or seated and bring one arm across your chest at shoulder height.
2. Use the opposite hand to pull the elbow or forearm closer to the chest.
3. Hold and deepen the stretch while keeping the shoulder down.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and rotate from the thoracic spine rather than the lower back

Health benefit: Lengthens the spine and stretches the posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands shoulder-width and fingers spread.
2. Lift hips up and back to form an inverted V with straight arms and legs.
3. Press heels toward the floor and distribute weight evenly through the palms.
4. Hold and keep the spine long with the head between the arms.
Safety cue: Press evenly through the hands, lift hips back and lengthen the spine

Health benefit: Strengthens spinal extensors and posterior chain muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift arms, chest, and legs off the floor while squeezing the glutes.
3. Hold briefly at the top then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs using glutes and lower back while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Raises heart rate and improves coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while swinging arms overhead and clap hands at the top.
3. Jump feet back together and lower arms to return to the start.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control each jump using the core

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and hips square.
2. Extend one arm forward overhead while reaching the opposite leg straight back.
3. Keep hips level and reach through the fingertips and toes.
4. Hold briefly then return to start and switch sides.
