Safety cue: Reach through the arm and leg while keeping hips square and core braced

Health benefit: Promotes trapezius activation and neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears to the maximum comfortable range.
3. Lower the shoulders fully down and repeat with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep the neck relaxed and lift shoulders straight up and down without jutting the chin

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and posterior chain length
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and feet flexed toward you.
2. Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips, keeping the spine long.
3. Reach hands toward or onto your feet while maintaining a gentle forward pull.
4. Hold the position and keep the chest moving toward the thighs.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and avoid rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and thoracic extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop the belly while lifting the chest and tailbone for cow.
3. Exhale and round the spine, tucking the chin and tailbone for cat.
4. Alternate slowly, emphasizing the thoracic extension during the cow phase.
Safety cue: Articulate through the mid thoracic spine and coordinate each movement with slow controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet wider than hip-width and extend arms out to a T.
2. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and reach one hand toward the opposite foot.
3. Rotate the torso to point the other arm up toward the ceiling.
4. Return to center and repeat slowly on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and reach with control

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder joint mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side with knees slightly bent and the bottom arm extended forward.
2. Lift the top arm toward the ceiling and perform small controlled circular motions.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several reps.
4. Switch sides and repeat the same pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and elbow extension capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the bench edge and place hands shoulder-width on the bench beside your hips.
2. Slide your hips off the bench and extend your legs forward.
3. Lower your hips by bending elbows until upper arms are near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through your palms to extend elbows and lift your hips back up.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows tucked close while lowering to the bench with control

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and improves hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee toward your chest while driving the opposite arm upward.
2. Land softly on the standing foot and maintain an upright torso.
3. Alternate knees rapidly while pumping your arms in opposition.
Safety cue: Drive knees upward while maintaining an upright torso and steady breathing

Health benefit: Promotes coordination and increases shoulder mobility during locomotion
Steps to perform:
1. Walk forward with an upright posture and engaged core.
2. Swing both arms up to shoulder height as you step.
3. Keep a brisk pace and coordinate each arm swing with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright spine and swing arms from the shoulders without collapsing the chest

Health benefit: Stretches lateral trunk muscles and enhances side bending range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and raise one arm overhead.
2. Lean the torso toward the opposite side while keeping hips stable.
3. Hold briefly, return to upright, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core engaged as you laterally hinge with controlled alignment

Health benefit: Improves spinal extension and opens anterior chest muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Press through your palms to lift your chest while keeping hips on the floor.
3. Pull your shoulders down and open the chest, then hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and supports knee joint alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee to grab the same-side ankle behind you.
2. Pull the heel gently toward the glute while reaching the other arm overhead.
3. Keep knees close and hold briefly, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and promotes rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Drop both knees to one side while extending the opposite arm out in a T.
3. Turn your head toward the extended arm and press the knee gently toward the floor.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and shoulder girdle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with wrists under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Keep arms straight and retract the shoulder blades to lower the chest slightly.
3. Push through your palms to protract the shoulder blades and return to the start.
Safety cue: Move only the shoulder blades by protracting and retracting without bending the elbows

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder strength and overhead mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet touching the base of the wall.
2. Walk your hands slowly toward the wall while keeping your core tight.
3. Continue walking your feet up the wall and hands closer until your chest faces the wall.
4. Reverse the motion to return to plank by walking hands back and lowering feet.
Safety cue: Brace your core and walk slowly to keep a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and hip stability while challenging balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms straight overhead.
2. Step one foot backward and lower until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Press through the front heel to return to standing while keeping arms overhead.
4. Repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep your chest tall and lower into the lunge with control

Health benefit: Increases hip and ankle mobility while strengthening quadriceps and glutes
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hands behind the head.
2. Push hips back and bend knees, lowering into a deep squat until hips drop below knees.
3. Keep chest up and weight in the heels as you hold the bottom position.
4. Drive through the heels to stand while squeezing the glutes.
Safety cue: Keep heels grounded and sit back into a tall neutral squat

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge forward with a slight knee bend.
2. Raise arms straight overhead to form an "I" and hold briefly.
3. Lower arms out to the sides to form a "T" and pause with thumbs up.
4. Rotate arms forward and up to form a "Y" and return to the start slowly.
Safety cue: Lead with your shoulder blades and lift each arm with control

Health benefit: Builds shoulder pressing strength and upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width.
2. Bend elbows to lower the crown of your head toward the floor.
3. Push through your palms to extend the elbows and return to the starting position.
4. Keep hips high and core engaged throughout each rep.
Safety cue: Stack hips over shoulders and lower with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and spinal mobility while building full body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Scoop your chest downward and forward, leading with your head toward a low pushup.
3. Arch your back and lift your chest into an upward-facing position with hips low.
4. Reverse the motion to return to downward dog by pushing hips back.
Safety cue: Flow through the movement with a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic shoulder mobility and upper body strength through fluid movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike or downward dog position with hands shoulder-width.
2. Bend elbows and swoop your chest forward and down into an upward-facing position.
3. Push your torso back and lift hips slightly as you move back toward the starting pike.
4. Repeat the flowing motion with controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a smooth shoulder arc while bracing your core

Health benefit: Develops core stability while increasing hip and thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest as you drive your right knee toward your right elbow.
3. Push back up to plank while returning the right leg.
4. Repeat the same motion on the left side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and draw the knee forward with controlled motion

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with light cardiovascular challenge and lateral hip activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet together and body in a straight line.
2. Jump both feet out wide like a horizontal jumping jack while keeping hips stable.
3. Jump feet back together and maintain a tight core for consecutive reps.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips steady to avoid bouncing

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate while strengthening core and improving hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running motion.
3. Maintain a flat back and brisk tempo for continuous reps.
Safety cue: Hold a strong plank line and drive knees forward with control

Health benefit: Enhances full body power and cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend and place hands on the floor, then jump feet back into a plank.
3. Do a push-up, then jump your feet forward toward your hands.
4. Explode upward into a full overhead jump and reach hands above head.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and core braced

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability hip mobility and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with hands behind hips and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift hips high into a reverse tabletop and straighten arms.
3. Press through hands and feet to step one hand and the opposite foot forward.
4. Keep hips elevated and alternate controlled steps while moving.
Safety cue: Keep hips high, shoulders stacked, and take controlled small steps

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes shoulder and glute endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands behind hips, fingers pointing toward feet.
2. Press through hands and heels to lift hips until the body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze glutes, keep chest open, and hold the elevated position.
Safety cue: Press through heels and lift hips to form a straight line from shoulders to heels

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop elbow under the shoulder with legs stacked.
2. Press into the elbow and lift hips into a straight line from head to feet.
3. Reach the top arm straight up toward the ceiling and hold the position.
Safety cue: Stack hips and keep a straight line from head to heels while reaching up

Health benefit: Develops oblique strength and single side balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on one hand or elbow with legs stacked.
2. Lift hips so the body forms a straight line and extend the top arm overhead.
3. Raise the top leg and open the chest as you rotate into a star shape.
4. Hold briefly with core engaged, then lower back to the side plank.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and aligned with shoulders while controlling the arm and leg movement

Health benefit: Builds anti rotation core stability while challenging shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Shift weight to one hand and tap the opposite shoulder with the other hand.
3. Alternate taps while keeping hips steady and core tight.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level to minimize rotation during each shoulder tap

Health benefit: Improves integrated core strength and midline stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and extend arms overhead with legs straight and together.
2. Lift shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground, pressing the lower back into the floor.
3. Keep arms active overhead, engage the core, and hold the hollow position.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor, keep ribs down, and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and place hands gently behind your head with elbows wide.
2. Lean back slightly and lift legs to form a V shape with your torso.
3. Balance on your sit bones, keep chest open, and hold or pulse as desired.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall chest and neutral spine while controlling the descent with your core

Health benefit: Builds lower abdominal strength and improves hip flexor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and arms fully extended.
2. Brace your core and pull knees upward toward your chest without swinging.
3. Control the motion at the top, then slowly lower legs back to the start.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Engage your shoulder blades and control the hips to avoid swinging as you lift knees

Health benefit: Improves grip endurance and enhances shoulder and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp the pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Hang with arms fully extended and shoulders relaxed but slightly engaged.
3. Maintain a tall torso and steady breathing while holding the dead hang.
Safety cue: Hang with shoulders pulled down and back, chest open, and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips and place hands on the floor, walking them forward into a high plank.
3. Walk hands back toward feet by hinging at the hips until feet are under you.
4. Stand up and reach both arms overhead for a maximal stretch.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and hinge at the hips as you walk your hands forward

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with knees hovering an inch above the ground and back flat.
2. Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, keeping hips low.
3. Follow by moving your left hand and right foot forward in a controlled crawl.
4. Continue alternating while maintaining a compact core.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and take controlled, steady steps with the shoulders engaged

Health benefit: Activates and strengthens glute muscles for improved hip drive
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling while keeping the knee bent and hip stable.
3. Extend the leg into a high kick, then lower it back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and lift with glute drive without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength while promoting trunk rotation and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward with one foot into a deep lunge.
2. Lower until both knees form roughly 90-degree angles.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg while keeping the hips square.
4. Push through the front heel to stand and step forward into the next lunge.
Safety cue: Stack the front knee over the ankle and rotate from the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower body power and transition speed
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with hands under shoulders and chest lifted slightly.
2. Explosively push through your hands and bring your rear foot forward beneath you.
3. Land in a low, balanced stance with both feet shoulder-width apart.
4. Stabilize and reset before returning to the starting prone position if repeating.
Safety cue: Use controlled hip drive and keep your chest over your hands when popping up

Health benefit: Targets triceps and chest for increased pressing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands close together forming a diamond under your chest.
2. Lower your chest toward the diamond while keeping elbows tucked close to your sides.
3. Push back up to full arm extension while maintaining a straight plank line.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to the ribs and hold a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Boosts lower body power and enhances vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and lower into a squat by bending knees and sitting back.
2. Explode upward into a jump and reach both hands straight to the ceiling.
3. Land softly on your feet and immediately descend into the next squat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and absorb the force through the hips

Health benefit: Combines aerobic intensity with lower body coordination and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide and drop into a squat while swinging both arms wide overhead.
3. Jump feet back together and swing arms down to your sides to return to start.
4. Repeat the jump-squat-jack rhythm with controlled landings.
Safety cue: Brace the core and sit back into the hips as you swing the arms wide

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hands by your sides or holding weight.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the free leg straight behind you.
3. Keep the standing-leg knee soft and the back flat as you reach toward the ground.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to an upright single-leg stance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs lifted and bent at 90 degrees.
2. Rotate your torso to bring your right elbow toward your left knee as you extend the right leg.
3. Switch sides by rotating to bring your left elbow toward your right knee while extending the left leg.
4. Continue alternating with full, controlled rotations.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and rotate slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent.
2. Leap laterally to one side while driving the opposite arm aggressively across your body.
3. Land on the outside foot with a soft knee and swing the other arm back.
4. Repeat the lateral leap to the opposite side with equal power.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest lifted to keep the torso stable

Health benefit: Builds core stability while improving shoulder mobility and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in Downward Dog with hips high and shoulders open.
2. Shift weight forward and lower hips as you bring shoulders over wrists into High Plank.
3. Hold the plank with a straight body and engaged core.
4. Push hips back up into Downward Dog and repeat the flow.
Safety cue: Engage your core and move slowly, keeping shoulders stacked over wrists

Health benefit: Develops wrist strength and upper body balance
Steps to perform:
1. Squat and place hands shoulder-width on the mat with fingers spread.
2. Lean forward and rest knees on the backs of your upper arms while shifting weight into the hands.
3. Lift feet off the floor and balance with a tight core and steady breath.
Safety cue: Spread fingers wide and press through fingertips while keeping your gaze forward

Health benefit: Enhances oblique engagement and rotational core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms out wide and legs extended toward the ceiling.
2. Lower both legs to one side with control while keeping the shoulders glued to the floor.
3. Return legs to center and lower them to the opposite side with the same control.
4. Repeat the side-to-side sweeping motion for the desired number of reps.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and lower back connected to the floor, moving the legs with control

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift legs a few inches off the ground and begin alternating small rapid up-and-down flutters.
3. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor and maintain steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts explosive lateral power and reactive balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with knees bent and arms ready to drive.
2. Push off one foot and hop laterally while swinging both arms high and forward.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot with a bent knee and absorb the impact.
4. Immediately explode into the next hop using a high arm drive.
Safety cue: Drive arms high and land softly with knees tracking over toes to absorb impact

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder endurance and promotes overhead posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms extended overhead forming an "I".
2. Lower arms slowly to shoulder height while keeping the spine long and shoulders down.
3. Raise arms back overhead to the starting position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and shoulders packed while lifting the arms in a controlled motion

Health benefit: Builds inverted balance and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from a wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor a short distance from the wall.
2. Kick one leg up and use the other to gently push into a handstand so your heels touch the wall.
3. Engage the core and glutes to hold a straight body line against the wall.
4. Come down with control by lowering legs back to the floor one at a time.
Safety cue: Keep core tight and shoulders engaged, pushing through the palms to maintain a straight line

Health benefit: Increases vertical pressing strength and upper body power
Steps to perform:
1. Set up in a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width and body straight.
2. Bend elbows to lower your head toward the floor in a controlled manner.
3. Pause briefly when your head approaches the floor without collapsing the shoulders.
4. Push through your hands to extend the elbows and return to the starting handstand.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance, spatial awareness, and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a free or short-distance handstand with straight arms.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and lift the other slightly to take a small step with your fingertips.
3. Alternate fingertip steps to move forward while keeping a tight core and straight body.
4. Stop by planting both hands and lowering one leg down with control.
Safety cue: Keep core engaged and take small controlled steps while maintaining a straight body alignment

Health benefit: Develops shoulder mobility and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with your feet against the wall and hands on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Walk your hands slowly toward the wall while pushing your feet up the wall until your body is vertical.
3. Hold the vertical position briefly with your shoulders stacked over your hands.
4. Lower your feet down the wall and walk your hands back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral as you control each hand and foot movement

Health benefit: Enhances explosive upper body strength and coordinated pulling pushing movement
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a high bar with a false grip and arms fully extended.
2. Pull explosively and drive your chest toward the bar while transitioning your hands to support.
3. Press down on the bar to straighten your arms and lock out above the bar.
4. Lower yourself back to the hang with control and reset your grip.
Safety cue: Maintain a tight hollow body and transition under control

Health benefit: Increases lat strength and improves scapular control during vertical pulling
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Pull your chest toward the bar by driving your elbows down and squeezing your back.
3. Lower yourself with control to full arm extension.
Safety cue: Engage the scapula and avoid shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens biceps and upper back while supporting grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp the bar with a shoulder-width underhand grip and hang with arms straight.
2. Pull your chin above the bar by driving the elbows down and engaging the biceps.
3. Lower yourself slowly to the starting hang.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest and control the descent without swinging

Health benefit: Builds core and hip flexor strength with dynamic abdominal control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with an overhand grip and legs fully extended.
2. Engage your core and swing slightly to generate momentum.
3. Raise your legs by contracting the abs until your toes touch the bar.
4. Lower the legs back down with control to the dead hang.
Safety cue: Initiate toes-to-bar with controlled hip flexion and avoid using momentum

Health benefit: Develops maximal core tension and posterior chain stability under load
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and hold the bench behind your head with both hands for support.
2. Press your shoulders into the bench and lift your entire body so only your upper back contacts the bench.
3. Lower your body in a controlled hinge from shoulders to just above horizontal while keeping the body rigid.
4. Return to the top by driving the body up and maintain a straight line.
Safety cue: Brace the core and lower with a slow controlled descent

Health benefit: Improves isometric core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and place hands beside your hips on the ground.
2. Press into the floor with your hands and lift your hips and legs off the ground to form an L shape.
3. Hold the position with legs parallel to the floor and shoulders packed.
Safety cue: Press through the palms, lift the hips, and keep the spine long

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral chest strength and shoulder stability through staggered loading
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with one arm extended wide and the other hand under your shoulder.
2. Lower your chest toward the hand under your shoulder while the extended arm stays straight.
3. Push through the support arm to return to the top and shift weight to the opposite side.
4. Repeat the movement alternating sides with controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Shift weight deliberately and keep the working shoulder stacked

Health benefit: Builds unilateral pressing strength and advanced core antirotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Place one hand under your chest and spread your feet wide for a stable base.
2. Brace your core and lower your torso toward the ground by bending the elbow of the working arm.
3. Push through the hand to extend the arm and return to the starting position.
4. Keep the body in a straight line throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and maintain core tension through a slow controlled descent

Health benefit: Improves explosive upper body power and fast neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Lower your chest to the ground and then explosively push off the floor to leave contact.
3. Clap your hands quickly while airborne and land softly back into the push-up position.
Safety cue: Explode from a stable plank and absorb the landing with bent elbows

Health benefit: Develops upper body power and rapid force production
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands shoulder-width and body straight.
2. Lower your chest to the floor with controlled elbow bend.
3. Explode upward and push your hands off the ground.
4. Land softly on your hands and immediately repeat.
Safety cue: Brace your core and control the descent and landing

Health benefit: Enhances full body conditioning and anaerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing, drop into a squat, and place hands on the floor.
2. Kick feet back into a high plank and then pull feet forward toward your hands.
3. Explode upward into a high jump with full extension.
4. Land softly and reset the position.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves lower body explosive power and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width and swing arms back.
2. Explode upward, drive knees to your chest, and swing arms overhead.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and reset.
Safety cue: Drive arms up, keep chest tall, and absorb the landing with soft knees

Health benefit: Builds leg power and jump coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width and swing arms back.
2. Bend knees and hips into a quick countermovement.
3. Swing arms up forcefully and jump onto the box.
4. Land softly with both feet and stand tall.
Safety cue: Swing arms to generate power and fully extend hips while landing softly on the box

Health benefit: Increases horizontal explosiveness and hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge into a powerful squat.
2. Swing your arms and explode forward using hips and legs.
3. Land softly with knees bent and step back to start.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips, keep chest forward, and land in a balanced, soft stance

Health benefit: Enhances rotational power and multidirectional lower body agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a shallow squat with feet hip-width.
2. Swing arms and explode upward while rotating your hips and feet 180 degrees.
3. Land softly in a squat facing the opposite direction.
4. Reset your balance before repeating.
Safety cue: Rotate under control and absorb the landing with hips and knees bent

Health benefit: Develops unilateral strength and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg and lower hands to the ground.
2. Kick the free leg back into a plank while balancing on the support leg.
3. Hop the support leg forward to your hands and explode into a jump on the same leg.
4. Land softly on the same leg and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, move deliberately, and maintain balance with a braced core

Health benefit: Trains quick ground contact and reactive ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on both knees with hands on the ground.
2. Place hands under shoulders and explosively bring your feet forward under your hips.
3. Continue the momentum into a quick vertical jump.
4. Land softly on both feet and return to your knees.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips, keep chest upright, and land softly with knees bent

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination and core plus shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back holding one arm straight up and bend the opposite knee with foot on the floor.
2. Press the arm up and roll to your side, then rise onto your forearm and hand.
3. Drive through the planted foot and sweep the straight leg under you into a kneeling lunge.
4. Stand tall while keeping the arm overhead, then reverse the steps to return to the floor.
Safety cue: Move slowly through each step, brace the core, and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and side to side agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat with weight on one leg.
2. Push off explosively sideways and bound to the opposite leg while swinging arms.
3. Land softly on the opposite leg with a bent knee and rebound immediately.
Safety cue: Push off explosively, keep hips square, and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Develops lower body and posterior chain strength while improving overhead shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms raised overhead.
2. Sit back and lower to the floor with control until hips touch.
3. Roll onto your back and bring feet flat to prepare to stand.
4. Drive hips forward and stand while keeping arms extended overhead.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and core braced as you sit back and press overhead

Health benefit: Enhances explosive leg power and rotational coordination for dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing arms and explode upward while rotating your hips and shoulders in one direction.
3. Spot the landing and absorb the impact by bending the knees.
4. Reset your stance and repeat the jump in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and absorb the impact

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core strength while improving scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high push-up position with hands by your waist.
2. Shift your shoulders forward over your hands while keeping arms straight.
3. Hold the forward lean with core tight for the chosen duration.
Safety cue: Protract the shoulders and keep hips aligned over the hands with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and spinal rotational control while enhancing grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with a firm overhand grip and legs together.
2. Raise your legs to about 90 degrees while keeping them straight or slightly bent.
3. Rotate your hips and lower the legs to one side in a controlled arc.
4. Reverse through center and lower to the opposite side with control.
Safety cue: Engage the core and move the legs slowly with control to avoid shoulder swing

Health benefit: Improves spinal extension and posterior chain activation while increasing shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands and feet planted and chest open.
2. Press through hands and feet to lift into a full bridge.
3. Walk your hands backward or your feet forward a few steps while keeping hips lifted.
4. Walk back to the start and lower hips down with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and glutes engaged while stepping the feet with control

Health benefit: Develops single-leg strength and lateral stability while enhancing hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and arms extended level to the sides.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and bend that knee while the other leg stays straight.
3. Lower your hips until the working thigh is roughly parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to center and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and shift weight into the working heel while tracking the knee

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance while challenging ankle and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended forward and arms lifted overhead.
2. Hinge at the hips and begin lowering into a single-leg squat while keeping the extended leg straight.
3. Descend as low as you can with control while keeping chest upright.
4. Drive through the heel of the standing leg to return to standing and keep arms overhead.
Safety cue: Stay tall and lower with control keeping the knee aligned over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation while promoting scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from rings or a bar with a neutral or overhand grip and engaged shoulders.
2. Tuck knees to your chest and pull hips up toward the bar.
3. Rotate your shoulders and thread your legs through to invert behind the bar.
4. Reverse the rotation under control to return to the hanging start.
Safety cue: Move slowly with scapular control and only go as deep as your shoulder mobility allows

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioception while developing shoulder stability and body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor and step one foot forward into a lunge.
2. Kick the back leg up while driving through the front leg and reaching hips over shoulders.
3. Use a controlled kick to find the vertical position and adjust with the free leg.
4. Hold briefly against the wall or balance, then lower down with control.
Safety cue: Kick up with control keeping shoulders stacked over wrists and core hollowed

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength while improving knee extension control and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and reach both arms backward at shoulder height.
2. Rise onto your toes and begin to hinge your knees while leaning the torso back.
3. Lower knees forward until you feel strong tension in the quads while staying on your toes.
4. Push through the toes to return upright and keep arms reaching back.
Safety cue: Keep the torso upright and lower with control keeping the knee tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances upper body strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in one line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending both elbows.
3. Push back up to the starting position to full arm extension.
4. Keep your core tight and your body straight throughout.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral throughout the movement

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and legs straight.
2. Keep your body in a straight line and engage your core.
3. Breathe evenly and hold the position for over 30 seconds.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulders down and back and maintain a long straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and increases upper body blood flow
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Begin making large, rapid circles with both arms simultaneously.
3. Maintain steady breathing and continue the rapid circles for the set time.
Safety cue: Control the motion by keeping shoulder blades stable and start slow if needed

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and feet slightly forward.
2. Place arms against the wall with elbows bent and shoulders down.
3. Slide your arms up the wall overhead to full range of motion.
4. Lower your arms back to the start while maintaining contact with the wall.
Safety cue: Press lower back and shoulders gently against the wall and move with steady control

Health benefit: Increases chest flexibility and promotes thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your torso through the doorway.
3. Hold the position while feeling a deep stretch across the chest.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply and keep ribs down while avoiding excessive arching of the lower back

Health benefit: Strengthens rotator cuff muscles and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your top elbow bent at 90 degrees and upper arm along your torso.
2. Rotate your forearm upward away from your body through external rotation.
3. Lower the forearm back to the starting position with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep elbow tucked at your side and rotate with slow controlled movements

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles and supports spinal alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms fully extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest, arms, and legs off the floor by squeezing your back and glutes.
3. Hold briefly at the top and then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift through the upper back while keeping neck neutral and avoid jerky motions

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular activation while challenging shoulder coordination and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Rapidly reach both arms overhead as high as possible and then return them down.
3. Repeat the fast overhead reaches continuously for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Reach smoothly and maintain a neutral spine without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances aerobic fitness and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while raising both arms overhead and clap hands.
3. Jump back to the starting position and repeat with impact each rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and absorb force through hips and ankles

Health benefit: Improves core stability and balance through contralateral limb engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm fully forward and the opposite leg fully back until straight.
3. Pause while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Return to the start and switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace the core and move slowly keeping hips level and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and overhead shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at sides.
2. Raise arms overhead into a Y with thumbs pointing up.
3. Squeeze shoulder blades and keep a slight bend in elbows.
4. Lower arms slowly back to sides.
Safety cue: Keep scapulae stable while raising arms into a Y

Health benefit: Improves posterior shoulder strength and upper back muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms extended to the sides.
2. Raise arms to shoulder height creating a T with palms facing down.
3. Squeeze shoulder blades and keep elbows soft.
4. Lower arms slowly back to sides.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades as you open arms to a T

Health benefit: Increases shoulder horizontal adduction range and tissue flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bring one arm across the chest.
2. Grab the upper arm with the opposite hand and pull gently.
3. Hold the stretch while breathing evenly.
4. Release and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down while applying controlled cross-body pressure

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and improves thoracic and lumbar movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders.
2. Press palms firmly into the floor and arch the back upward.
3. Reverse by dropping the belly and lifting the chest while pressing hands down.
4. Move slowly between positions with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Move slowly through cat and cow while coordinating steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances upper trapezius endurance and neck stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Shrug both shoulders up toward the ears rapidly.
3. Lower shoulders back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Shrug with a slow controlled tempo to avoid neck tension

Health benefit: Builds upper arm pushing strength and elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench and place hands beside hips.
2. Slide hips off the bench and bend elbows to 90 degrees.
3. Push through palms to straighten elbows and raise hips.
4. Lower hips back down slowly toward the floor.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back while lowering until elbows reach a right angle

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and core activation during forward bending
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk hands forward only a short distance while keeping hips high.
3. Walk hands back toward feet and rise slowly to standing.
Safety cue: Brace your core and hinge at the hips to keep your spine flat

Health benefit: Develops full body coordination and low load core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift knees a few inches off the floor.
2. Keep back flat and gaze down as you shift weight forward.
3. Move right hand and left foot forward a small step.
4. Alternate limbs slowly while maintaining a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and core engaged while taking slow controlled steps

Health benefit: Increases muscular endurance of the chest and anterior shoulder muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Place hands on the wall at chest height and step back slightly.
3. Bend elbows to bring chest toward the wall.
4. Push through palms to straighten arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip hinge coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and arms at the sides.
2. Raise one arm overhead and hinge at the hip toward the opposite foot.
3. Slide the opposite hand down the leg while keeping the raised arm extended.
4. Return slowly to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine and move each rep slowly

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and calf flexibility while promoting shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders.
2. Lift hips up and back while straightening legs and pressing palms into the floor.
3. Press heels toward the mat and lengthen through the spine.
4. Hold the position and maintain steady tension through shoulders and core.
Safety cue: Press hips back and heels toward the floor while keeping a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and enhances trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked.
2. Prop your forearm under your shoulder and lift your hips so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep the bottom knee on the floor and engage your core to hold the line.
4. Extend the top arm overhead or toward the ceiling and maintain alignment.
Safety cue: Stack shoulder over elbow and keep hips lifted in a straight line

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves balance and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms ready to pump.
2. Step forward into a deep lunge, lowering the back knee toward the floor.
3. Pump your arms aggressively front-to-back as you descend.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and improves hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drive one knee up to hip level while swinging the opposite arm up.
3. Alternate knees rapidly, lifting each knee high with control.
4. Pump both arms actively with each step to increase intensity.
Safety cue: Drive knees up with a tall posture and land softly through the midfoot

Health benefit: Opens the chest and promotes thoracic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and clasp your hands behind your back.
2. Pull your hands down and away while opening your chest.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and hold the expansion.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked and both arms extended forward.
2. Lift the top arm and rotate your upper back to reach the arm across your chest.
3. Open the top arm upward and then behind you, rotating through the thoracic spine.
4. Keep your hips stable and hold the rotated position.
Safety cue: Rotate from the thoracic spine while keeping the hips anchored and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder blade strength
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a high plank with hands under shoulders and legs extended.
2. Keep arms straight and squeeze shoulder blades together to allow the chest to dip slightly.
3. Push through your hands to spread the shoulder blades and return to the protracted position.
Safety cue: Protract and retract the shoulder blades slowly without bending the elbows

Health benefit: Develops inner thigh strength and hip external rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out, and raise arms level in front.
2. Push your hips back and bend knees into a deep plie squat.
3. Keep your chest lifted and knees tracking over your toes.
4. Drive through your heels to rise while keeping your arms level.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and hinge from the hips with chest lifted

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and reduces stiffness through full range motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift your shoulders toward your ears.
2. Roll your shoulders backward in a large, full-range circle.
3. Reverse the direction and roll your shoulders forward in a large, full-range circle.
Safety cue: Move the shoulders slowly through a comfortable range while keeping the neck long

Health benefit: Lengthens quadriceps and improves knee joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee, bringing your heel toward your glutes.
2. Reach behind and grab your foot or ankle with the same hand.
3. Pull your heel gently toward your glutes while keeping knees close together.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and gentle shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with toes together and knees apart.
2. Sit back toward your heels and place your palms on the mat.
3. Reach your arms forward away from your hips while pressing your chest down.
4. Actively pull your shoulder blades forward and lengthen through the fingertips.
Safety cue: Keep hips back and spine long while reaching with control

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and engages upper body for improved coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Set the treadmill to a moderate incline and a comfortable walking speed.
2. Stand tall with a slight forward lean from the ankles.
3. Pump your arms vigorously front to back with elbows bent.
4. Maintain brisk steps and coordinate each arm drive with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall posture, drive arms purposefully and keep shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Increases thoracic extension and chest mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands under your shoulders.
2. Press into your palms and straighten your arms to lift your chest.
3. Lock your elbows briefly while keeping your shoulders down.
4. Look slightly upward and hold the lifted position with a long spine.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and raise one arm overhead.
2. Keep hips square and reach through the raised hand.
3. Lean laterally toward the opposite side until you feel a side stretch.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged as you reach overhead to avoid collapsing the torso

Health benefit: Develops shoulder pressing strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hips high and legs straight.
2. Bend your elbows to lower the crown of your head toward the floor.
3. Push through your shoulders to straighten your arms and return to start.
4. Keep your core engaged and hips elevated throughout each rep.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, keep head between arms and maintain a braced core

Health benefit: Builds dynamic upper body strength and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Swoop your chest down and forward while lowering your hips.
3. Arch your back and lift your chest into an upward-facing position.
4. Reverse the motion by pushing back to the starting downward dog.
Safety cue: Move with a controlled tempo, keep core engaged and maintain a smooth spinal line

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and upper body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a pike position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width.
2. Dive forward by lowering your chest toward the floor and sweeping it forward.
3. Arch your back and lift your head and chest into an upward-facing position.
4. Reverse the sweep to return to the pike start and repeat.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest and control the transition while keeping shoulders stable

Health benefit: Improves rotational core strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower into a pushup while bringing one knee to the same-side elbow.
3. Push back up and return your foot to the starting position.
4. Repeat the lowering and knee drive on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases core stability while raising heart rate for conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet together and hands under shoulders.
2. Jump your feet out wide keeping your hips level.
3. Jump your feet back together to the starting position.
4. Maintain a tight core and steady breathing throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts aerobic capacity and recruits core and hip flexors dynamically
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest while keeping the other leg extended.
3. Quickly switch legs in a running rhythm by alternating knee drives.
4. Keep your hips low and maintain a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over wrists, brace the core and breathe steadily as you drive the knees

Health benefit: Builds full body strength and aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Squat and place hands on the floor in front of you.
3. Step one foot back, then the other into a plank position.
4. Step both feet forward, stand up, and reach overhead to finish.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and land softly

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder and core stability while improving coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with hands behind hips and feet flat.
2. Lift hips until torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Walk hands and feet forward quickly while keeping hips lifted.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and step with control

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves glute and hamstring engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed slightly behind hips.
2. Press through hands and heels and lift hips until body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze glutes and hold the straight position.
Safety cue: Press through heels and lift hips into a straight line

Health benefit: Develops lateral core strength and spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side with feet stacked and elbow under the shoulder.
2. Press the forearm into the floor and lift hips until the body forms a straight line.
3. Reach the top arm up or rest it on your hip and hold the position.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbows and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Increases oblique strength and balance while enhancing shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift your top leg and top arm upward to form a straight line from foot to hand.
3. Hold the star position while keeping hips lifted and body aligned.
4. Lower the leg and arm back to side plank to exit.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level in the star position

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and anti rotation control while building shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet slightly wider than hip-width.
2. Brace your core and shift weight to one side.
3. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while keeping hips steady.
4. Return the hand and repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and minimize torso rotation while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Builds deep core strength and improves pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift shoulders and legs a few inches off the floor while pressing your lower back into the ground.
3. Hold the hollow shape with arms and legs extended and core engaged.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and maintain the hollow shape while breathing

Health benefit: Targets abdominal strength and hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees slightly bent and hands placed behind your head.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor while balancing on your sit bones.
3. Straighten the legs to form a V and lower back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and control the descent to protect the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal control and hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with an overhand grip and arms fully extended.
2. Brace your core and bend your knees, lifting them toward your chest.
3. Lower your legs with control back to the hang position.
Safety cue: Use slow controlled reps and avoid swinging to maintain core tension

Health benefit: Improves grip endurance and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with hands shoulder-width apart and arms fully extended.
2. Hang with shoulders engaged and body relaxed while keeping feet together.
3. Maintain the hang for the desired time and then step or pull down to exit.
Safety cue: Hang with scapulae engaged and avoid shrugging toward the ears

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk hands forward until you reach a full plank with a straight body line.
3. Hold the extended plank briefly then walk feet forward toward hands while keeping legs straight.
4. Reset by standing tall and repeat the inchworm pattern.
Safety cue: Brace your core and hinge at the hips to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances total body coordination and cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low bear position with knees off the ground and hips low.
2. Drive the opposite hand and foot forward quickly in a crawling rhythm.
3. Maintain a stable core and fast cadence as you move forward.
4. Keep movements light and continuous without rising the hips.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and shoulders packed while moving with controlled steps

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on all fours with hands planted under shoulders and knees hip-width.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling while keeping the knee bent and hands anchored.
3. Lower the leg back to the starting position with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Anchor hands under shoulders and squeeze the glute to lift without arching the back

Health benefit: Enhances leg strength and rotational mobility of the torso
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a lunge with the front knee over the ankle.
2. Lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg while keeping the hips square.
4. Push through the front heel to stand and step forward into the next lunge.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and rotate from the upper back while stepping with control

Health benefit: Develops explosive power and dynamic core control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with hands under shoulders and feet together.
2. Push through the hands to lift the chest and explode into a quick pop-up to the feet into a low surf stance.
3. Settle into a balanced squat with knees bent and repeat the pop-up movement.
Safety cue: Land softly and drive through the hips to rise with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and upper body pressing stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands forming a diamond under your chest.
2. Lower your chest toward the diamond by bending the elbows while keeping the body straight.
3. Push back up to the starting plank position by extending the elbows.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to the body and core engaged to avoid sagging hips

Health benefit: Enhances lower body power and vertical reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Lower into a squat until hips are below parallel while preparing to jump.
3. Explode upward, reaching both arms overhead, and land softly back into the squat.
Safety cue: Explode through the heels and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Increases aerobic activity and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Jump feet out to a wide squat while swinging arms overhead.
3. Jump feet back together and swing arms down to return to the start; repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain chest up and control the hip-width squat as you swing the arms

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with arms extended out to the sides for balance.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower the torso while extending the non-standing leg straight back.
3. Keep a flat back and reach arms forward as you stretch the hamstring on the standing leg.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a flat back and keep the standing knee slightly bent

Health benefit: Engages obliques and enhances abdominal muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands lightly at your head and legs lifted in tabletop.
2. Rotate the torso and pull the head slightly toward the opposite knee as you extend the other leg.
3. Switch sides in a controlled pedaling motion while maintaining a gentle pull on the head.
4. Continue alternating knees and elbows with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance and drive off one foot into a lateral jump.
2. Land softly on the opposite foot with a slight knee bend.
3. Pump both arms horizontally across your chest as you jump.
4. Alternate sides continuously with controlled rebounds.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and keep core braced

Health benefit: Improves full body mobility and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in Downward Dog with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Shift your weight forward into Plank keeping a straight line from head to heels.
3. Push back into Downward Dog by lifting hips and pressing hands.
4. Repeat the flow with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Flow slowly keeping shoulders pulled away from ears and spine long

Health benefit: Develops balance, wrist strength, and body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Squat low and place hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Lean forward and place knees or shins onto the backs of your upper arms.
3. Shift weight into your hands and try to lift one foot then the other.
4. Tuck toes and balance while keeping gaze slightly forward.
Safety cue: Shift weight onto the hands gradually with core engaged and gaze forward

Health benefit: Builds oblique strength and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides.
2. Lift legs together to vertical and brace your core.
3. Lower legs to one side with control until near the floor.
4. Sweep legs across the center to the opposite side and repeat.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and move each rep with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Challenges core endurance and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead on the floor.
2. Lift legs a few inches off the ground and engage your core.
3. Flutter legs up and down in small, rapid pulses while keeping arms still.
Safety cue: Keep lower back flattened and breathe steadily throughout the set

Health benefit: Boosts explosive lateral power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on one leg and swing the other leg behind you.
2. Explode laterally onto the planted foot and drive both arms up high.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot with knees bent.
4. Repeat the lateral hops with strong arm drive.
Safety cue: Land on the midfoot with knees tracking over toes and drive arms upward for balance

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank with feet stacked and bottom hand under shoulder.
2. Rotate your top arm down and thread it under your torso.
3. Open the arm back up and lift your chest toward the ceiling.
4. Continue rotating the arm for each rep while keeping hips lifted.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Improves shoulder endurance and balance confidence
Steps to perform:
1. Face away from the wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Kick one leg up and use the wall to catch your heels in a straight handstand.
3. Press through your shoulders and hold a tight hollow body.
4. Breathe steadily and maintain alignment against the wall.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders active and core engaged to prevent arching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases overhead pressing strength and upper body control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width.
2. Bend your elbows slowly to lower your head toward the floor.
3. Press through your palms to extend the elbows and return to full handstand.
4. Repeat the controlled lowering and pressing for the set.
Safety cue: Lower with control while keeping a tight core and a long neck alignment

Health benefit: Develops dynamic balance, coordination, and spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a freestanding or wall-assisted handstand.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and take a small step with the other hand.
3. Continue alternating hand steps to move forward.
4. Keep a tight core and controlled shoulder engagement while walking.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps with shoulders stacked over wrists and core braced

Health benefit: Develops shoulder mobility and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands on the floor and walk feet up the wall until body is vertical.
2. Shift weight into your shoulders and press hands down to hold the vertical position.
3. Walk hands back down the wall to return to the starting position.
4. Lower chest to the floor to finish the rep.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and shoulder stability as you ascend

Health benefit: Builds combined pulling and pushing power for full upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with a false or overhand grip and hang with straight arms.
2. Pull explosively until your chest clears the bar and your elbows drive high.
3. Roll your chest over the bar and transition into the dip position.
4. Press down to straighten your arms and lock out above the bar.
Safety cue: Keep a tight hollow body and control the transition between pull and press

Health benefit: Increases lat and back strength while improving grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the bar with a wide overhand grip and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Pull your body up until your chin clears the bar and your chest approaches the bar.
3. Lower yourself slowly to the dead hang with controlled tension.
Safety cue: Lead with your chest and retract shoulder blades before every rep

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and upper back strength with improved pulling capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with a shoulder-width underhand grip and hang tall.
2. Pull your chin above the bar by driving your elbows down and back.
3. Lower yourself with control until your arms are fully extended.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close and drive through the lats with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Challenges abdominal control and hip flexor strength during dynamic hanging movements
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip and legs straight.
2. Engage your core and swing your legs up using hip flexion.
3. Touch the bar with your toes while keeping legs straight.
4. Lower your legs back to the hanging position with control.
Safety cue: Brace the core and control the swing while lifting toes to the bar

Health benefit: Develops intense core stability and whole body tension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench or floor and grip the anchor behind your head firmly.
2. Brace your core and press your feet toward the ceiling to lift your body into a straight line.
3. Lower your body slowly while keeping the torso rigid and hips elevated.
4. Stop just before your back touches the bench and repeat the controlled descent.
Safety cue: Anchor your shoulders and lower with a slow controlled descent

Health benefit: Builds isometric core and hip flexor strength while improving posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor between parallettes or hands and place hands beside your hips.
2. Press down through your hands to lift your hips and legs until legs are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the L position with legs straight andhips elevated.
Safety cue: Depress the shoulders and keep legs straight while engaging the core

Health benefit: Promotes unilateral chest and shoulder strength with enhanced core bracing
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands set wider than shoulder width.
2. Shift your weight to one arm while straightening the opposite arm out to the side.
3. Lower your chest toward the weighted arm while keeping the other arm straight.
4. Push back to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Control the lateral shift and keep a straight spine as you lower

Health benefit: Increases unilateral pressing strength and shoulder stability under load
Steps to perform:
1. Place one hand under your chest and set your feet wider than hip width.
2. Keep your body straight and lower your torso toward the floor on the single arm.
3. Push explosively through that arm to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Square the hips and maintain a rigid torso while lowering and pressing

Health benefit: Improves explosive upper body power and neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Lower into a push-up and explode upward with enough force to lift your hands off the ground.
3. Clap your hands quickly while airborne and land softly back into the next push-up.
Safety cue: Explode upward with a strong core and land softly with bent elbows

Health benefit: Improves upper body explosive strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest to the floor with control.
3. Explode upward and push your hands off the ground.
4. Land softly with bent elbows and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and land softly with elbows tracking under shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances full body power and cardiovascular efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Drop into a squat and place hands on the floor.
3. Kick feet back into a plank and immediately return them to your hands.
4. Explode upward into a high jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the descent into the plank

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and bend knees slightly.
2. Swing arms back then drive them overhead as you jump upward.
3. Pull knees toward your chest and tuck at the top.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet with knees slightly bent.
Safety cue: Drive arms up and pull knees to chest, landing quietly with soft knees

Health benefit: Develops explosive leg power and reactive jump mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Swing arms back and bend knees into a quarter squat.
3. Explode upward, swing arms forward, and jump onto the box.
4. Land softly with both feet flat and stand tall.
Safety cue: Explode from the hips and land softly with hips back and knees bent

Health benefit: Builds horizontal force production and overall lower body explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips.
2. Swing arms back and bend knees into a loaded position.
3. Explode forward driving through the heels and swing arms forward.
4. Land with both feet together and absorb with bent knees.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and swing arms to drive forward, landing softly with bent knees

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and multidirectional lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and lower into a squat.
2. Explode upward while rotating your hips and torso 180 degrees.
3. Land softly in a squat facing the opposite direction.
4. Reset your stance and repeat the rotation.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and spot your landing, absorbing impact through bent hips and knees

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral strength and balance under dynamic conditions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and place hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Kick the free leg back into a single-leg plank and perform one pushup.
3. Pull the leg forward, spring the foot under you, and stand up on the same leg.
4. Explode into a small jump on that leg and repeat.
Safety cue: Move deliberately through each phase and keep hips level to maintain balance

Health benefit: Trains explosive hip extension and rapid force generation
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with hands on the floor under shoulders.
2. Swing hips forward and push off with feet to bring feet beneath hips.
3. Explode upward to stand tall with arms reaching overhead.
4. Control the descent back to kneeling and repeat.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips to stand and land softly with knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Improves full body stability and coordinated core to limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back holding one arm straight up and the same-side knee bent.
2. Roll onto your elbow and then press up to a tall forearm position.
3. Push to a hand, lift hips, and sweep the straight leg back into a kneeling lunge.
4. Stand up tall keeping the arm overhead, then reverse the steps to return.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance for change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with knees slightly bent.
2. Push off laterally and drive your opposite knee across your body.
3. Bound to the other side landing on the opposite foot softly.
4. Absorb the landing with a bent knee and immediately rebound.
Safety cue: Drive laterally from the hips and land under control with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width, arms by your sides, and chest tall.
2. Swing arms up and back as you push hips back and bend your knees.
3. Continue the arm swing overhead as you sit and roll onto your back with chin tucked.
4. Drive through your feet, swing arms forward, and pop back to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and control the descent

Health benefit: Improves explosive power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and bend your knees.
2. Wind up your arms and rotate your torso to initiate the turn.
3. Jump explosively and rotate 360 degrees in the air.
4. Land softly with knees bent and absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent to absorb the rotation

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core strength for horizontal support
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor and extend legs back into a plank.
2. Lean shoulders forward over your hands while keeping arms straight and core tight.
3. Hold the forward lean for the desired time and slowly return to plank.
Safety cue: Pack the shoulders and brace the core as you lean forward

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and grip while increasing spinal rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with a shoulder-width grip and legs together.
2. Raise your legs to at least 90 degrees by hinging at the hips.
3. Rotate your hips and sweep your legs to one side with control.
4. Reverse through center and sweep your legs to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Brace the core and move the legs slowly to avoid hip swinging

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and whole body balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on one forearm or hand with feet stacked.
2. Lift the top leg and the top arm toward the ceiling to form a star shape.
3. Squeeze glutes and core to maintain a straight line from head to toes.
4. Hold the balance and lower both arm and leg back to the starting plank.
Safety cue: Stack shoulder over hip and keep a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Develops upper body balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor facing a wall or open space.
2. Step forward and kick one leg up while the other leg drives to push you into the handstand.
3. Adjust finger pressure and keep the body tight to find balance.
4. Tuck and bring your feet down under control to exit.
Safety cue: Kick up with control and keep shoulders stacked over wrists with core engaged

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain strength and shoulder extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press into a full bridge with hands and feet on the floor.
2. Walk your hands overhead toward your feet while keeping hips lifted.
3. Continue walking hands over until shoulders extend and chest opens.
4. Reverse the hand walk back to the starting bridge and lower down.
Safety cue: Press through the feet and control the hands as you walk the bridge out

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a wide stance with arms extended straight out to the sides.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Squat down on the loaded leg until the thigh approaches parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the loaded foot to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and shift weight slowly to the working leg

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and controlled rotational strength
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from rings or a bar with a firm grip and engaged shoulders.
2. Pull hips up and bring knees toward your chest while controlling the descent.
3. Rotate hips and shoulders to thread your feet through and lower into the inverted position.
4. Pull back through the rotation and return to a full hang with control.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the shoulders and keep the core engaged throughout
