Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength while promoting knee tracking awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and reach your arms back behind you.
2. Shift weight onto your toes and hinge the knees forward while leaning the torso back.
3. Lower until knees are deeply bent and then push through the toes to return upright.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and maintain an upright torso as you lower

Health benefit: Increases upper body muscular endurance in chest and shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands on the wall at chest height.
2. Lower your chest toward the wall by bending your elbows while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
3. Push away from the wall to fully extend your arms.
4. Repeat for high repetitions with controlled, steady movements.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and pace your reps

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with hands under shoulders and arms straight.
2. Brace your core and hold a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep your neck neutral and gaze down.
4. Hold the position for the target time while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep hips level with shoulders and brace your core

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and circulation to the upper limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and extend arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make large, controlled circles forward with straight arms.
3. Reverse direction and make large, controlled circles backward.
4. Continue for the set duration while keeping shoulders relaxed.
Safety cue: Control each circle and keep shoulders relaxed away from ears

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and enhances elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Bend one elbow to 90 degrees with the upper arm close to your torso.
3. Extend the working arm straight back until the elbow is fully extended.
4. Bend the elbow back to 90 degrees and repeat, then switch arms.
Safety cue: Anchor your upper arm and extend only at the elbow to control the movement

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexor flexibility and reduces hand stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front of you with the palm facing up and fingers relaxed.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers back toward your body.
3. Keep the elbow straight and hold the stretch.
4. Release and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Ease into the stretch and move slowly without bouncing

Health benefit: Improves wrist extensor range of motion and hand comfort
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front with the palm facing down and fingers pointing toward the floor.
2. Use the opposite hand to press the fingers down and toward your body.
3. Keep the elbow straight and hold the stretch.
4. Release and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Apply gradual pressure and keep the elbow soft to maintain control

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle coordination between breath and movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Press heavily into your palms and round the spine upward, tucking the chin (Cat).
3. Press into your palms and arch the spine, lifting the chest and tailbone (Cow).
4. Flow between Cat and Cow with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Shift weight evenly through the palms and move with a smooth breath rhythm

Health benefit: Enhances core and glute coordination for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm fully forward until the arm is straight.
3. Simultaneously extend the opposite leg fully back for balance.
4. Hold briefly, return to start, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Reach long through the arm while keeping hips square and core engaged

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump your feet wide while raising your arms overhead.
3. Jump your feet back together while lowering your arms to your sides.
4. Continue rapidly with controlled, soft landings.
Safety cue: Land quietly with knees softly bent and control your tempo

Health benefit: Opens chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one straight arm on the doorframe at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward to gently lean your chest through the doorway.
3. Keep the arm straight and rotate your torso away to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and draw shoulder blades down to avoid overarching the low back

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and promotes upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Raise both arms overhead and lock your elbows.
3. Reach your hands upward and slightly back.
4. Hold the locked overhead position.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lengthen the spine as you reach overhead

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and enhances chest and triceps endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows.
3. Keep your body in a straight line and tighten your core.
4. Push back up to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and lower with control

Health benefit: Strengthens upper neck and shoulder muscles for improved stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and clench your fists at your sides.
2. Shrug your shoulders straight up toward your ears while squeezing fists.
3. Lower your shoulders back down and relax the tension.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and lift shoulders straight up without jutting the chin

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift your knees an inch off the floor.
2. Keep your hips low and your gaze toward the ground.
3. Move your right hand and left foot forward slowly.
4. Continue alternating limbs to crawl forward.
Safety cue: Hold a neutral spine, engage the core, and move hands and feet deliberately

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and activates core muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hinge at the hips to reach toward the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward partway until you feel a partial plank.
3. Walk your feet toward your hands to return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a flat back and control the walk out and back

Health benefit: Targets triceps to increase arm pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair and place hands shoulder-width on the seat.
2. Slide your hips off the chair and extend your legs forward.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your hips toward the floor.
4. Push through your palms to extend your arms and lift your hips.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down, elbows close, and lower only until elbows reach about 90 degrees

Health benefit: Stretches calves and hamstrings while promoting shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank and lift your hips up and back into an inverted V.
2. Press your hands into the floor and lengthen your spine.
3. Hold the downward dog position steadily.
Safety cue: Press through the palms, send hips high, and lengthen the spine while breathing

Health benefit: Raises heart rate and improves hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and march in place lifting each knee to hip level.
2. Pump your opposite arm vigorously with each step.
3. Maintain an upright posture and a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall, drive knees to hip height and pump arms in rhythm with your breath

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and improves lateral spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and extend your arms out to the sides.
2. Rotate your torso and reach your right hand toward your left foot with legs straight.
3. Return to center with arms outstretched.
4. Repeat the reach on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and challenges balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a large step forward into a lunge.
2. Drop your hips to bend both knees while keeping your torso upright.
3. Swing your arms upward and forward in a quick motion as you step.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep the torso upright, step through with control and keep arms steady to avoid momentum

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thighs and improves hip mobility and lower body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned outward, and extend arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Bend knees and lower hips down and back until your thighs feel engaged.
3. Press through your heels to rise back to standing.
4. Squeeze your inner thighs and glutes at the top.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes with weight in the heels

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and engages core stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and raise arms straight overhead with hands together.
2. Keep arms straight and lean your torso slowly to one side while sliding hips slightly opposite.
3. Return to center and repeat the lean to the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and keep ribs stacked with the arm fully extended

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility during seated and standing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and open arms out in a T.
2. Draw knees toward your chest and lower them to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Pause at the end range and keep the opposite arm extended.
4. Return knees to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the mid back while keeping hips grounded and core engaged

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal extension and opens the chest to improve posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and elbows straight.
2. Press through your hands to lift your chest while keeping your elbows locked.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly, then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Soften the elbows and lift through the chest using the upper back

Health benefit: Builds lateral core stability and improves shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on your side with the lower knee bent and the lower hand or forearm on the floor under your shoulder.
2. Press into the hand or forearm and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from the bent knee to your head.
3. Keep the top arm extended or resting on your hip while holding the position.
4. Lower your hips back down with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulder over elbow and keep hips lifted in line from knee to shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and improves shoulder blade mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with arms straight and hands under your shoulders.
2. Keep your arms straight and push your chest away by protracting the shoulder blades.
3. Pull your shoulder blades together to allow a slight drop in the chest without bending the elbows.
4. Repeat the protraction and retraction with slow, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Perform slow scapular protractions and retractions with arms straight and neck neutral

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and improves hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a light fighting stance with feet staggered and hands up by your face.
2. Extend one arm fully to throw a straight punch while rotating your torso.
3. Retract the arm back to guard and then extend the other arm fully.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and move lightly on your feet.
Safety cue: Brace the core and snap the punch without locking the elbow at full extension

Health benefit: Enhances gait efficiency and increases overall energy expenditure
Steps to perform:
1. Walk forward with an upright posture and relaxed shoulders.
2. Swing your arms vigorously from the shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
3. Keep a brisk pace and coordinate each arm pump with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and swing the arms from the shoulders with relaxed elbows

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation flexibility and promotes upright seated posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit cross-legged on the floor and place your hands beside your hips.
2. Press into your hands and lift your hips slightly to take weight through your hands.
3. Hold the supported position and keep your spine tall.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and distribute weight evenly through both sit bones

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles to support back and hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Keep your arms locked and lift your chest, arms, and legs off the floor together.
3. Squeeze your glutes and lower back while holding the raised position.
4. Lower back down with control and reset.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes spinal and hip mobility and encourages gentle shoulder opening
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels.
2. Reach arms forward and lower your torso toward your thighs.
3. Spread fingers and press your palms firmly into the mat.
4. Rest your forehead down while maintaining pressure through the hands.
Safety cue: Press hands into the mat to lengthen the spine and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Improves shoulder girdle mobility and strengthens scapular stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and straighten your spine.
2. Extend both arms straight overhead into an "I" and hold briefly.
3. Move arms diagonally outward and up into a "Y."
4. Bend elbows and pull arms down to form a "W."
Safety cue: Move with scapular control and keep the neck long

Health benefit: Develops upper body power and enhances coordination and rhythm
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width apart and raise arms overhead.
2. Swing arms down quickly and clap your hands above or in front of your head.
3. Repeat rapid overhead claps while keeping a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Land softly with shoulders packed and control the clap rhythm

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and hands behind hips fingers pointing forward.
2. Press through your palms to lift your hips off the floor.
3. Bend elbows to lower your hips toward the floor.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your elbows and lift your hips.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows tracking close to the body

Health benefit: Increases shoulder pressing strength and overhead stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend elbows and lower your head toward the floor.
3. Keep hips high and chest moving toward your hands.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the pike.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral neck and braced core as you lower with control

Health benefit: Enhances full body mobility while engaging shoulder and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in downward dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Lower your chest and swoop forward, dropping the hips and lifting the chest.
3. Arch your back and lift your gaze into a cobra-like position.
4. Push hips back up and lift into downward dog to complete the flow.
Safety cue: Flow with a long spine and steady breathing through each rep

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and develops dynamic upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a pike position with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend elbows and dive your chest forward and down toward the floor.
3. Slide your chest forward and lift into an upward-facing position.
4. Reverse the motion to push hips back and return to the starting pike.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest while keeping a long spine and active shoulders

Health benefit: Increases core stabilization and hip mobility during loaded pushing
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Lower your chest while bringing your right knee toward your right elbow.
3. Push back up and return the right leg to plank.
4. Repeat the lowering with the left knee on the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core tight as the knee drives toward the elbow

Health benefit: Challenges core endurance while improving shoulder stability and cardiovascular effort
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet together.
2. Jump your feet apart to a wide stance and then back together.
3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels while repeating the jumps.
Safety cue: Maintain a steady plank with hips level and shoulders over wrists

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and engages core and hip flexors dynamically
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest and then switch legs in a running motion.
3. Continue alternating quickly while keeping your hands planted on the floor.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep a stable plank while driving the knees with control

Health benefit: Improves full body conditioning and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides.
2. Squat and place hands on the floor, keeping knees soft.
3. Step one foot back, then the other into a high plank.
4. Step both feet forward to your hands and stand up.
Safety cue: Step back with control and keep hips level and core braced

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and posterior chain activation while improving coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind hips fingers facing forward.
2. Lift hips until torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Walk hands and feet alternately to move backward or forward while keeping hips elevated.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and shoulders stable while taking controlled steps

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes shoulder and core integration
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands behind hips fingers facing forward.
2. Press hands into the ground and lift hips until body is a straight line.
3. Hold the straight line from head to heels while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Lift hips into a straight line and press through heels while keeping neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves lateral core strength and promotes spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with feet stacked and bottom hand on the floor under your shoulder.
2. Press through the bottom hand and lift hips until body forms a straight line.
3. Stack shoulders and hold the line keeping top arm relaxed or raised.
4. Lower hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders to hold a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Builds core stability while challenging anti rotation and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width.
2. Tap your left shoulder with your right hand while keeping hips still.
3. Alternate taps, maintaining a stable plank and tight core.
Safety cue: Brace your core and minimize hip rotation while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Reinforces deep core engagement and hip flexor control for body tension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Engage your core and lift shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Reach arms toward your feet and hold the hollow position.
4. Keep the lower back pressed gently toward the floor.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and draw ribs down while holding the hollow

Health benefit: Develops abdominal strength and dynamic balance through hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright and lift legs slightly off the ground.
2. Lean back and lift legs and torso to form a V shape.
3. Extend arms forward and hold the V position with a tight core.
Safety cue: Keep your spine long, engage your core, and control the descent without rounding the back

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves grip endurance and hip flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing away.
2. Hang with arms straight and shoulders slightly engaged.
3. Raise knees toward your chest with control until hips bend.
4. Lower knees slowly back to the hanging position.
Safety cue: Hang tall with shoulders engaged and lift knees with a controlled core contraction

Health benefit: Improves grip endurance and shoulder stability while encouraging spinal elongation
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with hands shoulder-width and arms fully extended.
2. Hang with shoulders engaged and body relaxed below the bar.
3. Maintain the dead hang for time while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Hang tall with shoulders active and avoid shrugging toward the ears

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and core activation while promoting shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to touch the floor.
2. Walk hands forward until your body reaches a full plank position.
3. Pause in full extension with shoulders over wrists and core tight.
4. Walk feet toward hands keeping legs as straight as possible and stand.
Safety cue: Brace your core and maintain a flat back as you walk hands out and back

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and dynamic core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a tabletop with knees hovered and hips low.
2. Drive opposite hand and foot forward quickly.
3. Pump legs and arms in fast alternating strides.
4. Keep hips level and maintain a quick cadence.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and improves hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Plant hands shoulder-width under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drive one heel up toward the ceiling by extending the hip.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the hip while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and quickness
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with hands on the ground.
2. Jump feet back into a plank while pressing hands hard into the floor.
3. Jump feet forward near the hands and sink into a squat.
4. Explode upward, then return hands to the ground to repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and control the descent

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and enhances chest and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands under chest with thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond.
2. Brace the core and straighten the legs into a plank.
3. Lower chest toward the hands with elbows close to the ribs.
4. Push back up until arms are fully extended.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to the sides and core braced to protect the shoulders

Health benefit: Improves reactive balance and rapid transition mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width.
2. Push through hands and swing one foot under to plant near the opposite hand.
3. Drive the back leg to stand quickly and square the hips.
Safety cue: Explode through the hips and land with a neutral spine and soft knees

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and vertical explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand shoulder-width with chest up and hips back.
2. Bend deeply at the hips and knees while swinging arms back.
3. Explode upward, driving the arms forcefully overhead.
4. Land with knees bent and immediately reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Drive through the heels and land quietly with hips back and chest up

Health benefit: Combines cardiovascular challenge with hip mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and arms at sides.
2. Jump feet wide into a squat while swinging arms overhead.
3. Jump feet back together and lower arms to return.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and maintain an upright chest as arms swing

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power, balance, and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and reach the opposite arm across the body.
2. Push off the standing leg to leap laterally toward the other side.
3. Land on the opposite leg while reaching the free arm long across the chest.
4. Absorb the landing and immediately drive off to the next rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds wrist and arm strength while challenging core balance
Steps to perform:
1. Squat and place hands shoulder-width on the mat with fingers spread wide.
2. Bend elbows slightly and bring knees to rest on the outer triceps.
3. Lean weight forward and shift heels off the floor while engaging the core.
4. Lift both feet and attempt to balance on the hands for a brief hold.
Safety cue: Shift weight forward, gaze slightly ahead and keep core engaged to support the balance

Health benefit: Improves oblique strength and shoulder stability through rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on one forearm with feet stacked and hips lifted.
2. Extend the top arm straight up toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate the torso and bring the top arm down and through under the body.
4. Reverse the rotation to return the arm overhead and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core tight while rotating the top arm slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg and shift weight into the supporting foot.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the opposite hand toward the floor while lifting the rear leg.
3. Keep a flat back and slight bend in the standing knee as torso and raised leg form a straight line.
4. Drive hips forward to return to standing and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and controlled reach

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and dynamic core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in Downward Dog with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Shift weight forward and lower hips until the body forms a straight plank.
3. Hold the plank with shoulders over wrists and core engaged.
4. Press hips back to Downward Dog and flow between the two positions.
Safety cue: Brace the core and stack shoulders as you flow between positions

Health benefit: Improves core stability and anti-rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands under shoulders and a braced core.
2. Reach one arm straight forward while keeping hips level.
3. Return the arm and repeat on the other side, alternating slowly.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and avoid rotation as you extend each arm

Health benefit: Builds core and hip flexor strength and posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with hands beside hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Press into hands and lift hips off the floor while extending both legs forward.
3. Hold legs straight and hips lifted with a 90-degree torso-to-legs angle.
4. Lower hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Press through the hands and maintain a long, neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands lightly at the temples and knees bent.
2. Lift shoulders off the floor and bring one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg.
3. Alternate sides in a steady pedaling motion while keeping the head lightly supported by the hands.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin and drive the movement with your abs instead of pulling the head

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and coordination through explosive single-leg movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with knees soft and feet hip-width.
2. Swing arms vigorously to generate momentum and leap laterally onto the opposite foot.
3. Land softly on the ball of the foot and absorb with the knee, then immediately repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with bent knees and control your torso alignment

Health benefit: Improves spinal rotational mobility and oblique control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides and legs straight up.
2. Keep shoulders on the floor and lower both legs to one side until you feel resistance.
3. Use your obliques to lift legs back to center.
4. Lower legs to the opposite side and repeat in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and move the legs with controlled oblique engagement

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and proprioceptive balance in vertical alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Face away from the wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor a short distance from the wall.
2. Kick one leg up and rest both feet on the wall while stacking shoulders over wrists.
3. Press through your hands and engage core to hold a straight line against the wall.
4. Dismount by tapping one foot down then the other with control.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over wrists and engage the scapula to prevent arching

Health benefit: Develops overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kick into a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width and body tight.
2. Bend elbows to lower your head toward the floor in a controlled descent.
3. Pause briefly with elbows tracking slightly forward.
4. Press through your hands to extend elbows and return to the top.
Safety cue: Keep core tight, neck neutral, and lower with slow controlled reps

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic shoulder control and whole-body coordination during locomotion
Steps to perform:
1. Kick into a freestanding handstand with shoulders stacked and core engaged.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and take a small step with the opposite hand.
3. Continue alternating small hand steps while maintaining a straight body line.
4. Stop the walk by lowering one foot to the floor and returning to standing.
Safety cue: Hold a tight hollow body and take small controlled steps while looking forward

Health benefit: Develops combined pulling and pushing upper body strength and explosive transition power
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a sturdy bar with a false grip and hang with arms straight.
2. Pull explosively, drive your chest toward the bar, and lean back.
3. Rotate your wrists and push down to extend your arms over the bar.
4. Lower back to a dead hang with control.
Safety cue: Pull smoothly and keep your core tight to control the transition

Health benefit: Builds vertical pulling strength, scapular control, and strict back muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with hands shoulder-width and start from a dead hang.
2. Pull steadily until your chin clears the bar without using momentum.
3. Lower completely to a dead hang and reset before the next rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and upper back strength while improving elbow flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with an underhand shoulder-width grip and hang with arms straight.
2. Pull your chest toward the bar until your chin passes over the bar.
3. Lower under control to a full dead hang.
Safety cue: Drive elbows down and back while keeping ribs down and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens core and hip flexors while improving grip endurance and midline control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with a shoulder-width grip and brace your core.
2. Raise your legs together toward the bar using your abs.
3. Touch your toes to the bar at the top of the movement.
4. Lower your legs back to a dead hang with control.
Safety cue: Initiate with a hollow body and lead with the hips to minimize swinging

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and full body muscular endurance through high intensity movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then drop into a squat and place hands on the floor.
2. Kick your feet back into a plank and perform a quick push-up.
3. Jump your feet forward toward your hands and explode upward.
4. Land softly and reset into the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly through the balls of your feet and absorb impact with bent knees

Health benefit: Improves upper body power and rate of force development for explosive pushing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest and then push explosively so your hands leave the floor.
3. Clap hands quickly and return hands to the floor before landing.
Safety cue: Lower with control then explode upward while maintaining a tight plank line

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability, core tension, and balance while practicing inverted body positions
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a plank with feet against the base of a wall.
2. Walk your feet up and simultaneously walk your hands toward the wall.
3. Continue until your body is vertical against the wall.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the starting plank.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and move deliberately to preserve spinal alignment

Health benefit: Develops extreme core control and posterior chain tension for improved body rigidity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and grip a stable anchor behind your head.
2. Brace your core and lift your legs and hips to form a straight line.
3. Lower your body slowly while keeping it rigid and nearly parallel to the bench.
4. Hold briefly and press back up to the starting vertical position.
Safety cue: Brace the core and control the descent while maintaining a straight spine

Health benefit: Builds unilateral pushing strength and shoulder mobility while promoting scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands wide with one hand extended further to the side.
2. Shift your weight to the closer hand and lower your chest toward that hand.
3. Push back to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Shift weight laterally with a stable shoulder and neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops significant unilateral upper body strength, balance, and core antirotation capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Place one hand under your shoulder and the other behind your back.
2. Keep your body straight and lower your chest toward the floor.
3. Push back up to full arm extension while maintaining a rigid torso.
Safety cue: Place feet wide for balance and keep hips square while lowering under control

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and vertical jump performance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width apart and arms by your sides.
2. Swing your arms back then explosively drive them upward as you drop into a quarter squat.
3. Jump onto the box, bringing both feet to land together.
4. Land softly with knees bent and step down under control.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and core braced

Health benefit: Improves explosive knee drive and anaerobic power for short intense efforts
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Bend your knees and drive your arms down then explosively swing them upward.
3. Jump straight up and tuck your knees toward your chest.
4. Land softly with knees bent and immediately prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Drive the arms while keeping chest up and absorb the landing through hips and knees

Health benefit: Enhances horizontal power and hip extension strength for jumping distance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hinge slightly at the hips.
2. Swing your arms back then drive them forward as you explode through the legs.
3. Jump forward for maximum distance while extending your hips.
4. Land softly on both feet and absorb the impact with bent knees.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves rotational agility and rapid lower body force production
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and lower into a squat.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward while rotating your hips and feet 180 degrees.
3. Land softly into a squat facing the opposite direction.
4. Reset and repeat by squatting and jumping back the other way.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and land softly with chest up and knees aligned over toes

Health benefit: Develops unilateral strength and cardiovascular challenge with increased balance demand
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee.
2. Hinge forward, place hands on the floor, and kick the free leg back into a plank.
3. Perform a push-up, then jump the free leg forward under your hips.
4. Explode upward on the standing leg into a hop and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move deliberately through each step to control the single-leg transitions

Health benefit: Trains reactive ankle stiffness and improves jumping coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with hands resting on your thighs.
2. Swing your arms and explode upward, pushing through the knees to reach your feet.
3. Land on both feet into a soft squat and absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Explode from the hips and absorb the landing with bent knees and a braced core

Health benefit: Enhances full body stability and coordinated mobility transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one arm extended toward the ceiling and knees bent.
2. Press the hand up, roll to your elbow, then push to your hand and lift your hips.
3. Sweep the straight leg back and come to a half-kneeling position while keeping the arm vertical.
4. Stand up fully, then reverse the steps to return to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder packed and move each phase slowly with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Increases lateral power and improves dynamic balance for change of direction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and a forward lean.
2. Push off explosively sideways using the grounded leg and swing your arms for momentum.
3. Land softly on the opposite leg with a bent knee and absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds hip hinge coordination and upper body involvement for rising mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing then fold forward and lie chest-down with arms extended.
2. Press through your palms to lift your chest and roll onto your heels while bringing hands under shoulders.
3. Use an arm drive to pull your torso up and push your hips forward into a squat.
4. Stand tall, then reverse the movement to return to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and use a controlled arm drive to stand without rushing

Health benefit: Increases shoulder and core isometric strength and improves scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a push-up position with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Shift your shoulders forward past your hands while keeping elbows straight and core tight.
3. Hold the forward lean with a flat back, then return to a neutral plank.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves oblique strength and spinal rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip and legs together.
2. Engage the core and raise the legs to hip level or higher.
3. Rotate the hips to sweep the legs to one side until they align with the hands.
4. Control the movement back through center and sweep the legs to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep shoulders packed during each controlled rotation

Health benefit: Develops lower body power and aerial coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing the arms and explode upward while initiating a full body rotation.
3. Rotate the hips and shoulders to complete a 360-degree turn in the air.
4. Land softly on both feet with knees bent to absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest upright

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and unilateral shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank on one hand with feet together.
2. Keep the hips level and jump the feet wide apart quickly.
3. Jump the feet back together while maintaining single-arm support.
4. Switch arms and repeat the same sequence with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while moving the legs with control

Health benefit: Builds posterior chain strength and glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed by your ears.
2. Press into your hands and feet to lift the hips into a bridge position.
3. Walk the hands forward while keeping the hips elevated until arms are nearly extended.
4. Walk the hands back under the shoulders and lower the hips with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and keep a neutral spine while walking the feet out

Health benefit: Improves single leg strength and lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms extended at shoulder height.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Lower the hips into a deep squat on the bent-leg side while keeping arms level.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and sit back into the hips with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and spatial body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor a short distance away.
2. Step one foot forward and kick the other leg up toward the wall with force.
3. Find wall contact with the kicking leg and stack the shoulders over the hands.
4. Control the descent by lowering one leg and bringing the other down to the floor.
Safety cue: Engage shoulders and core and use a small controlled kick to reach vertical

Health benefit: Develops unilateral core resilience and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank and lift one forearm off the ground to balance on the opposite forearm.
2. Keep the hips square and the core braced with a neutral spine.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch arms with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core braced to prevent rotation

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from rings or a bar with arms fully extended and legs together.
2. Tuck the knees and pull the shoulders to rotate the hips back and through the arms.
3. Extend the legs down behind you while controlling the rotation into an inverted hang.
4. Tuck and pull to reverse the motion and return to the starting hang.
Safety cue: Move slowly and control your shoulders while keeping the spine long

Health benefit: Boosts reactive power and landing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a box or platform with feet hip-width and step forward off the edge.
2. Land on both feet and absorb the impact by bending the hips and knees deeply.
3. Immediately explode upward into a jump or reach tall from the landing.
4. Reset and step back onto the box or prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips and knees absorbing force and chest upright

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and improves knee tracking control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and extend the arms forward for balance.
2. Rise onto the balls of the feet and lean the torso back while allowing the knees to travel forward.
3. Lower the hips until the thighs are near parallel, then push through the toes to return upright.
Safety cue: Keep the torso upright and control the descent with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens core and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands flat under shoulders and extend legs behind you.
2. Press palms into the floor and straighten your arms.
3. Engage your core and keep a straight line from head to heels.
4. Hold steady breathing while maintaining a neutral neck.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and core braced

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet together.
2. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the floor while keeping a straight body line.
3. Touch or come close to the floor with your chest.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Lower with control keeping elbows close and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and promotes controlled torso movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips and hold a weight in both hands at chest level.
2. Inhale and drop the belly toward the mat while lifting your head and tailbone (Cow).
3. Exhale and round the spine, tucking the chin and tailbone while pressing the weight toward your chest (Cat).
4. Flow between the two positions with controlled breath.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow, controlled spinal flexion and extension with your breath

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm forward with the palm facing down and fingers pointing away.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and palm down toward the forearm.
3. Hold the stretch while keeping the elbow straight.
4. Switch arms and repeat the same controlled pull.
Safety cue: Support the forearm and ease into the stretch without forcing the wrist

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep the planted hand firm while extending the opposite leg straight behind you.
3. Extend the opposite arm forward while keeping hips square and core engaged.
4. Hold briefly, return limbs to the floor, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged as you extend the opposite arm and leg

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength with lower joint loading
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place palms flat at chest height with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step your feet back slightly while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend elbows to lower your chest toward the wall while keeping palms flat.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Align shoulders over wrists and lower with slow, controlled motion

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair or bench with hands gripping the edge beside your hips.
2. Slide your hips forward off the seat and extend your legs out with heels on the floor.
3. Bend elbows to lower your hips straight down until your arms form about 90 degrees.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips back up.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows pointing backward while lowering with control

Health benefit: Stretches posterior chain and promotes shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands shoulder-width and feet hip-width.
2. Press palms into the floor and lift hips toward the ceiling while straightening the legs as much as possible.
3. Keep the head between the arms and lengthen the spine by reaching the hips up and back.
4. Hold the position while breathing evenly and pedal the feet if needed.
Safety cue: Push hips back and up to lengthen the spine while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Improves forearm and wrist flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor and place both forearms flat in front of you with palms down.
2. Sit back toward your heels while keeping forearms pressed into the floor.
3. Hold the stretch while maintaining a straight spine and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and breathe into the stretch without collapsing the chest

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift your knees a few inches off the ground while keeping toes tucked.
2. Keep a flat back and engage your core while moving one hand and the opposite foot forward.
3. Take slow, controlled steps with the other hand and foot while maintaining low hips.
4. Continue crawling forward slowly for the desired distance or time.
Safety cue: Move deliberately with a flat back and steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips to place your hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward until your torso is nearly horizontal without dropping into a full plank.
3. Pause briefly with a flat back and braced core.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet and slowly rise to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and keep a flat back as you walk your hands out

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and shoulder stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed behind your hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Lift your hips off the floor and bend your elbows to lower your hips toward the ground.
3. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips back up.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows tracking backward as you lower

Health benefit: Activates glutes and improves posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Hold briefly at the top with ribs tucked, then lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and squeeze glutes to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and forearm coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides and elbows slightly bent.
2. Extend your hands forward and make rapid small circles with your wrists in one direction.
3. Continue briskly for the desired count or time.
4. Reverse the direction and repeat the rapid circles.
Safety cue: Control the wrist circles and keep elbows soft to protect the joints

Health benefit: Strengthens lower back and posterior chain muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and arms reaching overhead palms facing down.
2. Simultaneously lift your chest, arms, and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold the lifted position while keeping your neck neutral and core engaged.
4. Lower your limbs back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift through the upper back and glutes while keeping the neck long

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular endurance and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while swinging your arms overhead and land with knees soft.
3. Jump back to start and continue at a steady high-impact pace.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent to absorb impact

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and shoulder strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and place your bottom hand flat under your shoulder with legs stacked.
2. Press through your palm to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep your top arm resting on your hip or extended upward and hold the alignment.
4. Lower your hips down with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and hips and press through the supporting hand to keep a straight line

Health benefit: Improves spinal extension mobility and chest opening
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and wrists straight and aligned.
2. Press through your palms to lift your chest while keeping your elbows slightly bent.
3. Hold the lifted position, then lower your chest back to the mat with control.
Safety cue: Keep wrists neutral and initiate the lift from the upper back

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and hamstring mobility while engaging shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach one hand down toward the opposite foot while keeping the other arm overhead.
3. Touch or hover your hand near the shin or foot for support and rotate your torso back up.
4. Repeat the motion on the other side in a controlled, continuous sequence.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and maintain a long spine while the supporting hand presses down

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and encourages thoracic and hip opening
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels, then fold forward with your forehead toward the mat.
2. Extend your arms forward and press your palms actively into the floor to broaden your upper back.
3. Breathe and maintain the active palm press while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and arms straight.
2. Keep arms locked and lower your chest slightly by retracting the shoulder blades.
3. Push through your hands to protract the shoulder blades and raise the upper back.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move the scapulae together and apart without letting hips sag

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and enhances hip coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot forward into a lunge.
2. Lower your back knee toward the floor while keeping your torso upright.
3. Pump both arms forward and back with quick, controlled jerks.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and control arm swing to prevent trunk rotation

Health benefit: Enhances core stability while promoting controlled hip and shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Pull one knee slowly toward your chest in a controlled motion.
3. Extend that leg back slowly and then repeat with the other leg.
4. Maintain a steady, deliberate tempo throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and drive knees forward with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and improves shoulder stability through anti rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a forearm or high plank with a stable core.
2. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while keeping hips square.
3. Return the hand to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep hips steady while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity and engages lower body muscles at reduced impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at the base of the incline and lightly hold the rails with both hands.
2. Set a slow walking speed and a moderate incline on the treadmill.
3. Take controlled steps forward while maintaining an upright posture.
4. Keep a light grip on the rails and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Hold the rails lightly and walk with an upright chest without leaning

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and reinforces scapular upward rotation and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against the wall and palms touching the wall.
2. Slide your palms upward along the wall while keeping contact.
3. Continue sliding until arms reach overhead or as far as mobility allows.
4. Slide your palms back down the wall to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press lower back and palms into the wall and slide shoulders slowly

Health benefit: Increases thoracic spine mobility and enhances rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with one hand planted under your shoulder and the other behind your head.
2. Rotate your upper spine to lift the elbow of the hand behind your head toward the ceiling.
3. Thread that elbow under your torso toward the planted hand in a slow twist.
4. Repeat the motion for reps and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate from the thoracic spine with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Develops inner thigh strength while promoting hip external rotation and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned outward.
2. Place both hands on the floor between your feet for support.
3. Lower into a plie by bending the knees and keeping your chest lifted.
4. Press through the heels to rise back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and chest lifted as you lower into the plie

Health benefit: Warms shoulder joints and improves muscular endurance in the deltoids
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and clench both fists firmly.
2. Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
3. Make small, controlled forward circles with the clenched fists for reps.
4. Reverse direction and perform the same controlled circles backward.
Safety cue: Keep neck relaxed and initiate circles from the shoulders with relaxed fists

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and assists comfortable knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee to bring your heel toward your glute.
2. Reach back and grip your ankle with the same-side hand.
3. Pull the ankle gently toward your glute while keeping knees close together.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and chest lifted while gently pulling the ankle

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and improves shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width and hold weights at your sides with a heavy grip.
2. Raise both shoulders straight up toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Lower shoulders back down under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down away from ears and neck long

Health benefit: Improves aerobic endurance and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing tall with hands clenched at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee up toward hip level while keeping an upright torso.
3. Lower the right foot and immediately lift the left knee to repeat quickly.
4. Maintain a marching rhythm and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and lift knees with controlled breath

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying on your back with knees bent and hands flat on the floor by your head.
2. Press through your heels to lift hips into a bridge and squeeze your glutes.
3. Walk your hands forward on the floor while keeping hips elevated.
4. Walk hands back toward your feet, lower hips, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you extend and retract

Health benefit: Opens chest and promotes thoracic mobility for better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet shoulder-width and hold a band or object with a firm grip in front of you.
2. Pull your hands apart and open your chest while squeezing your shoulder blades.
3. Return your hands to the starting position under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and back while keeping ribs tucked

Health benefit: Combines upper body strength with hip mobility and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Bend elbows to lower your chest while bringing your right knee up to your right elbow.
3. Push through your hands to return to plank and return the right leg.
4. Repeat the lowering motion while bringing the left knee to the left elbow and alternate.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and core tight while moving the knee toward the elbow

Health benefit: Builds shoulder pressing strength and improves upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward the ground in a controlled manner.
3. Push through your shoulders to straighten your arms and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and keep a tight core to avoid neck collapse

Health benefit: Develops full body strength while enhancing spinal and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hips high and hands planted shoulder-width.
2. Sweep your chest forward and down while lowering your hips in a smooth arc.
3. Arch your back and lift your chest into an upward dog-like position.
4. Reverse the motion to return to downward dog and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a smooth spine and steady breath as you move through the arc

Health benefit: Challenges core stability while increasing heart rate and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank on your hands with feet together and body straight.
2. Jump your feet out wide like a jumping jack while keeping hips level.
3. Jump your feet back together and continue the quick jack motion.
Safety cue: Keep hips steady and core braced to prevent sagging or piking

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and enhances dynamic hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and core engaged.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest then quickly switch legs in a running motion.
3. Maintain a steady, alternating rhythm and keep your hips low.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and drive knees with controlled speed

Health benefit: Provides full body conditioning while improving functional movement efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width and hands at your sides.
2. Squat down, place hands on the floor, and step one foot back then the other into a plank.
3. Step both feet forward to your hands and stand up or perform a small jump.
4. Repeat the sequence at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Step back with control, land softly, and keep chest up to protect the lower back

Health benefit: Boosts lateral mobility and engages core glutes and shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind hips, fingers facing forward.
2. Lift hips so torso is parallel to the ground and gaze forward.
3. Step one hand and the opposite foot forward quickly, then follow with the other hand and foot.
4. Drive quick alternating steps while keeping hips elevated and core tight.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and shoulders stacked over wrists

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder stability and glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and palms flat on the floor beside hips.
2. Press through palms and heels to lift hips until body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the straight position, keeping shoulders stacked over wrists and glutes engaged.
Safety cue: Press through heels and lift hips into a straight line from shoulders to heels

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength shoulder stability and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stack feet and place bottom hand under shoulder with fingers spread.
2. Press up into a side plank on the hand and lift hips to align body.
3. Extend the top arm upward and lift the top leg to form a star shape.
4. Hold the star position with hips high and core braced.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and keep hips elevated to avoid sagging

Health benefit: Targets triceps and inner chest while improving upper body pressing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Position hands under chest with thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond.
2. Extend legs back into a straight pushup position with body in one line.
3. Lower chest toward the diamond by bending elbows close to your sides.
4. Push back up to the starting position while keeping elbows tucked.
Safety cue: Tuck elbows close to the ribs and maintain a tight core

Health benefit: Builds shoulder mobility and full body pressing strength with dynamic spinal movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend elbows and swoop the chest down and forward in a fluid arc toward the floor.
3. Continue the arc to lift the chest into an upward-facing position with hips low.
4. Reverse the motion by pushing hips back up into downward dog.
Safety cue: Lead with the chest and maintain a long spine during the swoop

Health benefit: Activates glutes and improves hip extension control while maintaining core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on all fours with hands planted under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keeping the knee bent, lift one heel toward the ceiling by driving the foot up.
3. Lower the knee back to the starting position with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core braced as you drive the heel up

Health benefit: Develops explosive power coordination and upper body shock absorption during dynamic jumps
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a deep squat with hands on the floor between your feet.
2. Explosively jump both feet back into a plank position and immediately jump them forward.
3. Land back in a deep squat and slap hands on the floor or chest for impact.
4. Repeat the forward-back explosive jumps with controlled landings.
Safety cue: Land softly through the hands with bent elbows and a braced core

Health benefit: Trains quick transitional balance and core coordination for standing from prone positions
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands by the chest.
2. Push through hands to pop the torso up while swinging one foot forward under your hips.
3. Land into a low surfing stance with knees bent and arms ready.
4. Repeat the pop-up movement smoothly to alternate front foot placement.
Safety cue: Keep a flat back and engage the core as you pop up

Health benefit: Challenges wrist strength balance and concentrated core stability during arm balancing
Steps to perform:
1. Squat low with feet shoulder-width and place hands on the floor shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend elbows slightly and place knees onto the upper arms near the triceps.
3. Lean weight forward, engage core, and lift one foot off the ground to balance.
4. Lift both feet if possible and hold the crow position with knees on triceps.
Safety cue: Press palms into the mat, brace the core, and gaze slightly forward for balance

Health benefit: Reinforces deep core endurance and posterior pelvic control with isometric tension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and reach hands forward gripping behind your thighs or shins.
2. Lift shoulders and legs slightly off the floor to create a hollow position.
3. Rock gently back and forth between the tailbone and upper back while maintaining the hollow.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back pressed to the floor and breathe evenly through the rocks

Health benefit: Improves core strength and trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and palms beside hips.
2. Lean back slightly and lift both feet off the floor.
3. Extend legs forward while pressing palms into the floor for support.
4. Hold the position with core engaged and lower back to start.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while balancing on your sit bones

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and hamstring flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place palms on the floor.
2. Walk palms forward until you reach a full plank with a straight body.
3. Hold the full extension briefly while keeping core tight.
4. Walk feet toward hands and stand up slowly.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and maintain a long flat back during the walkout

Health benefit: Boosts full body coordination and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with knees hovering a few inches off the floor.
2. Keep hips low and drive opposite hand and foot forward quickly.
3. Alternate limbs rapidly while maintaining a steady breathing rhythm.
4. Continue crawling forward at a fast, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Stay low with controlled quick steps to protect the spine and shoulders

Health benefit: Develops isometric core stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with body in a straight line.
2. Extend your right arm forward until it is parallel to the floor.
3. Return the right arm to the plank and extend the left arm forward.
4. Alternate extensions while keeping hips square and stable.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you reach one arm forward

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the right leg with a slight bend in the knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the left leg back while lowering the torso.
3. Reach both hands toward the supporting foot or the floor.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and keep weight over the standing foot

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and dynamic agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start with a lateral hop to the right, landing on your right foot.
2. Swing your left leg behind and reach your left hand down to touch the floor.
3. Push off and leap laterally to the left, touching the floor with the right hand.
4. Continue alternating quickly in a skating rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with a slight knee bend and keep chest up during each lateral hop

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and core to posterior chain integration
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in Downward Dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Shift weight forward by rolling shoulders over wrists into a straight plank.
3. Push back through your hands to return to Downward Dog.
4. Flow between positions with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Move with control, keeping core engaged and shoulders stacked over wrists

Health benefit: Builds oblique stability and rotational shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side and prop your body into a side plank on the right forearm or hand.
2. Stack your feet and lift hips to create a straight line from head to heels.
3. Rotate your torso and thread the left arm under your body toward the floor.
4. Return the left arm overhead and repeat the rotation.
Safety cue: Stack hips and brace the core while rotating the top arm to maintain alignment

Health benefit: Increases abdominal strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and place palms beside your hips.
2. Press through the palms, straighten your arms, and lift your legs to form an L shape.
3. Hold the L-sit with core engaged and legs fully extended.
Safety cue: Press through the palms and brace the core to keep hips level and legs extended

Health benefit: Boosts lower body power and aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide and lower into a squat while reaching your hands to touch the floor.
3. Jump feet back together and stand up tall.
4. Repeat the jump, squat, and floor touch continuously.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and sit back into the hips as you control each squat landing

Health benefit: Improves abdominal muscular endurance and rotational core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hands behind your head.
2. Lift your shoulder blades and twist to bring one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg.
3. Switch sides in a controlled pedaling motion.
4. Continue alternating at a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and rotate from the torso

Health benefit: Enhances oblique engagement and spinal rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides and legs straight up.
2. Lower your legs to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Sweep your legs back up and over to the other side in a wide arc.
Safety cue: Brace your core and control the hip sweep with shoulders grounded

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and place your hands under your glutes.
2. Lift your legs a few inches off the floor with knees straight.
3. Flutter your legs by alternating small, quick up and down kicks.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis tucked and lower back in contact with the mat

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with a slight forward lean and arms ready for balance.
2. Push off one foot and hop laterally to land on the opposite foot, sweeping the rear leg behind.
3. Drive your arms across your body to assist balance on landing.
4. Repeat the lateral hops, alternating sides in a quick rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly on the midfoot with knees bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Develops leg strength dynamic balance and functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward with your right foot into a lunge.
2. Lower until both knees are bent and touch the back hand to the floor.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and step the back foot forward.
4. Continue walking lunges alternating legs each step.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates glutes and enhances hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Lift one knee and kick the leg back and through under the torso toward the opposite side.
3. Return the leg to the starting position under control.
4. Repeat on the other side and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while controlling the kick-through

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and lateral core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Step your right hand and right foot slightly to the right.
3. Follow with your left hand and left foot to move the plank sideways.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and move sideways with control

Health benefit: Improves upper body isometric strength and proprioceptive balance awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on the floor a few inches from the wall.
2. Kick up so both feet make contact with the wall and settle into the hold.
3. Straighten your body, press through your shoulders, and hold the position.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over wrists and press through the hands to hold alignment

Health benefit: Develops vertical pressing strength and overhead shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward the floor in a controlled descent.
3. Push through your hands to extend the elbows and return to the handstand.
Safety cue: Maintain a tight hollow body and control the descent with shoulders over wrists

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance coordination and inverted spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a freestanding or lightly wall-assisted handstand.
2. Shift your weight onto one hand and reach the opposite hand slightly forward.
3. Step that hand forward then the other in small controlled movements to travel.
4. Keep your shoulders stacked and use short, controlled steps to walk.
Safety cue: Keep core tight and shoulders packed while taking small controlled hand steps

Health benefit: Enhances explosive upper body power and fast-twitch muscle recruitment
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest until it is just above the floor.
3. Push explosively to lift your hands and clap once mid-air.
4. Land softly on your hands and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Brace your core and land softly with elbows slightly bent

Health benefit: Builds upper body explosive strength and improves neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor with control.
3. Push explosively so your hands leave the floor and land softly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the descent before each explosive drive

Health benefit: Develops unilateral pushing strength and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a wide push-up stance with one hand extended and the other under your chest.
2. Lower your body toward the bent-side arm while keeping the opposite arm straight.
3. Push through the bent-side hand to return to the wide start position.
4. Switch sides after the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and shift weight smoothly while maintaining a tight core

Health benefit: Increases single-arm pressing strength and challenges core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a staggered position with one hand under the center of your chest and feet wider than hip-width.
2. Brace your core and lower your torso toward the floor on one arm.
3. Push through the working hand to extend your elbow fully.
4. Control the descent and switch sides after the set.
Safety cue: Position feet wide, brace the midline, and lower with a controlled tempo

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and full body core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a plank position with your feet against the base of a wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while simultaneously walking your hands forward.
3. Continue until your body is near vertical and your core is tight.
4. Walk your hands back and lower your feet until you return to the plank.
Safety cue: Move slowly and keep shoulders stacked over wrists without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances full body conditioning and functional cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Drop into a squat, place your hands on the floor, and kick your feet back into a plank.
3. Perform a quick push-up, then jump your feet forward toward your hands.
4. Explode upward into a vertical jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and reset your posture before the next rep

Health benefit: Develops single leg power while challenging balance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg with the other leg slightly lifted.
2. Squat down on the standing leg and place your hands on the floor while extending the free leg back into a single-leg plank.
3. Perform a push-up, then hop your foot forward to your hands.
4. Explode upward off the standing leg into a jump and land on the same leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts explosive lower and upper body power and anaerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drop to a plank, perform a push-up, then jump your feet forward to your hands.
3. Explode into a high jump with strong arm drive and land softly.
Safety cue: Use a braced core and controlled arm drive to absorb impact efficiently

Health benefit: Combines pulling and pushing to improve upper body pulling strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width with palms over the bar and a tight grip.
2. Generate upward momentum with a strong pull and a short hip drive.
3. Transition by rolling your chest over the bar and shifting your wrists above it.
4. Press down to full lockout and lower with control.
