Safety cue: Keep a tight core, pull to chest level, and transition smoothly without aggressive kipping

Health benefit: Enhances pulling strength and grip endurance with increased forearm and wrist engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with a false grip so your wrists sit over the bar and palms face down.
2. Engage your shoulders and pull your chest up toward the bar.
3. Lower yourself with control to a full hang.
Safety cue: Maintain a strong false grip and retract the shoulder blades before initiating the pull

Health benefit: Builds upper body pulling strength and forearm grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the bar with an underhand grip and flex your wrists toward your forearms.
2. Pull your chest to the bar by driving elbows down and back.
3. Lower slowly to full hang while maintaining wrist flexion.
Safety cue: Start each rep by retracting and depressing the shoulder blades before pulling

Health benefit: Enhances core strength and grip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from the bar with an overhand grip and engage your shoulders.
2. Raise your legs by flexing hips and abs until your toes reach the bar.
3. Lower your legs under control back to the hang while keeping your grip.
Safety cue: Engage the core and control the swing to lift toes in a smooth arc

Health benefit: Develops exceptional core control and eccentric lowering strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and grip the anchor behind your head with both hands.
2. Brace your core and lift your legs and torso as one rigid unit toward vertical.
3. Lower slowly back toward the bench while keeping your shoulders anchored.
Safety cue: Hold a hollow rigid body and lower with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves full body mobility and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one arm extended and palm flat on the floor.
2. Press through the palm to lock the elbow and roll onto your opposite elbow and hand.
3. Drive through the planted foot to rise to a kneel and then stand.
4. Reverse the steps and lower back to the floor while keeping the palm engaged.
Safety cue: Keep the supporting arm vertical with eyes on the hand and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Enhances lower body power and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with hands on the floor under your shoulders and fingers spread.
2. Explode upward by pushing through your hands and driving your legs to land on your feet.
3. Return to your knees under control while keeping your fingers active on contact.
Safety cue: Land softly with bent knees and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Builds shoulder protraction strength and integrated core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on the floor and straighten your arms.
2. Lean your shoulders forward over your hands while keeping your body straight and toes on the ground.
3. Hold the forward-leaning position with a tight core and pressed scapulae.
Safety cue: Protract the shoulders and keep hips aligned over the hands

Health benefit: Develops balance and shoulder load tolerance
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor facing a wall or open space.
2. Kick one leg up explosively and follow with the other to reach vertical.
3. Stack shoulders over hands to catch balance and hold or gently bail out.
Safety cue: Control the kick-up and stack shoulders directly over wrists before holding

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral core strength and dynamic shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with one hand under the shoulder and the other behind your back.
2. Jump both feet out wide and then back together while keeping hips level.
3. Maintain a tight core and controlled breathing throughout the set.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep hips square to prevent rotation

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and reactive agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and swing your arms for momentum.
2. Propel laterally off the ground and land on the opposite leg while reaching to touch the ground.
3. Absorb the landing with a bent knee and immediately bound back the other way.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and controlled posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then drop to your knees and place hands on the floor.
2. Roll back onto your shoulders while keeping hands pressed to the floor.
3. Drive hips forward and press through your hands to bring your chest over your knees.
4. Use your hands to push and return to a standing position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and press evenly through the palms to control the rise

Health benefit: Enhances full body coordination and explosive rotational power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and arms by your sides.
2. Swing arms forcefully backward then forward to build momentum.
3. Jump off both feet while rotating your torso 360 degrees.
4. Spot the landing and absorb impact with bent knees.
Safety cue: Control arm swing and keep chest upright throughout the rotation

Health benefit: Improves lower body power and safe landing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing arms and hinge at the hips to load explosively.
3. Jump onto the box, landing with both feet flat.
4. Sink into a soft squat and hold for control before stepping down.
Safety cue: Land quietly with knees soft and hips hinged to absorb impact

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and forearm grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width and hang with legs extended.
2. Engage your core and raise legs to one side while keeping a tight grip.
3. Sweep legs smoothly to the opposite side in a controlled arc.
4. Lower legs back to center and repeat without relaxing the grip.
Safety cue: Maintain a firm grip and keep shoulders packed while controlling the legs

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and controlled hanging strength
Steps to perform:
1. Grip rings or a bar and hang with arms straight.
2. Tuck knees and pull hips up while rotating shoulders to bring knees through hands.
3. Extend hips and lower legs behind you until shoulders open.
4. Reverse the motion by pulling hips through and returning to the hang.
Safety cue: Keep a tight grip and move slowly with shoulders engaged through the rotation

Health benefit: Challenges lateral core strength and whole body balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on one forearm with feet stacked.
2. Press through your forearm and lift the top leg and arm toward the ceiling.
3. Open your chest and hold the body in a straight line like a star.
4. Maintain balance and steady breathing before switching sides.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over the wrist, lift hips, and brace the core for balance

Health benefit: Develops rotational power and reactive ankle control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and bend knees into a quarter squat.
2. Explode upward and pivot your feet midair to rotate 90 degrees.
3. Land softly with knees bent and absorb the impact.
Safety cue: Initiate the pivot from the hips and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances upper body mobility and dynamic pushing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Drop your chest and sweep forward low into an upward-dog position.
3. Reverse the sweep back to pike rapidly and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the descent and maintain a long spine with steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves plyometric power and impact absorption ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a sturdy box and step off to drop onto the ground.
2. Land with both feet flat and knees bent slightly.
3. Immediately absorb force by bending hips, knees, and ankles.
4. Explode upward into a vertical jump while keeping a braced core.
Safety cue: Brace your core and absorb impact through hips and soft knees on landing

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder girdle stability and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a handstand against a wall with arms straight.
2. Keep elbows locked and lift your shoulders toward your ears to shrug.
3. Lower shoulders back down without bending the elbows and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep arms straight and press shoulders up while holding a tight core

Health benefit: Builds intense core tension and advanced upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit between parallel bars and press down to lift into an L-sit with legs extended.
2. Lean forward and begin to tuck your knees toward your chest while keeping arms straight.
3. Shift weight forward until your hips lift and feet clear the bars into a tuck planche.
4. Hold briefly, then reverse the motion to return to the L-sit.
Safety cue: Engage shoulders and core and control the transition from L-sit to tuck planche

Health benefit: Increases upper abdominal strength and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place hands lightly behind your head and curl your shoulders toward your hips.
3. Lower with control back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and lower back pressed into the floor

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs lifted to tabletop.
2. Twist your torso to bring your right elbow toward your left knee while extending the right leg.
3. Switch sides by bringing your left elbow toward your right knee and extending the left leg.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled, cycling motion.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and move the torso with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and promotes forward hip hinge awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and slump forward from the hips.
2. Round your spine and reach your hands toward your feet.
3. Hold the folded position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and lengthen your spine rather than rounding the back

Health benefit: Encourages spinal flexion mobility and hamstring lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and keep knees soft.
2. Hinge forward from the hips and round your spine as you reach toward your toes.
3. Rise slowly to standing while keeping the spine rounded.
Safety cue: Slightly bend the knees and hinge from the hips to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and chest endurance and reinforces pushing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands shoulder-width on the wall at chest height.
2. Step back so your head protrudes forward past your hands and your body is angled.
3. Bend elbows to bring your chest toward the wall, then push back to start.
Safety cue: Keep your neck aligned with the spine and draw the head back slightly

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and promotes awareness of scapular elevation patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms at your sides.
2. Shrug both shoulders upward toward your ears, then roll them forward.
3. Repeat the shrug and forward roll in a smooth, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Lift the shoulders straight up and lower them with control instead of rolling forward

Health benefit: Develops core stability and encourages scapular control when performed correctly
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Allow your shoulders to sag slightly forward while keeping hips level.
3. Hold briefly, then reset to a neutral plank.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over wrists and pull the ribcage up to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal engagement and hip flexor control during leg elevation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and tuck your chin toward your chest.
2. Keep legs straight and lift them upward until perpendicular to the floor.
3. Lower the legs slowly toward the floor while maintaining the chin tuck.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves cervical mobility and raises awareness of neck alignment during device use
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and place both hands behind your head.
2. Tuck your chin toward your chest and gently guide your head downward.
3. Hold the stretch while keeping your upper back rounded.
Safety cue: Sit tall, retract the chin slightly, and breathe to lengthen the back of the neck

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and promotes coordination between flexion and extension movements
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Exhale and round your spine upward, tucking your chin and pelvis.
3. Inhale and gently arch your back to lift your chest and tailbone.
4. Continue moving between the rounded and arched positions with emphasis on the rounded phase.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes spinal and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the mat with your toes together and knees apart.
2. Sit back toward your heels and reach your arms forward on the floor.
3. Lower your chest toward your thighs and rest your forehead on the mat.
4. Relax your shoulders and breathe while holding the position.
Safety cue: Draw shoulder blades down and back to open the chest and unload the shoulders

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and press the soles of your feet together with knees dropped to the sides.
2. Hold your feet with your hands and gently press your knees toward the floor.
3. Lean forward from the hips while keeping the spine long and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor activation and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward hip height while driving the opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the foot and immediately lift the other knee in a marching rhythm.
4. Maintain a steady pace and pump your arms as you alternate knees.
Safety cue: Keep gaze forward with chin slightly tucked and drive knees up with a braced core

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Reach one arm overhead and bend your torso to the opposite side.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Stand tall, lengthen through the side body and hinge from the waist without rounding

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain including lower back glutes and hamstrings
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms stretched overhead and legs extended.
2. Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep your neck extended and gaze forward as you hold the position.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral by looking at the floor a few inches ahead to avoid overextension

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump your feet wide while swinging both arms forward to shoulder height.
3. Jump feet back together while returning your arms to your sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Move arms in a controlled arc and keep shoulders down away from the ears

Health benefit: Improves core stability and contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg straight back until aligned with the torso.
3. Keep your head looking down and your spine neutral as you hold the position.
4. Return to hands and knees and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a controlled lunge.
2. Lower your back knee toward the floor while keeping weight in the front heel.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest, step back with control and press through the front heel

Health benefit: Enhances lower body endurance and functional stair mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stair with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step onto the stair with one foot and drive through that heel to lift your body up.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to the same stair and stand tall.
4. Step back down one foot at a time and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds deep core stability and improves limb to core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift your head and shoulders off the floor while raising both knees bent over hips.
2. Extend one arm overhead and lower the opposite leg toward the floor with control.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side while keeping your head lifted.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and slump your shoulders forward.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back to grab your ankle with your right hand.
3. Pull your ankle toward your glute, hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core braced to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Opens chest and improves shoulder joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on the frame with palms facing down.
2. Step forward slightly until you feel a stretch across your chest with internal shoulder rotation.
3. Hold the position, then step back and relax.
Safety cue: Retract and depress the shoulder blades to open the chest and externally rotate the shoulders

Health benefit: Increases lower body strength and elevates cardiovascular demand
Steps to perform:
1. Set an incline on a treadmill or find a gentle hill.
2. Lean forward from your ankles so your torso creates an angled line.
3. Walk briskly up the incline while maintaining the forward lean.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotational spinal range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms extended to the sides in a T.
2. Tuck your chin forward and drop both knees to one side while keeping shoulders on the floor.
3. Pause, return to center, then repeat to the other side.
4. Keep movements controlled and repeat for desired reps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages core muscles and improves abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and chin tucked toward your chest.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the ground and begin alternating scissor-like overlaps.
3. Maintain the neck flexion and steady core throughout the set.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and hip mobility through full squat range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and drop your shoulders forward and down.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a deep squat.
3. Keep chest neutral and knees tracking over toes.
4. Drive through your heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders back and down and keep chest up while sitting back into the heels

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thighs and improves hip external rotation mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance, toes turned out, and hands resting on your hips while slumping slightly.
2. Bend your knees and lower into a plié until your thighs reach parallel or lower.
3. Press your knees outward and push through your heels to rise back up.
Safety cue: Lift the chest and lengthen the spine while bracing the core through the movement

Health benefit: Stretches posterior chain and promotes shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and feet and lift your hips into a downward dog position.
2. Press your palms into the mat and push hips up and back while allowing your head to protrude forward.
3. Reach your heels toward the floor and hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances oblique strength and trunk rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and your torso hunched forward.
2. Lean back slightly and rotate your torso to touch the floor beside your hip or hold a weight.
3. Rotate to the opposite side and repeat while keeping feet down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets hip abductors and improves lateral stability and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and tilt your torso slightly toward the supporting leg.
2. Lift the opposite leg out to the side to hip level with a controlled motion.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms extended straight at shoulder height.
2. Rotate both arms forward in small controlled circles.
3. Keep shoulders down and pulled slightly back throughout.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders down and back and keep chest open during arm circles

Health benefit: Develops core strength and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hips low and eyes looking slightly forward.
2. Move opposite hand and foot forward a few inches while maintaining a flat back.
3. Take small, controlled steps keeping the core engaged.
4. Keep the neck neutral and gaze ahead to avoid sagging.
Safety cue: Keep a long neutral neck by looking slightly ahead to prevent head sag

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees slightly bent in an athletic stance.
2. Push hips back and chest up to prevent a hunched posture.
3. Shuffle quickly three to five steps to one side with low, controlled movements.
4. Change direction and repeat while keeping the spine long.
Safety cue: Stay tall with a proud chest and neutral spine to avoid hunching during shuffles

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and thoracic rotation mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at sides.
2. Reach the right hand across your body toward the left foot while hinging at the hips.
3. Return upright and repeat on the other side with a straight spine.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and improves spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor while extending legs and arms slightly off the ground.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches and draw the belly toward the spine.
3. Hold the position with steady breathing and a flat lower back on the floor.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor, draw the ribs down, and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Enhances pushing strength while improving hip mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands shoulder-width and body in a straight line.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending elbows while bringing your right knee toward your right elbow.
3. Push back up to plank and return the leg to neutral.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite side with controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds shoulder pressing strength and overhead stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a pike position with hips raised and head aligned between arms.
2. Bend the elbows and lower the crown of your head toward the floor with control.
3. Push through your shoulders to extend the arms and lift back to the pike position.
4. Keep the neck neutral and avoid jutting the chin forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular conditioning and core stability during dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Drive one knee toward the chest, then alternate legs in a quick, controlled rhythm.
3. Keep the core braced and head in line with the spine to prevent sagging.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze down and maintain a strong plank line to prevent head sag

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and adds dynamic cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and spine long.
2. Jump both feet out wide and then back together with soft, controlled landings.
3. Maintain a braced core and lifted chest to avoid hunching.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over wrists, brace the core, and move feet smoothly to avoid hunching

Health benefit: Improves full body conditioning and functional movement efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then squat down and place hands on the floor in front of your feet.
2. Step back one foot at a time into a plank while keeping the chest low.
3. Step the feet back toward the hands and stand up or perform a small jump.
4. Tuck the chest slightly and brace the core during the transition.
Safety cue: Keep your chest lifted, brace the core, and move through the burpee with controlled landings

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat on your right foot with your left foot behind and look down.
2. Push off the right foot laterally and swing the left leg behind while landing on the left foot.
3. Lower your chest slightly and swing your arms for balance.
4. Drive off the landing and jump to the opposite side with a controlled landing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and gaze forward to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Increases lower body power and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width and hands clasped behind your head.
2. Lower into a squat by bending at the hips and knees.
3. Explode upward into a jump while keeping your hands behind your head.
4. Land softly into a squat and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace your core and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal control and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hands gently supporting the back of your head.
2. Curl your hips up toward your chest by contracting your lower abs.
3. Lower your hips back down with control while keeping the neck supported.
Safety cue: Keep your neck long and chin slightly tucked while lifting with your abs

Health benefit: Develops hip flexor and lower abdominal engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with arms straight and let your shoulders slump slightly.
2. Swing your knees up toward your chest using a controlled momentum.
3. Lower your legs back down while allowing your torso to slump again.
4. Repeat the raise with steady, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Control the movement from your core and avoid swinging your legs

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core endurance and shoulder stabilizer activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself up on your forearm with feet stacked.
2. Lift your hips into a side plank and push your top shoulder slightly forward.
3. Hold a straight line from head to heels while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders and push the top shoulder forward to prevent torso rotation

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a couple feet in front of a bench and place the top of one foot on the bench behind you while hunched forward.
2. Lower your back knee toward the ground by bending your front knee.
3. Push through the front heel to return to start while keeping the hunched torso.
4. Repeat for reps then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and maintain a neutral spine throughout the descent

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and dynamic hamstring flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips, then place your hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward into a plank while allowing your head to shift forward.
3. Pause in the plank, then walk your hands back toward your feet.
4. Hinge at the hips and rise up to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep a long neck and eyes on the floor to preserve spinal alignment

Health benefit: Targets glute activation and hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drive one heel upward toward the ceiling while keeping your spine neutral and avoiding sudden neck motion.
3. Lower the knee back under control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral neck and stabilize your core while driving the leg back

Health benefit: Improves explosive coordination and full body power
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with your chest down and hands on the floor.
2. Jump both feet back into a plank, then immediately jump them forward toward your hands.
3. Land softly back into the low squat while keeping the chest down.
Safety cue: Keep your chest lifted on each landing to avoid collapsing forward

Health benefit: Enhances functional leg strength and stair climbing capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box with feet hip-width and gaze down at the box.
2. Step one foot onto the box and press through the heel to lift your body up.
3. Step the trailing foot onto the box to stand tall.
4. Step down with control and repeat leading with the opposite foot.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and gaze forward while stepping through the heel

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and rotational core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width and torso slightly hunched.
2. Step forward into a deep lunge and lower until both knees are bent.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg while keeping the hunched position.
4. Push through the front heel to stand and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and pull shoulders back as you twist

Health benefit: Boosts anaerobic power and leg muscle recruitment
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a sprint stance with shoulders shrugged and neck pushed slightly forward.
2. Drive knees up and pump arms aggressively while sprinting at top speed.
3. Maintain explosive form for the interval.
4. Decelerate and walk to recover.
Safety cue: Relax shoulders down and keep neck long with eyes forward

Health benefit: Increases hamstring activation and running cadence
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing and look down at the ground.
2. Jog in place while kicking each heel up to touch the glute on each stride.
3. Keep a steady running rhythm while maintaining the downward gaze.
Safety cue: Keep head neutral and gaze forward to maintain upright posture

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor strength and cardiovascular activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with shoulders shrugged upward.
2. Run in place driving knees up to waist height on each rep.
3. Pump arms quickly while maintaining the shrugged shoulders.
Safety cue: Lower and relax shoulders while driving knees up with tall posture

Health benefit: Develops explosive upper body coordination and quick transition skills
Steps to perform:
1. Start lying prone with chest low and hands by the ribs.
2. Push through your hands to lift the upper body slightly off the ground.
3. Jump your feet under you into a low surfer crouch while keeping chest low.
4. Balance briefly then return to the prone start.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and drive through hips to rise into the pop-up

Health benefit: Combines lower body strength and aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet together and torso hunched forward.
2. Jump feet wide into a squat while keeping the hunched torso.
3. Jump feet back together and repeat the squat jack motion.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and open the chest as you jump in and out

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start seated with hands behind you, feet flat, and hips lifted low.
2. Shift weight and step one hand and opposite foot sideways to move.
3. Continue stepping in the same direction while keeping hips low and shoulders shrugged.
Safety cue: Lift hips to align the torso and relax shoulders away from ears

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and hamstring strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing on one leg with a slight bend in the supporting knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the free leg straight back.
3. Reach toward the standing foot with your hands while keeping a neutral spine.
4. Drive hips forward to return to standing on the same leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and anti rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank and allow your hips to sag slightly.
2. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while maintaining the sag.
3. Alternate hands and continue the shoulder taps while keeping the plank.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and brace the core to prevent the midline from dropping

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps endurance and joint control in lunging position
Steps to perform:
1. Start by stepping into a forward lunge with shoulders tipped forward.
2. Lower into the lunge and perform small pulses up and down in the bottom range.
3. Maintain the forward shoulder position while pulsing, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Retract shoulders and keep chest lifted while pulsing in the lunge

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and lower abdominal activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended.
2. Lift your legs a few inches off the ground and point your toes.
3. Flutter your legs in small, alternating kicks while keeping your core tight.
4. Tuck your chin slightly and keep your neck relaxed.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and neck long throughout the leg flutters

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and upper body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog with hands shoulder-width and hips high.
2. Scoop your chest forward and down in a smooth arc toward the floor.
3. Press through your palms to lift your chest up into an upward dog.
4. Return to the starting position in a controlled reverse arc.
Safety cue: Keep head neutral and gaze slightly forward during Hindu pushups

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and dynamic shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a pike position with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Drop your head and chest toward the floor while sweeping forward and down.
3. Press your chest up and forward into an upward-facing position.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to return to the starting pike position.
Safety cue: Move deliberately and lower with control through each dive bomber rep

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and improves midline stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands reaching forward beside your knees.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your legs to form a V with your torso.
3. Hold a tall chest and straight spine while maintaining balance.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace the core and draw shoulders down and back in V‑sits

Health benefit: Increases rotational core control and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms outstretched and legs raised toward the ceiling.
2. Lower both legs to one side in a controlled motion until you feel resistance.
3. Use your core to lift and move the legs to the opposite side with a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and keep shoulders grounded while sweeping side to side

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and improves elbow extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands together under your chest with thumbs and index fingers forming a diamond.
2. Set your feet hip-width and engage your core to form a straight line.
3. Lower your chest while keeping your elbows close to your sides.
4. Push back up to full arm extension while maintaining a neutral head position.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked close to the ribs and lower with steady control in diamond pushups

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and arms ready for balance.
2. Push off explosively to the opposite leg, landing softly on the ball of your foot.
3. Drive your chest upright and swing your arms for stability.
4. Repeat the lateral hop with controlled landings and stable posture.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back, chest up and knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Builds intense core strength and eccentric control through the torso
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench and hold the edge behind your head with both hands.
2. Brace your core and lift your hips and legs into a straight, elevated line.
3. Lower your body slowly in one controlled motion while keeping the spine aligned.
4. Stop just before your shoulders touch and press back up using your core.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long, shoulders pressed into the bench and initiate movement from the core

Health benefit: Improves abdominal strength and hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip and active shoulders.
2. Engage your core and keep your chest open while initiating the lift.
3. Raise your legs toward the bar with control until your toes touch or reach the bar.
4. Lower your legs back down with a controlled motion before repeating.
Safety cue: Engage lats, keep chest open and avoid rounding the upper back during toes‑to‑bar

Health benefit: Boosts full body conditioning and anaerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then lower into a squat and place your hands on the floor.
2. Kick or step your feet back into a plank with a stable core.
3. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet forward under your hips.
4. Explode upward into a jump while keeping your neck neutral and eyes forward.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and control each transition to prevent the head from snapping

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing arms back, dip into a quarter squat, and explode upward.
3. Pull knees toward your chest while keeping your torso tall.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and absorb through hips and knees.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and extend your spine in the air

Health benefit: Enhances plyometric strength and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Dip into a squat and swing your arms to explode up onto the box.
3. Land softly with knees bent and hips back.
4. Step down under control and reset your stance.
Safety cue: Land softly with chest up and hips back

Health benefit: Improves single leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the opposite leg extended forward.
2. Reach arms forward and hinge at the hips to begin lowering.
3. Lower slowly into a single-leg squat keeping the torso upright.
4. Press through the heel to return to standing.
Safety cue: Retract shoulders and keep chest lifted

Health benefit: Builds pulling and pressing strength while improving upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar or rings with a false grip and hang tall.
2. Explode into a high pull and drive your chest toward the bar.
3. Transition by leaning chest over and pressing through into a dip.
4. Lock out at the top and lower with control back to the hang.
Safety cue: Externally rotate and engage shoulders as you transition

Health benefit: Strengthens back and arm musculature improving pulling capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and hang with arms straight.
2. Retract shoulder blades and pull your chest toward the bar until your chin clears.
3. Lower slowly to full arm extension.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and chin slightly tucked

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and upper back strength with improved grip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar underhand at shoulder-width and hang with a tall torso.
2. Pull elbows toward your ribs and drive your chin above the bar.
3. Lower with control to a full hang.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders down and away from the ears

Health benefit: Develops core strength and shoulder endurance through controlled vertical movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet touching the wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer to the wall.
3. Reach the top position briefly, then walk hands back and lower feet to plank.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and stack ears over shoulders

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and proprioception under inverted load
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor and kick into a handstand.
2. Squeeze glutes and engage the core to align the spine.
3. Press through the shoulders and hold a stable handstand position.
Safety cue: Engage core and tuck ribs to reduce lower back arch

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and coordination during inverted locomotion
Steps to perform:
1. Kick or press into a handstand and find a balanced position.
2. Keep eyes between your hands and shoulders stacked over wrists.
3. Shift weight onto one hand and step the other hand forward, alternating steps.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral neck and lead movement with your eyes

Health benefit: Increases reactive power and improves landing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a sturdy box and step off with a controlled stance.
2. Land softly on the balls of your feet with knees bent and hips back.
3. Absorb the impact and immediately explode upward into a jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with chest up and absorb impact through hips and knees

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and horizontal propulsion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips with your chest down.
2. Swing arms back and bend knees into a quarter squat.
3. Explode forward into a broad jump and extend hips.
4. Land softly on both feet and bend knees to absorb.
Safety cue: Drive the chest up and keep a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances rotational lower body power and landing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and allow the upper body to slump slightly.
2. Lower into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees.
3. Explode upward while rotating 180 degrees using your arms.
4. Land softly into a squat facing the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Stay tall through the torso and brace the core during rotation

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other slightly lifted and push the head forward.
2. Drop hands to the floor and kick the free leg back into a single-leg plank.
3. Hop the free leg forward, drive through the standing leg, and jump up.
4. Land on the same leg with knees soft and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin slightly and maintain a long spine when coming up

Health benefit: Improves lateral explosiveness and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees soft and shoulders shifted forward.
2. Push off one foot laterally and swing the other leg behind you.
3. Drive your arms across your body to generate momentum.
4. Land on the opposite foot with a soft bend and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Pull the shoulders back and open the chest on each landing

Health benefit: Increases single leg power and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a split lunge with your torso slightly hunched forward.
2. Bend both knees to load the movement and keep weight centered.
3. Explode upward and switch leg positions in mid-air.
4. Land softly into the opposite split lunge and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and avoid rounding the shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens core and hip flexors while promoting shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit between supports or on the floor and place hands beside your hips.
2. Press down through the hands and shrug the shoulders upward.
3. Lift both legs straight to form an L shape and hold the position.
4. Maintain a tight core and breathe while holding.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down away from the ears and press through the hands

Health benefit: Enhances anterior core endurance and body tension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift shoulders and legs off the ground with chin tucked to chest.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Rock back and forth in a small controlled range while keeping the chin to chest.
4. Continue the rocking motion for the desired number of reps.
Safety cue: Lift the chin slightly to keep the neck neutral and ribs packed

Health benefit: Develops rapid lower limb power and explosive takeoff ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and drop into a slight squat.
2. Jump forward driving the knees toward your chest and extend before landing.
3. Bring your head quickly from the tucked position back to neutral as you land.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and absorb landings with soft bent knees

Health benefit: Boosts alternating leg power and coordination for multidirectional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a slumped upper body and feet hip-width.
2. Swing one leg forward and the other back while bending the knees.
3. Explode upward and switch leg positions in mid-air like scissors.
4. Land softly and resume the slumped posture for the next rep.
Safety cue: Hold the chest up and brace the core throughout each jump

Health benefit: Enhances lateral force production and reactive agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and adopt a hunched torso.
2. Bend knees and load laterally onto one leg while preparing to push off.
3. Bound explosively to the opposite side and land on the other foot.
4. Absorb the landing with bent knees and immediately bound back.
Safety cue: Land tall with hips back and chest lifted to avoid rounding

Health benefit: Enhances leg strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and slump your shoulders.
2. Bend knees and drop hips into a low squat.
3. Roll back along the spine to lie with knees bent.
4. Plant feet and drive through heels to roll upright into a slumped finish.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and roll through the thoracic spine with control

Health benefit: Improves lower body muscular endurance and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and round your shoulders forward.
2. Sink hips back and down while keeping heels on the floor.
3. Swing arms forward and rise onto the balls of your feet.
4. Lower back into the rounded squat and repeat continuously.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and back to maintain an open chest

Health benefit: Develops explosive power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand, use a countermovement, and explode into the first jump.
2. Land in a slightly hunched position with knees bent.
3. Rebound immediately into two more jumps and absorb each landing.
Safety cue: Brace your core and land upright with soft hips to avoid hunching

Health benefit: Builds lateral agility and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside the box and fix your gaze downward.
2. Step or jump laterally onto the box and place both feet quickly.
3. Step or jump down on the opposite side while keeping eyes down.
4. Reset and repeat moving laterally each rep.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze level and lead with the chest to maintain balance

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank with hips slightly hunched and elbow under shoulder.
2. Dip hips and then explosively lift them off the ground.
3. Drive the top leg upward into a small hop.
4. Land back in the hunched side plank and repeat.
Safety cue: Stack hips and keep a straight line from head to heels while bracing the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances single leg mobility and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance and push your shoulders forward.
2. Lower into a deep single-leg squat while sliding the rear leg under.
3. Touch the floor with the rear foot and drive through the front heel to stand.
Safety cue: Draw shoulders back and lift the chest to maintain an upright torso as you lower

Health benefit: Improves overhead balance and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall, place hands on the floor, and shift your head position slightly.
2. Kick one leg up forcefully while the other follows to reach vertical.
3. Adjust head position to balance and control the descent back down.
Safety cue: Keep eyes between the hands and align the head with the spine during the kick-up

Health benefit: Develops rotational power and spatial awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a slight slump in the torso and prepare to explode.
2. Jump up and rotate 360 degrees in the air while maintaining the slump.
3. Land softly with knees bent and stabilize the slumped posture.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and drive rotation from the hips

Health benefit: Increases unilateral leg strength and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand wide and internally rotate one foot and hip inward.
2. Shift weight to the opposite leg and bend that knee deeply.
3. Keep the other leg straight and extend the arms for balance.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to center and switch sides.
Safety cue: Track the knee over the toes and rotate the thigh outward to prevent internal collapse

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and knee flexion mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and lean your head forward.
2. Rise onto the toes and push the knees forward while keeping torso upright.
3. Lower the knees toward the floor and then press through toes to stand.
Safety cue: Keep the neck neutral and chin slightly tucked to align the head with the spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart.
2. Raise both arms straight overhead with palms facing each other.
3. Reach fingertips upward and lengthen through the torso.
4. Lower arms slowly to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine as you lift arms overhead

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and upper back activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hinge forward slightly.
2. Lift arms up and out to form a Y with thumbs pointing up.
3. Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep your neck neutral.
4. Lower arms with control back to the start.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly at the hips and retract shoulder blades as you raise to a Y

Health benefit: Increases thoracic extension and shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Place forearms and hands on the wall at shoulder height.
3. Slide your hands upward toward the top of the wall while keeping contact.
4. Slide hands back down to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Press forearms into the wall and slide shoulders up without shrugging

Health benefit: Improves shoulder flexion endurance and postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Raise both arms straight overhead with palms facing inward.
3. Lower arms slowly back to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Keep arms close to the ears and maintain a neutral neck alignment

Health benefit: Enhances upper body coordination and explosive shoulder power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and raise hands overhead with palms facing each other.
2. Clap hands together overhead with a quick controlled motion.
3. Return hands to the overhead start position and prepare for the next clap.
Safety cue: Clap overhead with controlled motion and avoid rapid shoulder jerks

Health benefit: Stretches posterior chain while promoting shoulder and spine mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips up and back to form an inverted V shape.
3. Press heels toward the floor and lengthen the spine.
4. Hold the shape while keeping arms straight and head relaxed.
Safety cue: Push hips back and up to lengthen the spine while keeping soft knees

Health benefit: Encourages spinal lengthening and gentle shoulder extension
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the mat and sit back on your heels.
2. Reach both arms forward and place palms on the mat.
3. Press your chest toward your thighs while actively reaching fingertips forward.
4. Hold the reach and keep your forehead toward the mat.
Safety cue: Reach forward with long arms while keeping hips back and ribs toward thighs

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and engages oblique muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and raise both arms overhead.
2. Lean to one side from the waist while keeping your hips squared.
3. Return to center and repeat the lean on the other side.
Safety cue: Stack the hips and brace the core to avoid collapsing the lower back

Health benefit: Builds core stability while challenging shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands on the floor shoulder-width apart and step feet back into a straight line.
2. Position hands slightly forward of the shoulders and engage your core.
3. Keep your body in one straight line from head to heels.
4. Hold the plank while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Drive shoulders over wrists and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Enhances contralateral coordination and lumbar spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm forward at ear level while extending the opposite leg straight back.
3. Keep your hips level and reach through fingertips and toes.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Extend the arm to ear level while bracing the core and preventing torso rotation

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and raise one arm straight overhead.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide the opposite hand down toward the foot while keeping the raised arm reaching up.
3. Reverse the hinge to stand tall and lower the raised arm.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips, brace the core, and keep the spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances spinal flexibility and movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop the belly while lifting the chest and tailbone into full extension.
3. Exhale and round the spine, tucking the chin and tailbone.
4. Flow between the two positions with controlled breaths.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with controlled spinal flexion and extension

Health benefit: Opens the chest and stretches the front shoulder muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one hand high on the door frame.
2. Step the opposite foot forward and lean the chest through the doorway.
3. Rotate the torso slightly away from the hand to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep the ribs down and avoid overarching the lower back while reaching high

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides and legs straight.
2. Lift the chest, arms, and legs off the floor simultaneously.
3. Hold briefly at the top then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Engage the core and lift through the glutes without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Boosts aerobic fitness and rhythmic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet out wide while raising both arms overhead and touch your hands.
3. Jump feet back together while lowering the arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain a tall chest

Health benefit: Builds single leg stability and hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms raised straight overhead.
2. Step one foot back and lower into a reverse lunge until the front knee is over the ankle.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing while keeping arms up.
4. Repeat the lunge on the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Step back with control, keep the front knee tracking over the ankle, and stay upright

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and pump your arms as if marching.
2. Lift one knee high toward your chest while driving the opposite arm forward.
3. Alternate knees and arms in a controlled high-march pattern.
Safety cue: Drive the knee up with a tall posture and brace the core for stability

Health benefit: Improves lower body power and functional endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at the base of the stairs and place one hand lightly on the rail.
2. Step up with your leading foot and reach the opposite hand up toward the rail.
3. Push through the leading foot to bring the trailing foot up while continuing to reach.
4. Continue ascending at a steady pace and descend carefully when finished.
Safety cue: Use the rail only for balance, keep chest lifted, and push through the entire foot

Health benefit: Promotes upright posture and thoracic opening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and interlace your hands behind your back.
2. Squeeze the shoulder blades together and lift the chest upward.
3. Hold briefly with open arms then release back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Retract the shoulder blades, keep ribs down, and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Relieves trapezius tension and enhances shoulder elevation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Elevate both shoulders straight up toward your ears as high as possible.
3. Lower the shoulders fully and repeat the shrugging motion.
Safety cue: Lift shoulders deliberately and lower them slowly under control while keeping the neck long

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and standing leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg and bend the opposite knee.
2. Reach back and grasp the ankle of the bent leg.
3. Reach the free arm overhead and press the hips slightly forward.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you reach back

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and feet flexed.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach hands toward the toes.
3. Keep a long spine and hold the forward position.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked.
2. Extend the top arm straight up toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate the top arm across your body while opening the chest.
4. Return the arm to the ceiling and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep both sit bones grounded and rotate from the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder mobility while adding light aerobic movement to walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin walking forward with controlled steps.
2. Make large circular motions with both arms high overhead.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several steps.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and control arm circles without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and open chest posture improving upper body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with hands under shoulders and legs extended.
2. Press through the hands to lift the chest while straightening the arms.
3. Keep the shoulders down and hold the lifted position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down away from the ears and lift through the upper back with control

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular control and improves upper body stability for pressing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with arms straight and hands under shoulders.
2. Keep arms straight and pinch the shoulder blades together to lower the chest slightly.
3. Push through the hands to protract the shoulder blades and separate them.
4. Repeat with slow, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and move only through the shoulder blades

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances unilateral balance and power development
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a high box or step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step up onto the box with one foot and drive through the heel.
3. Reach the opposite arm up overhead as you stand tall on the box.
4. Step down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Drive through the stepping heel and keep the chest lifted as you reach up

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and scapular coordination through integrated movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and a slight hinge at the hips.
2. Raise both arms straight overhead to form an "I."
3. Sweep the arms out to the sides at shoulder level to form a "T."
4. Angle the arms forward and up to form a "Y," then return to start.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move the arms slowly with control from the shoulder blades

Health benefit: Increases shoulder joint mobility and gently warms surrounding musculature for activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with arms extended at shoulder height to the sides.
2. Rotate the arms in small, controlled circles forward.
3. Reverse the rotation and circle the arms backward.
Safety cue: Anchor the ribs and perform slow controlled circles without shrugging

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder flexion range and strengthens serratus and deltoid activation during reaching
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm’s length with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place fingertips on the wall at a comfortable height.
3. Walk the hands up the wall as high as comfortable while keeping the body tall.
4. Walk the hands back down to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and lead with the fingertips while keeping the shoulders down

Health benefit: Improves hip and inner thigh strength while promoting upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hips and toes turned out, and raise arms overhead.
2. Initiate the squat by bending knees and pushing hips back.
3. Lower until thighs are parallel to the floor or as low as comfortable.
4. Push through heels to return to standing while keeping arms overhead.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and core coordination through contralateral movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift knees a few inches off the floor.
2. Reach right hand forward while stepping left foot forward.
3. Alternate sides with each step and reach the opposite hand forward.
4. Keep hips low and core tight as you move steadily forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip and ankle mobility while engaging core and lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and place hands on the back of your head.
2. Sink hips back and down into a deep squat while keeping your chest upright.
3. Drive through heels to return to standing while keeping hands on your head.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility with oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees slightly bent and top arm extended toward the ceiling.
2. Rotate your torso and sweep the top arm down and across your body toward the floor behind you.
3. Lift your chest to follow the movement and open the top shoulder.
4. Return the arm to the starting overhead position with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Stack hips, keep the shoulder open and move the arm slowly without collapsing the ribcage

Health benefit: Builds shoulder pressing strength and enhances upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a pike position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Bend elbows to lower the crown of your head toward the ground.
3. Push through your hands to extend the elbows and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops full upper body mobility and dynamic strength with spinal flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hips high and hands wider than shoulders.
2. Lower your chest in a scooping motion toward the floor while bending elbows.
3. Move your chest forward and upward into an upward-facing position by arching your back.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the starting downward dog position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Combines pushing and flowing spinal movement to improve shoulder mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start with hips high in a pike position and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Sweep your chest down and forward between your hands while lowering your head toward the floor.
3. Continue the motion to slide your chest forward and lift into an upward-facing position.
4. Reverse the sweep to return to the starting pike position.
Safety cue: Move in a controlled arc, keep shoulders active and avoid letting the low back sag

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and core activation while enhancing shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk your hands forward until your body is fully extended in a straight plank.
3. Hold the full plank briefly with core engaged and shoulders stacked over hands.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet and stand up by hinging at the hips.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Integrates rotational core strength with unilateral hip mobility and upper body power
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor while bringing your right knee toward your right elbow.
3. Push back up while returning your right leg to the starting position.
4. Repeat the next rep bringing the left knee toward the left elbow.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves full body conditioning and elevates cardiovascular fitness and power
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing then drop into a squat and place your hands on the floor.
2. Jump your feet back into a plank and perform a pushup.
3. Jump feet back toward your hands, stand up, and explode into an overhead jump with arms extended.
4. Land softly with knees slightly bent and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and place your bottom forearm under your shoulder.
2. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Reach your top arm straight up toward the ceiling.
4. Hold the position and keep your core engaged.
Safety cue: Stack your shoulders over the supporting elbow and keep your body in a straight line

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a side plank on your bottom forearm or hand.
2. Lift your top leg and top arm away from your center to form a star shape.
3. Keep your hips high and body aligned in one plane.
4. Hold briefly, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Control the lifted leg to keep hips level and avoid dropping the pelvis

Health benefit: Builds anterior core endurance and promotes a neutral spine
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended behind your head and legs straight.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and lift your shoulders and legs slightly.
3. Keep your arms reaching back and maintain a hollow shape.
4. Hold the position while keeping the core engaged.
Safety cue: Flatten your lower back into the floor by drawing your belly button toward your spine

Health benefit: Develops abdominal strength and hip flexor coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and arms reaching overhead.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your legs to form a V with your torso.
3. Reach your hands toward your feet while keeping your spine long.
4. Hold briefly, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall, braced spine as you hinge from the hips into the V position

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominals and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp a bar with an overhand grip and hang with arms fully extended.
2. Brace your core and pull your knees up toward your chest.
3. Control the top position without swinging.
4. Lower your legs slowly back to the hang.
Safety cue: Initiate each rep from the core and lift the knees with controlled motion without swinging

Health benefit: Improves grip endurance and promotes shoulder joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp the bar with hands shoulder-width apart and an overhand grip.
2. Hang with your arms fully extended and shoulders slightly engaged.
3. Maintain a steady breath while holding the hang.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases core stability while boosting cardiovascular effort
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under your shoulders and arms slightly forward.
2. Jump your feet out wide like a jumping jack while keeping hips level.
3. Jump your feet back together and stabilize your core.
4. Repeat the movement at a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Keep a tight core and perform small controlled jumps with the legs

Health benefit: Enhances core coordination and accelerates aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest while reaching forward with the opposite hand.
3. Return that leg and reach with the other hand to the opposite knee.
4. Continue alternating at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips low, maintain a neutral spine and reach with controlled movement

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder and hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and place hands behind your hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the elevated position.
Safety cue: Lift through the hips, squeeze the glutes and keep the neck long and neutral

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and dynamic balance during side-to-side movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and arms at your sides.
2. Push off laterally and swing your arms high as you land on the opposite foot.
3. Land softly with a bent knee and drive the trailing leg behind you.
4. Immediately push off and repeat the bound to the other side.
Safety cue: Control the lateral swing by driving through the stance leg and keeping the torso steady

Health benefit: Develops lower body power and explosive jumping ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with knees soft.
2. Lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel.
3. Explode up into a jump while reaching for the sky with both arms.
4. Land softly into a squat and repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest tall

Health benefit: Combines squat strength with dynamic cardio for improved aerobic capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet together with arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet out into a wide squat while raising arms overhead.
3. Jump feet back together while lowering arms to your sides.
4. Continue the jumping pattern with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep weight in heels and chest up as you jump and clap overhead

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and rotational core mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward into a lunge with your right foot.
2. Lower until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Twist your torso toward the front leg and extend your arms out to the sides.
4. Step forward with the other foot and repeat alternating sides.
Safety cue: Brace the core and twist from the torso keeping front knee aligned over the ankle

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from a bench and place the top of your back foot on the bench.
2. Step the front foot forward and lower into a lunge until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Reach both arms overhead as you lower for added range.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the start and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor

Health benefit: Activates and strengthens glute muscles for hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Bend one knee and kick that heel up toward the ceiling while pressing hands forward.
3. Lower the knee back to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and extend the leg slowly without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves agility and dynamic lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet together.
2. Jump feet forward outside your hands into a low squat while reaching hands toward your toes.
3. Explode back into the plank position with a controlled jump.
4. Land softly and prepare immediately for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly into a stable squat position with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Develops full body coordination and rapid transition skills
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your stomach with hands by your shoulders.
2. Push through your hands to pop your chest up and bring a front foot under into a low lunge.
3. Stand or shift into a surfer stance while raising both arms high.
4. Reverse the movement to return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Pop up quickly but control the landing and keep a neutral spine

Health benefit: Targets hamstrings and posterior chain to enhance single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the opposite hand forward to form a Y while the back leg extends straight.
3. Keep your spine neutral and hips square as you lower toward the floor.
4. Drive the hip forward to return to standing and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hip with a tight core and reach without collapsing the standing knee

Health benefit: Builds core stability and challenges shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a plank position with body in a straight line.
2. Extend one arm forward to shoulder height while keeping hips stable and core tight.
3. Return the arm and extend the other arm forward, maintaining a steady plank.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and a braced core as you extend each arm slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and improves trunk rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands extended overhead and legs lifted in tabletop.
2. Crunch up and twist to bring the opposite elbow toward the opposite knee while reaching the other arm long.
3. Switch sides by extending the opposite leg and reaching the opposite arm toward the bent knee.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled, cycling motion.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and rotate from the torso with slow controlled reaches

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and shoulders while improving core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Press into hands and feet and lift hips high into a reverse tabletop.
3. Step one hand and opposite foot forward to move, then follow with the other side.
4. Keep hips elevated and core tight while continuing to crab-walk.
Safety cue: Drive hips high and brace your core to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and core endurance while enhancing full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in Downward Dog with hips high and hands shoulder-width.
2. Shift weight forward and lower hips until shoulders stack over wrists into a straight plank.
3. Keep core engaged and hold plank for a breath.
4. Push hips back and lift tailbone to return to Downward Dog.
Safety cue: Flow slowly keeping a long spine and engaged core during transitions

Health benefit: Develops wrist and arm strength while enhancing balance and body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Squat with feet close together and place palms shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Bend elbows slightly and press the inner knees onto the upper arms.
3. Lean forward and shift weight into the hands while bringing heels off the ground.
4. Squeeze knees to arms and hold balance with core engaged.
Safety cue: Shift weight forward with elbows stacked under shoulders and keep core engaged

Health benefit: Builds core and hip flexor strength and improves straight arm support
Steps to perform:
1. Sit between parallettes or hands on the floor and place palms down next to hips.
2. Push through the palms and fully extend the arms, locking the elbows at the top.
3. Engage core and lift legs straight in front to form an L shape.
4. Hold the position with shoulders packed and legs parallel to the floor.
Safety cue: Press shoulders down into the sockets and extend through the arms while keeping core tight

Health benefit: Enhances oblique strength and rotational control through dynamic core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms outstretched and legs raised toward the ceiling.
2. Engage the core and lower both legs to one side with control until close to the floor.
3. Use the obliques to pull the legs back through center and lower to the opposite side.
4. Keep shoulders glued to the floor and move in a slow, controlled arc.
Safety cue: Keep your low back on the floor and move legs slowly with a braced core

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and hip stability while challenging coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly and engage the core.
3. Alternate small, rapid up-and-down flutter kicks with straight legs while keeping arms overhead.
Safety cue: Press tailbone into the floor and draw ribs toward hips to protect the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and balance while boosting cardiovascular intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and swing one arm high across your body while loading onto the opposite leg.
