2. Push off the grounded leg and hop laterally to the other side.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot with the chest up and the high arm driving forward.
4. Absorb the landing with a slight knee bend and repeat the hop to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees bent and chest lifted to control momentum

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and enhances spatial awareness and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Face away from a wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor a short distance from the wall.
2. Kick one leg up and use the wall to support the heels as both legs come overhead.
3. Press through the shoulders and fully extend the arms while keeping the body tight.
4. Maintain contact with the wall and breathe while holding the inverted position.
Safety cue: Press through the shoulders, stack hips over shoulders, and maintain a tight core

Health benefit: Develops overhead pressing strength and increases upper body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Set up in a wall-supported handstand with hands shoulder-width and body straight.
2. Bend the elbows and lower the head toward the floor with control.
3. Pause briefly at the bottom while keeping the core tight.
4. Press through the palms and extend the arms to return to the top position.
Safety cue: Maintain a hollow body and press through the shoulders to avoid collapsing

Health benefit: Improves balance coordination and dynamic shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a free or wall-assisted handstand and fully extend the shoulders.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and lift the other hand slightly to initiate a step.
3. Place the lifted hand forward and transfer weight steadily onto it.
4. Continue alternating small hand steps while keeping the core engaged and gaze fixed.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps with hips stacked over shoulders and core braced

Health benefit: Develops combined upper body pulling and pushing strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the bar with a false grip and hang with straight arms.
2. Swing slightly and explode into a powerful pull to bring your chest toward the bar.
3. Roll your wrists over the bar and press down to transition above it.
4. Lock out at the top, then lower back under control to the hang.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and shoulders packed as you transition through the bar

Health benefit: Builds lat strength and improves scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar wider than shoulder width and hang with engaged shoulders.
2. Drive your elbows down and pull your chest toward the bar.
3. Lower slowly to a full hang and reset.
Safety cue: Engage lats and pull your chest toward the bar while lowering slowly

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and upper back strength while improving grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar underhand at shoulder width and dead hang with straight arms.
2. Pull by driving your elbows down until your chin clears the bar.
3. Lower to a full dead hang and pause before the next rep.
Safety cue: Begin each rep from a full dead hang with scapula slightly retracted

Health benefit: Strengthens the core and hip flexors while improving dynamic trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from the bar with shoulders engaged and legs together.
2. Initiate a controlled hollow swing and drive your hips up.
3. Lift your legs and touch the bar with your toes using your abs.
4. Lower your legs back to the hang with control.
Safety cue: Hollow your body and control the swing as you lift toes to the bar

Health benefit: Builds maximal core strength and whole body tension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench or mat and grip behind your head for support.
2. Brace your core and lift your legs and hips to form a straight rigid line.
3. Lower your body slowly while keeping the torso tight and straight.
4. Stop just before touching the bench and press back up to the start.
Safety cue: Brace your midline and lower in a slow controlled line keeping hips extended

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and core strength during vertical body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet near the wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands closer to the wall.
3. Continue until your body is vertical and aligned.
4. Reverse the movement by walking your hands out and feet down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances balance and shoulder strength through inverted body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from the wall and place hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Kick one leg up explosively while pushing off the other leg.
3. Find balance against the wall and hold briefly before coming down.
Safety cue: Kick up with control and stack shoulders over wrists before holding balance

Health benefit: Develops unilateral pushing strength and increases shoulder stability under load
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a wide push-up stance with one arm set slightly more extended.
2. Bend the elbow on the working side and lower your chest toward that hand.
3. Push back to the center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and shift weight smoothly toward the working arm without twisting

Health benefit: Combines cardiovascular conditioning with explosive power and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, squat down, and place your hands on the floor.
2. Kick your feet back into a plank and perform one push-up.
3. Jump your feet forward to your hands and explode upward into a jump.
4. Land softly, stand tall, and repeat.
Safety cue: Explode upward and land softly with knees slightly bent and a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lower body explosive power and improves vertical jump mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and raise your arms high overhead.
2. Jump up explosively and tuck your knees to your chest while keeping arms high.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Drive arms overhead and absorb landing through hips and knees while keeping chest up

Health benefit: Improves lower body power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet shoulder-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Bend hips and knees into a quick quarter squat while swinging arms back.
3. Explode upward, drive arms overhead, and jump onto the box.
4. Land softly with knees bent and step down controlled.
Safety cue: Absorb box landings with soft knees and a neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops horizontal power and hip explosiveness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips.
2. Swing arms back and load by bending the knees.
3. Explode forward and drive arms to jump for maximum distance.
4. Land with knees soft and chest up.
Safety cue: Drive hips forward and keep chest tall on takeoff and landing

Health benefit: Builds rotational power and rapid lower body force production
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and lower into a squat.
2. Explode upward and rotate 180 degrees in the air.
3. Spot the landing and absorb the impact into a squat.
Safety cue: Rotate under control and land with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral strength and cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and hinge forward to place hands on the floor.
2. Kick the free leg back into a plank and lower chest in a push-up.
3. Jump the foot forward to the hands while keeping the other leg lifted.
4. Explode up into a single-leg jump and switch legs on the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and descend with controlled tempo on the standing leg

Health benefit: Improves full body coordination and functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back holding one arm straight up and bend the same-side knee.
2. Push through the planted foot and roll onto the opposite elbow.
3. Press to your hand and lift the hips into a bridge.
4. Sweep the straight leg back, rise to standing, then reverse the steps to return down.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and keep the overhead arm stable through each phase

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower leg power and reactive jumping ability
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling with toes tucked and hands at your sides.
2. Explode upward by driving through the toes and pull the knees toward the chest.
3. Land on both feet softly with knees bent.
Safety cue: Brace the core and explode to your feet, landing softly with bent knees

Health benefit: Builds full body strength and improves controlled movement transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Drop to your knees and roll back onto your back in a controlled motion.
2. Sit up, press through the hands, and lift the hips.
3. Roll forward to kneeling and stand up explosively.
4. Finish by reaching both arms overhead and hold briefly.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and spine neutral as you rise to the overhead finish

Health benefit: Improves aerial awareness and rotational coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and lower into a shallow squat.
2. Explode upward and rotate a full 360 degrees in the air.
3. Spot the landing and land softly with knees bent.
Safety cue: Initiate rotation from the hips and land softly with knees aligned over toes

Health benefit: Increases shoulder and core isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor and extend your legs back.
2. Shift weight forward by leaning the shoulders past the wrists while keeping the body straight.
3. Hold the forward lean with a tight core and engaged scapula.
Safety cue: Hold a tight core and keep shoulders engaged to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and enhances spinal rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a bar with arms straight and legs together.
2. Raise the legs to 90 degrees while keeping the core tight.
3. Rotate the legs to one side in a controlled motion.
4. Swing the legs through center and rotate to the opposite side with control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders braced and perform windshield wipers with slow controlled rotation

Health benefit: Activates glutes and hamstrings, improves posterior chain strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Lift hips into a strong bridge and squeeze glutes at the top.
3. Walk feet slowly forward one step at a time until legs are near straight.
4. Walk feet back under hips and lower hips to the mat.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted and core braced as you walk feet out

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and coordination for agility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with knees slightly bent and arms relaxed.
2. Swing the opposite leg laterally and push hard off the ground with the stance leg.
3. Land softly on the opposite foot with a bent knee and absorb the impact.
4. Immediately rebound laterally back to the starting foot.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees tracking in line with toes

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength mobility and overhead shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms overhead.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee into a deep squat.
3. Extend the opposing leg straight out to the side while keeping arms overhead.
4. Drive through the bent leg to return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and weight evenly distributed through the midfoot

Health benefit: Improves single leg strength mobility and balance with core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with arms extended overhead and the other leg straight forward.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee to lower into a one-legged squat.
3. Keep the free leg extended and chest tall as you descend.
4. Push through the heel to rise back to standing with arms overhead.
Safety cue: Sit back and keep the planted heel down with a braced core

Health benefit: Increases shoulder and thoracic mobility and active core control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from rings or a bar with a false grip and legs together.
2. Tuck knees to chest and pull hips up as you begin to invert.
3. Rotate shoulders and pass your legs through to fully invert into the position.
4. Reverse the motion with control to return to the hanging start.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the shoulders and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops upper body power fast twitch muscle recruitment and explosive pressing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a high plank with hands shoulder-width and feet together.
2. Lower your chest toward the ground with elbows bent.
3. Explode upward and clap your hands quickly before returning them to the floor.
4. Land softly into the plank and reset before the next rep.
Safety cue: Absorb the landing by bending the elbows and keeping a tight core

Health benefit: Challenges core stability while improving shoulder endurance and unilateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank on one hand with feet together and hips level.
2. Jump both feet outward into a wide stance while keeping one hand on the ground.
3. Jump feet back together while maintaining a stable single-arm plank.
4. Continue the jack pattern while keeping hips square and torso tight.
Safety cue: Square the hips to the floor and brace the core to prevent rotation

Health benefit: Enhances rotary power ankle reactive strength and change of direction ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing your arms and bend knees to load for a jump.
3. Jump and rotate your body 90 degrees in midair, landing softly on bent knees.
4. Reorient feet and reset before the next pivot jump.
Safety cue: Pivot through the hips and land softly with knees aligned over the toes

Health benefit: Isolates quadriceps strength and improves knee extension control and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the balls of your feet with feet hip-width and arms reaching back.
2. Bend knees and lean your torso back while keeping hips forward.
3. Lower until thighs are near vertical while reaching arms further back.
4. Press through the toes to return to the upright start.
Safety cue: Keep the torso tall and control knee tracking directly over the toes

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular control and shoulder stability in inverted position
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor and kick up to a supported handstand or handstand at the wall.
2. Keep arms straight and actively push through the palms to lift the shoulder girdle.
3. Allow the shoulders to relax downward while maintaining arm extension.
4. Repeat the shrugging motion while keeping the body aligned and stable.
Safety cue: Push through the shoulders to create tension while maintaining a tight core and neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push hips back and lower until thighs drop below parallel.
3. Keep chest up and knees tracking over the toes.
4. Drive through the heels to return to standing and squeeze the glutes.
Safety cue: Brace your core and push hips back while keeping chest upright

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and dynamic lower body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Swing one arm down and reach toward the opposite toe quickly.
3. Return to center and immediately repeat on the other side.
4. Continue alternating at a fast, steady pace.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a slight bend in the knees and move with control

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while raising arms overhead.
3. Jump back to the start position and repeat continuously.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain a tall spine

Health benefit: Increases upper body pushing strength and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on the floor and extend legs behind you.
2. Keep the body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lower the chest toward the floor by bending the elbows.
4. Push back up to full arm extension.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and lower with control

Health benefit: Strengthens single leg stability and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a long step forward with one foot.
2. Lower the hips until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Keep the front knee over the ankle and the torso upright.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves front thigh flexibility and hip extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on one knee with the other foot flat in front at 90 degrees.
2. Reach back and grasp the ankle of the kneeling leg.
3. Pull the heel toward the glute while keeping the hips square.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and coordinates breathing with movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders.
2. Rapidly round the spine and tuck the chin for the cat position.
3. Quickly arch the spine and lift the head and tailbone for the cow position, and repeat.
Safety cue: Move smoothly through spinal flexion and extension and avoid forcing the range

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor activation and improves gait rhythm
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee up toward the chest.
2. Lower that knee and immediately lift the opposite knee.
3. Continue marching with strong arm drive and an upright posture.
Safety cue: Drive knees up with controlled breathing and keep the core engaged

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and core rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and extend the arms out to the sides.
2. Rotate the torso forcefully to one side while keeping the hips facing forward.
3. Rotate fully to the other side and continue alternating in large controlled twists.
Safety cue: Rotate from the ribcage with hips square and control the speed of the twist

Health benefit: Builds lower body endurance and functional cardiovascular capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at the base of the stairs facing upward.
2. Step up with one foot and bring the other foot to meet it on the same step.
3. Maintain a steady pace and use the handrail for balance if needed.
4. Continue climbing at an even, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Step through with a full foot, keep chest lifted and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves core stability and spinal control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Engage your core and lengthen the spine.
3. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until both are fully straight.
4. Hold briefly, then lower and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you extend opposite arm and leg

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width a few inches forward.
2. Slide down until your thighs are below parallel to the floor.
3. Keep weight in your heels and knees aligned over your toes.
4. Hold the deep position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and knees tracking over toes with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands at your sides.
2. Reach your right arm overhead and bend your torso to the left.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and ribs stacked over hips as you bend to the side

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Squeeze your glutes and lift your chest, arms, and legs off the ground.
3. Keep your neck neutral and hold the lifted position.
4. Lower slowly back to the mat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift chest and legs with control to avoid excessive lumbar arch

Health benefit: Develops lower abdominal strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs straight.
2. Lift both legs toward the ceiling while keeping the lower back pressed down.
3. Lower your legs slowly until just above the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and lower legs slowly with your core engaged

Health benefit: Improves chest and anterior shoulder mobility for better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place forearms on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward to shift weight onto the front leg.
3. Lean your chest forward until you feel a stretch across the chest.
4. Hold the stretch and keep your shoulders down.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder blades down and back while opening the chest to avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal flexion and deep posterior chain relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the mat with big toes touching and knees together.
2. Sit back so your heels press toward your glutes and reach your arms forward.
3. Lower your torso toward your thighs and rest your forehead on the mat.
Safety cue: Sink hips toward heels with a long spine and breathe steadily into the back

Health benefit: Develops upper trapezius strength and improves shoulder elevation capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold heavy dumbbells at your sides.
2. Keep your arms straight and brace your core.
3. Shrug both shoulders up toward your ears as high as possible.
4. Lower your shoulders under control between reps.
Safety cue: Shrug straight up and down with controlled tempo while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle push off power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width on a flat surface or step edge.
2. Raise your heels as high as possible onto the balls of your feet.
3. Pause at the top, then lower your heels slowly below the level of the step or to the floor.
Safety cue: Push up through the balls of your feet with control and keep knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular effort while boosting lower body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Set the treadmill to a moderate incline and stand tall.
2. Step onto the belt and start walking at a brisk, steady pace.
3. Pump your arms and keep an upright posture.
4. Maintain consistent steps and breathing for the duration.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture, lean from the ankles into the incline and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thighs and improves hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hips and toes turned out.
2. Lower hips straight down by bending knees and keeping chest upright.
3. Pause when thighs are parallel to the floor or at a comfortable depth.
4. Push through heels to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes with core braced

Health benefit: Builds core stability and lateral trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and forearm directly under your shoulder.
2. Lift hips until body from shoulders to knees forms a straight line.
3. Hold core tight and keep hips elevated.
4. Lower hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Stack the shoulder over the elbow and keep hips lifted with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic spine rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms extended out to the sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and slowly reach your right hand toward your left foot while keeping your back flat.
3. Return to standing and repeat on the other side.
4. Move slowly and keep arms wide.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and move the windmill slowly with control

Health benefit: Increases groin flexibility and hip external rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped to the sides.
2. Reach forward and hold your feet or ankles.
3. Press your elbows into your knees to increase the stretch.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops full body isometric strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hands under shoulders.
2. Straighten your body so it forms a line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your core and hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels with shoulders over wrists and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and calf flexibility while promoting shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips up and back into an inverted V shape.
3. Press heels toward the floor and lengthen the spine.
4. Keep shoulders down and away from your ears.
Safety cue: Push hips back and up, lengthen the spine and press through the heels with control

Health benefit: Challenges rotational core strength and oblique endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lean back slightly and clasp your hands in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, then to the left with control.
4. Keep your feet grounded throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Rotate through the torso with chest lifted and core engaged, avoiding momentum from the arms

Health benefit: Enhances hip joint mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Shift weight to one leg and rotate your hips in a smooth circular motion.
3. Reverse the direction after several rotations.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and perform slow controlled hip circles without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Warms shoulders and improves scapular movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms extended out at shoulder height.
2. Make small controlled circles forward for the desired count.
3. Reverse the direction and circle backward with the same control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and engage the shoulder blades while moving the arms with control

Health benefit: Stretches the posterior chain and promotes spinal flexion awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended straight and feet flexed.
2. Inhale and lengthen your spine.
3. Exhale and hinge from the hips to reach toward your feet.
4. Keep your spine long and hold the fold.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step one foot back and lower into a lunge until both knees bend.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat on the other leg with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and front knee tracking over the ankle

Health benefit: Develops full body coordination and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift knees a few inches off the ground.
2. Step one hand and the opposite foot forward slowly.
3. Continue alternating hands and feet while keeping hips low.
4. Move slowly and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and avoid sagging or rounding the spine

Health benefit: Promotes light cardiovascular activity and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin walking forward at a comfortable pace.
2. Swing your arms forward and back in a natural motion.
3. Keep shoulders relaxed and maintain steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and swing from the shoulders with steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips for balance.
2. Lift one leg straight out to the side with a controlled motion.
3. Lower the leg slowly and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly at the hips and keep hips level

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower body power and jump performance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and lower into a squat.
2. Drive through your heels and explode upward into a jump.
3. Land softly with knees bent to absorb impact.
4. Immediately lower back into the squat for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and absorb impact through the hips

Health benefit: Boosts core endurance and elevates heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward your chest while keeping hips level.
3. Quickly switch legs by driving the other knee forward.
4. Maintain a steady pace and keep core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep hips low and core engaged, moving legs with control

Health benefit: Increases overall functional fitness with reduced joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall then step back one foot at a time into a plank.
2. Perform a chest-touch pushup or a knee pushup as needed.
3. Step both feet back to bring them toward your hands.
4. Stand up and reach your arms overhead to finish.
Safety cue: Step back instead of jumping and maintain a braced core during transitions

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a slight squat with feet hip-width apart.
2. Jump laterally to the right landing on your right foot.
3. Swing your left foot behind and touch the floor lightly with your left hand.
4. Repeat the lateral jump to the left with a controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Combines core stabilization with light cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet together.
2. Jump both feet out wide and then back together like a horizontal jumping jack.
3. Keep hips steady and core tight throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and move legs without letting hips drop

Health benefit: Targets shoulder strength and improves vertical pressing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward the floor.
3. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the pike position.
4. Maintain a straight back and control throughout each rep.
Safety cue: Keep hips high and neck neutral while lowering with control

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body straight.
2. Lower chest toward the floor while bringing right knee to right elbow.
3. Push back up and return the right leg to plank.
4. Repeat the move on the left side, alternating each rep.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral as you bring your knee toward your elbow

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and activates core stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips.
2. Walk hands forward into a full plank while keeping legs as straight as possible.
3. Pause, then walk feet toward hands in small steps until legs are straight.
4. Repeat by walking hands out again for the next rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal and hip flexor muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift torso and legs simultaneously to form a V and reach hands toward toes.
3. Lower back down with control while keeping arms and legs extended.
4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops deep core engagement and spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and press your lower back into the floor.
2. Lift shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground with arms reaching forward.
3. Squeeze your core and tilt your pelvis to maintain a hollow shape.
4. Hold the position for the target time while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench and place the top of your back foot on the bench.
2. Lower your hips by bending the front knee until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
4. Switch legs and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the toes and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves lateral mobility and hip adductor flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and point your feet forward.
2. Shift hips back and bend the loaded knee while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Push through the bent leg to return to center.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite side with control.
Safety cue: Sit back into the working hip with a tall chest and control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances oblique strength and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and stack your feet with the forearm under the shoulder.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels while keeping feet stacked.
3. Hold the side plank while keeping your core engaged and breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders and brace the obliques to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes shoulder extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Press into your hands and heels to lift hips until the body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the elevated position while keeping shoulders down and core engaged.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal strength and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with arms fully extended and legs straight.
2. Brace your core and lift your knees toward your chest with control.
3. Lower your legs back to a full hang without swinging.
4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Safety cue: Control the swing, exhale as you lift your knees, and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Promotes grip strength and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the pull-up bar about shoulder-width and step or jump to a full hang.
2. Keep your shoulders down and back while breathing steadily.
3. Hold the dead hang for the target time while keeping legs relaxed.
Safety cue: Engage the shoulder blades down and back while breathing steadily during the hang

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and improves hip extension power
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep your back flat and core engaged.
3. Drive one heel up and back toward the ceiling, leading with the sole.
4. Lower with control to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core braced as you drive the heel up

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower body power and improves full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a low squat with hands on the floor between your feet.
2. Kick your feet back into a plank, keeping your body straight.
3. Jump your feet forward to your hands and land in the squat.
4. Explosively jump up and return to the squat for the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest up

Health benefit: Enhances single leg strength and adds rotational core mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a long step forward into a deep lunge.
2. Lower until both knees form about 90-degree angles.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping hips square.
4. Step through to standing and repeat on the other leg as you walk.
Safety cue: Step with a long stride, keep front knee over ankle and rotate from the torso

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and functional stepping power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box or bench at a high, safe height.
2. Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through the heel.
3. Bring the trailing foot fully onto the box and stand tall.
4. Step down with control and repeat leading with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Push through the whole foot, keep spine tall and avoid collapsing the knee

Health benefit: Increases anaerobic power and high intensity cardiovascular capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, then explode forward into a full-intensity run.
2. Pump your arms and drive your knees up while leaning slightly forward.
3. Maintain maximum speed for the chosen distance or time.
4. Decelerate gradually and come to a controlled stop.
Safety cue: Lean slightly from the ankles, drive knees and maintain relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring activation and improves running cadence
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin jogging in place or forward.
2. Kick your heels up toward your glutes with quick, alternating legs.
3. Keep a quick cadence and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral, land under your hips and drive heels toward the glutes

Health benefit: Boosts hip flexor power and elevates cardiovascular tempo
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin jogging in place or forward.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest to hip height, then alternate quickly.
3. Pump your arms rapidly and maintain a fast, rhythmic pace.
Safety cue: Lift knees to hip height with upright posture and quick relaxed arms

Health benefit: Improves dynamic balance and quick transition strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start prone with hands beneath shoulders like a push-up position.
2. Push up explosively and swing one foot forward under your hips.
3. Bring the other foot beside it and land in a low surfer stance.
4. Square your shoulders and continue by shifting weight or repeating.
Safety cue: Explode up with a stable core, land softly and keep shoulders stacked over hips

Health benefit: Enhances lower body power and lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and drop into a shallow squat.
2. Jump your feet wide while keeping chest up and hips back.
3. Jump your feet back together into the squat and repeat rhythmically.
Safety cue: Sit back into your hips, keep chest lifted and move with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain while enhancing shoulder stability and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and hands behind hips, fingers pointing away.
2. Lift your hips off the ground into a reverse tabletop.
3. Walk forward using your hands and feet while keeping hips lifted.
4. Reverse direction or lower hips to the ground to finish.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted, reach through the shoulders and move deliberately without sagging

Health benefit: Improves single-leg posterior chain strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the knee slightly bent and the other leg extended behind you.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while reaching the hands toward the floor.
3. Drive the standing heel into the floor and pull your torso back up to standing.
4. Keep the extended leg aligned with your torso throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and controlled descent

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and anti-rotational shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one hand and tap the opposite shoulder with the free hand.
3. Alternate taps quickly while keeping hips as still as possible.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level to minimize rotation during taps

Health benefit: Builds lower body endurance and improves hip and knee control
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a deep lunge with the front knee over the ankle.
2. Pulse up and down a few inches while maintaining the lunge depth.
3. Push through the front heel and return to standing, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep your torso upright and control small pulses from the hips

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands under your hips and legs extended.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Flutter your legs up and down in a quick alternating motion.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Develops lateral power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a small lateral hop on one foot with the opposite foot hovering.
2. Leap sideways to land on the opposite foot while swinging the arms for momentum.
3. Absorb the landing softly and immediately explode back to the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly on the midfoot with knees bent and absorb impact through the hips

Health benefit: Increases abdominal endurance and rotational core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees pulled in.
2. Extend one leg while bringing the opposite elbow toward the bent knee in a crunching twist.
3. Switch sides quickly and continuously, keeping the pace fast.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves upper body mobility and full-body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a downward dog position with hips raised and hands shoulder-width.
2. Sweep your chest down and forward, lowering your torso in a scooping arc.
3. Rise into an upward-facing position with hips low and chest open.
4. Push back into the starting downward dog to repeat the cycle.
Safety cue: Lead the movement with the chest while maintaining a neutral spine and neck

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and extend the other leg straight in front of you.
2. Lower your hips back and down into a single-leg squat until the hip drops below parallel.
3. Press through the heel of the standing leg to return to standing.
4. Keep your chest up and the extended leg straight throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Sit back into the standing hip with weight in the heel and control the descent

Health benefit: Challenges maximal core strength and trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a bench or floor and grip a stable anchor behind your head.
2. Raise your legs and hips until your body is nearly vertical and straight.
3. Slowly lower your body down in a controlled motion while keeping it rigid.
4. Stop just before your shoulders touch and pull back to the vertical position.
Safety cue: Brace the core and lower the body slowly while keeping the spine rigid

Health benefit: Develops overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability while improving balance
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall and kick up into a handstand with feet supported against the wall.
2. Bend the elbows and lower your head toward the ground in a controlled descent.
3. Push through the hands to extend the elbows and return to the handstand.
4. Keep the core tight and the body in a straight line throughout each rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances full body conditioning and cardiovascular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and brace your core.
2. Drop into a squat, place hands on the floor, and kick feet back into a plank.
3. Lower chest to the floor, push up to plank, and jump feet toward hands.
4. Explode upward into a vertical jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Land softly and keep core braced through the burpee transition

Health benefit: Increases explosive lower body power and vertical jump performance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and slightly bend knees.
2. Swing arms and jump up driving knees to chest.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet and reset.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and keep chest up on each tuck jump

Health benefit: Improves explosive leg power and reactive strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the box with feet hip-width and bend knees.
2. Swing arms and explode upward to jump onto the box.
3. Land gently on the box with soft knees and hips back.
4. Step down carefully and prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Approach the box with controlled drive and land softly with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Develops upper body pulling and pushing strength and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Grip the bar with a strong overhand or false grip and hang tall.
2. Generate momentum with a controlled kip and pull explosively to chest height.
3. Transition by rolling your chest over the bar and pressing down.
4. Lock out at the top, then lower back to the hang with control.
Safety cue: Keep core tight and lead with your chest to clear the bar on the muscle-up

Health benefit: Increases back and arm strength and grip endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Hang from the bar with full arm extension and shoulder blades engaged.
2. Pull elbows down and back to raise your chin above the bar.
3. Lower slowly until arms are fully extended and return to the dead hang.
Safety cue: Engage your scapulae from the dead hang and pull without swinging

Health benefit: Enhances reactive strength and plyometric efficiency for faster force production
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on a stable box and step off the edge with control.
2. Land softly on both feet with knees bent and hips back.
3. Immediately explode upward into a vertical jump and land softly.
Safety cue: Step off controlled and absorb the impact by flexing hips and knees

Health benefit: Boosts horizontal power and explosive hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hinge into a deep squat.
2. Swing arms and explode forward driving hips and knees into a long jump.
3. Land with both feet together, absorb with bent hips and knees, and stabilize.
Safety cue: Drive explosively through the hips and land with soft knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and lower body explosive strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a quarter-squat with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Explode upward and rotate your body 180 degrees in the air.
3. Land softly in a squat facing the opposite direction with knees bent.
Safety cue: Drive through the hips, rotate under control, and land softly with knees aligned

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral strength balance and functional stability under fatigue
Steps to perform:
1. Balance on one leg and place hands on the floor while keeping the other leg off the ground.
2. Kick the free leg back into a single-leg plank, then lower your chest to the floor.
3. Push up to return to the single-leg plank, then jump your foot forward toward your hands.
4. Explode up into a single-leg hop and land softly on the same leg.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and control the descent and push-up on the single leg

Health benefit: Increases lateral power agility and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat and push off one foot to leap laterally.
2. Land on the opposite foot with knee bent and reach the trailing foot behind you.
3. Immediately push off that foot and leap to the other side, maximizing lateral distance.
Safety cue: Push laterally and absorb each landing with a soft, bent knee and upright chest

Health benefit: Develops lower body power and unilateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge with your right foot forward and your left knee near the floor.
2. Jump straight up and switch legs in mid-air so your left foot moves forward.
3. Land softly into a deep lunge with the opposite leg forward.
4. Immediately push into the next jump and repeat the switch.
Safety cue: Land softly with a slight knee bend and drive through the front heel

Health benefit: Enhances core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and hands beside your hips.
2. Press through your hands and lift your hips so your legs form an L shape.
3. Keep shoulders down and hold your legs straight and parallel to the floor.
4. Maintain a tight core and breathe evenly while holding the position.
Safety cue: Press through the palms, keep shoulders down and core tight to hold a flat back

Health benefit: Improves core stability and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms overhead and legs extended.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the floor into a hollow shape.
3. Rock forward toward your feet and back toward your shoulders while keeping the hollow shape.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases rotational core power and oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet off the floor while holding your hands together.
2. Twist your torso explosively to one side and touch the hands to the floor beside your hip.
3. Explode the twist to the opposite side and touch the floor there.
4. Continue alternating rapidly while keeping your feet elevated.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower limb power and ankle reactivity
Steps to perform:
1. Start kneeling on both knees with an upright torso.
2. Swing your arms and explosively jump up to land on the balls of your feet.
3. Absorb the landing with soft knees.
4. Lower back down to your knees under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and vertical body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with your feet against a wall.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while walking your hands toward the wall.
3. Continue until your body reaches a vertical or near-vertical position.
4. Walk your hands away from the wall and lower your feet back down to the plank.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and balance while improving proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Kick up into a freestanding handstand with a tight body line.
2. Press through your shoulders and balance on your fingertips.
3. Reach one hand forward then the other to take small hand steps.
4. Continue alternating hand steps to walk while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor power and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and one foot slightly forward.
2. Step into a forward lunge and drive off the front foot into a jump.
3. Switch legs mid-air so the opposite foot lands forward.
4. Land softly and immediately repeat the explosive scissor motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral explosiveness and single leg stability for agility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with knees soft and hips back.
2. Push off the outside leg and bound laterally as far as you can.
3. Land on the opposite leg in a soft knee bend.
4. Immediately explode back to the other side and continue bounding.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and controlled standing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Start standing with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drop to your knees and sit back toward your heels.
3. Lower yourself back onto the floor and lie flat across your chest.
4. Use your hands and feet to drive back up to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lower-body muscular endurance and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands clasped in front of chest.
2. Bend knees and drive hips back while lowering into a deep squat.
3. Explode upward by extending hips and knees and straighten legs.
4. Continue the smooth, rhythmic squat-and-rise motion without pausing.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and knees tracking toes during controlled descent

Health benefit: Develops explosive lower-body power and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Hop forward explosively on the balls of both feet for the first bounding hop.
3. Land softly, immediately step into the second hop and then explode into the third jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees slightly bent to absorb impact

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and reactive leg power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside the box with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Bend into a quarter squat and swing arms toward the box to load force.
3. Explode laterally over the box and land on both feet with soft knees.
4. Reset your stance and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Explode laterally and land softly with knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and lateral trunk power
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself up on one forearm with feet stacked.
2. Press hips up into a side plank and hold a strong straight line.
3. Lower hips slightly then explode back to the plank using oblique power.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while controlling the explosive movement

Health benefit: Increases single-leg strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Reach the opposite leg back and lower hips toward the ground into a deep single-leg squat.
3. Push through the front foot to return to standing while keeping balance.
4. Repeat for reps then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and control descent with the front knee tracking toes

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder stability and balance under load
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a lunge facing away from a wall or open space.
2. Place hands shoulder-width on the ground and kick the rear leg up toward vertical.
3. Use the front leg to drive the kick and find balance briefly at the top.
4. Control the descent back to the starting lunge.
Safety cue: Kick up with a controlled drive and stack shoulders over wrists

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and airborne body control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Drop into a quick squat and rotate your torso while exploding upward into a turn.
3. Complete a full 360-degree rotation in the air and land softly with bent knees.
Safety cue: Spot the landing, control your rotation, and absorb impact with bent knees

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and coordinated torso control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes slightly turned out.
2. Extend one leg out to the side and shift weight to the opposite leg.
3. Bend the weighted knee deeply while keeping the extended leg straight and torso upright.
4. Drive through the bent leg to return to the starting wide stance.
Safety cue: Keep weight through the working heel and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Enhances sprint mechanics and single-leg explosive capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a standing sprint stance with one foot forward.
2. Drive forcefully off the planted foot and sprint on the same leg for short bursts.
3. Pump the arms and maintain high knee drive on each stride.
Safety cue: Lean slightly forward from the hips and drive the knee without letting it collapse inward

Health benefit: Develops full-body mobility strength and movement sequencing
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one arm extended overhead and the opposite knee bent.
2. Press the weighted arm and heel into the ground to push hips into a high bridge and rise onto the forearm then hand.
3. Sweep the straight leg back to place the foot beneath you and rise to a kneeling position.
4. Stand up tall, then reverse the steps slowly to return to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder packed and move through each transition with controlled breathing
